1.verse: Blessed is the ish that walketh not in the Etzah (counsel, scheme) of the Resha’im, nor standeth in the Derech Chatta’im, nor sitteth in the Moshav (seat) of the Leitzim (scornful, ones mocking and reviling).

2.verse: But his delight is in the Torat Hashem; and in His torah doth he meditate yomam v’lailah.

3.verse: And he shall be like an etz planted by the streams of mayim, that bringeth forth its p’ri in its season; the leaf thereof also shall not wither; and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper.

4.verse: The Resha’im are not so, but are like the chaff which the ruach driveth away.

5.verse: Therefore the Resha’im shall not stand in the Mishpat, nor Chatta’im (sinners) in the Adat Tzaddikim.

6.verse: For Hashem knoweth the Derech Tzaddikim, but the Derech Resha’im shall perish. T.N. The next Psalm says that the whole world, all the earth, is, or will be, the possession of Moshiach, and that Hashem assures Moshiach of this; therefore, the Great Commission (Mt 28:19-20) was given to preach Moshiach to the ends of the earth that the whole world may hear.

1.verse: Why do the Goyim rage, and the Amim (peoples) imagine a vain thing?

2.verse: The Malchei Eretz rise up in rebellion, and the rulers take counsel together against Hashem and against His Moshiach, saying,

3.verse: Let us break their chains asunder, and cast away their fetters from us.

4.verse: He that sitteth enthroned in Shomayim laughs; Adonoi hath them in derision.

5.verse: Then shall He speak unto them in His wrath, and distress them in His hot displeasure.

6.verse: I have set Malki (My King) upon Tziyon, My Har Kodesh.

7.verse: I will declare the chok (decree): Hashem hath said unto me, Thou art Beni (My Son, i.e. Ben HaElohim Moshiach); HaYom (today) I have begotten thee.

8.verse: Ask of Me, and I shall give thee the Goyim for thine nachalah, and the uttermost parts of ha’aretz for thy possession.

9.verse: Thou shalt rule them with a shevet barzel; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.

10.verse: Have seichel now therefore, O ye Melachim; be warned, ye Shoftei Aretz.

11.verse: Serve Hashem with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

12.verse: Kiss the Bar (Ben, Son, [see Hebrew Mishlei 31:2; Ben HaElohim Moshiach; see 2:2,7, above]), lest he be angry, and ye perish from the Derech, for his wrath can flare up in a moment. Ashrei are all they that take refuge in him [Moshiach].

1.verse: (A psalm of Dovid, when he fled from Avshalom bno) Hashem, how are they increased that are my foes! Many are they that rise up against me.

2.verse: Many there be which say of my nefesh, There is no yeshuah for him in Elohim. Selah.

3.verse: But Thou, Hashem, art a mogen around me; my kavod, and the One who lifts up mine head.

4.verse: I cried unto Hashem with my voice, and He heard me out of His Har Kodesh. Selah.

5.verse: I laid me down and slept; I awaked, for Hashem sustains me.

6.verse: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of am (people), that have set themselves against me round about.

7.verse: Arise, Hashem; hoshieini (save me), O Elohai; for Thou hast struck all mine enemies upon the cheekbone; Thou hast broken the teeth of the resha’im.

8.verse: HaYeshuah (salvation) belongeth unto Hashem; the Birkhat (blessing) of Thee is upon Thy people. Selah.

1.verse: (For the one directing. With stringed instruments. Mizmor Dovid.) Hear me when I call, Elohei tzidki (O G-d of my righteousness); Thou hast relieved me when I was in distress; channeini, and hear my tefillah.

2.verse: O ye Bnei Ish, how long will ye turn my kavod into shame? How long will ye love delusion, and seek kazav (lie, falsehood)? Selah.

3.verse: But know that Hashem hath set apart the chasid for Himself; Hashem will hear when I call unto Him.

4.verse: Be angry, yet sin not; commune with your own levav upon your mishkav, and be still. Selah.

5.verse: Offer the zivkhei-tzedek, and put your trust in Hashem.

6.verse: There be many that say, Who will show us any tov? Hashem, lift Thou up the ohr of Thy countenance upon us.

7.verse: Thou hast put simcha in my lev, more than in the time that their dagan and their tirosh increased.

8.verse: In shalom I will both lay me down, and sleep, for Thou alone, Hashem, makest me dwell in safety.

1.verse: (For the one directing. For the flutes. Mizmor Dovid) Give ear to my words, Hashem, consider my meditation.

2.verse: Pay heed unto the voice of my cry, Malki v’Elohai; for unto Thee will I daven.

3.verse: My voice shalt Thou hear in the boker, Hashem; in the boker will I bring my prayer before Thee as a spiritual sacrifice and wait for an answer.

4.verse: For Thou art not El that hath pleasure in resha; neither shall rah dwell with Thee.

5.verse: The holelim (arrogant) shall not stand in Thy sight; Thou hatest all workers of iniquity.

6.verse: Thou shalt destroy them that speak kazav (falsehood); Hashem will abhor the ish damim u’mirmah (bloody and deceitful man).

7.verse: But as for me, I will come into Thy Bais in the multitude of Thy chesed; and in Thy fear will I bow down toward Thy Heikhal Kodesh.

8.verse: Lead me, Hashem, in Thy tzedakah because of mine enemies; make Thy Derech straight before my face.

9.verse: For there is nothing trustworthy in their mouth; their inwardness is a corruptible abyss; their throat is an open kever; they speak smooth deceit with their leshon.

10.verse: Punish them, Elohim; let them fall by their own intrigues; in the multitude of their peysha’im cast them out; for they have rebelled against Thee.

11.verse: But let all those that take refuge in Thee rejoice; let them shout for joy l’olam, and spread Thou protection over them that they be joyful in Thee, who love Shemecha (Thy Name).

12.verse: For Thou, Hashem, wilt bless the Tzaddik; with ratzon (favor) wilt Thou encompass him as with a tzinnah (large rectangular shield).

1.verse: (For the one directing. With stringed instruments. Al HaSheminit. Mizmor Dovid) Hashem, rebuke me not in Thine anger, neither chasten me in Thy hot displeasure.

2.verse: Have mercy upon me, Hashem; for I am weak: Hashem, heal me; for my atzmot are shaking.

3.verse: My nefesh is also much shaken; but Thou, Hashem, ad mosai (how much longer)?

4.verse: Turn, Hashem, deliver my nefesh; hoshieini (save me) for the sake of Thy chesed.

5.verse: For in mavet there is no remembrance of Thee; in Sheol who shall give Thee thanks?

6.verse: I am weary with my groaning; all the lailah flood I my mittah with weeping; I water my couch with my tears.

7.verse: Mine eye is consumed because of ka’as (grief); it groweth old because of all mine enemies.

8.verse: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for Hashem hath heard the voice of my weeping.

9.verse: Hashem hath heard my techinnah (supplication); Hashem will receive my tefillah (prayer).

10.verse: Let all mine oyevim be ashamed and much troubled; let them turn back and suddenly be ashamed.

1.verse: (Shiggayon of Dovid, which he sang unto Hashem, regarding Kush of Binyamin) Hashem Elohai, in Thee do I seek refuge; hoshieini (save me) from all them that persecute me, and deliver me;

2.verse: Lest he tear my nefesh like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to rescue.

3.verse: Hashem Elohai, if I have done this; if there be guilt in my hands;

4.verse: If I have recompensed with evil him that held out shalom unto me; or, without cause plundered my opposers,

5.verse: Then let the enemy persecute my nefesh, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life to the earth, and lay mine kavod to sleep in the dust. Selah.

6.verse: Arise, Hashem, in Thine anger, lift up Thyself because of the rage of mine enemies; awake, o my El, to the mishpat Thou hast decreed.

7.verse: So let the Adat l’Umim surround Thee; and over it return Thou on high [to judge].

8.verse: Hashem shall judge the people; judge me, Hashem, according to my tzedek, and according to mine integrity that is in me.

9.verse: Oh let the wickedness of the resha’im come to an end; but make the tzaddik secure; for the Elohim Tzaddik trieth the minds and hearts.

10.verse: My mogen (shield) is Elohim, Moshi’a of the upright in heart.

11.verse: Elohim is a Shofet Tzaddik, and El expresses wrath kol yom.

12.verse: If He relent not, He will sharpen His cherev; He hath bent His keshet (bow) and made it ready.

13.verse: He hath also prepared for Him the instruments of mavet; He ordaineth His flaming khitzim (arrows).

14.verse: Hinei, he [an evil person] travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived trouble, and brought forth falsehood.

15.verse: He makes a pit, and digs it, and is fallen into the shachat (pit) which he made.

16.verse: His trouble shall return upon his own rosh, and his chamas shall come down upon his own kodkod (crown of the head).

17.verse: I will give thanks to Hashem according to His tzedek; and will sing praise to the Shem of Hashem Elyon.

1.verse: (For the one directing. According to the gittit. Mizmor of Dovid). Hashem Adoneinu, how excellent is Shimecha in kol ha’aretz Who hast set Thy glory above HaShomayim.

2.verse: Out of the mouth of olelim and infants hast Thou established strength because of Thine enemies, that Thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.

3.verse: When I consider Thy heavens, the ma’asim of Thy fingers, the yarei’ach and the kokhavim, which Thou hast ordained;

4.verse: What is enosh (mankind), that Thou art mindful of him? And the ben adam, that Thou visitest him?

5.verse: For Thou hast made him a little lower than elohim [or Elohim, Gn 1:27], and hast crowned him with kavod and hadar.

6.verse: Thou madest him to have dominion over the ma’asim of Thy hands; Thou hast put all things under his feet:

7.verse: All sheep and oxen, yea, and the behemot sadeh;

8.verse: The fowl of the air, and the dag (fish) of the yam, and whatsoever passeth through the paths of the seas.

9.verse: Hashem Adoneinu, how excellent is Shimecha in kol ha’aretz!

1.verse: (For the one directing. To The Death of the Son. Mizmor of Dovid) I will give thanks to Thee, Hashem, with kol lev of me; I will show forth all Thy marvellous works.

2.verse: I will be glad and rejoice in Thee; I will sing praise to Thy Shem, O Thou Elyon.

3.verse: When mine oyevim are turned back, they shall fall and perish at Thy presence.

4.verse: For Thou hast maintained my mishpat and my cause; Thou as Shofet Tzedek dost sit on the kisse.

5.verse: Thou hast rebuked the Goyim, Thou hast destroyed the wicked, Thou hast blotted out their shem l’olam va’ed.

6.verse: Choravot lanetzach (endless ruins) have come to the enemy: and Thou hast rooted out cities; their memory is perished with them.

7.verse: But Hashem shall reign l’olam; He hath established His kisse (throne) for mishpat.

8.verse: And He shall judge the tevel (world) in tzedek, He shall govern the nations with justice.

9.verse: Hashem also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a stronghold in times of tzoros.

10.verse: And they that know Shemecha will put their trust in Thee; for Thou, Hashem, hast not forsaken them that seek Thee.

11.verse: Sing praises to Hashem, enthroned in Tziyon; declare among the nations His deeds.

12.verse: When He avenges [shefach] dahm, He remembereth them; He forgetteth not the cry of the aniyim (humble, afflicted, the helpless ones).

13.verse: Have mercy upon me, Hashem; consider my sufferings which I suffer of them that hate me, Thou that liftest me up from the sha’arei mavet (gates of death);

14.verse: That I may show forth all Thy praise in the Sha’arei Bat Tziyon. I will rejoice in Thy Yeshuah (salvation).

15.verse: The Goyim are sunk down in the shachat (pit) that they dug; in the reshet (net) which they hid is their own foot caught.

16.verse: Hashem is known by the mishpat which He executeth; the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgayon. Selah.

17.verse: The resha’im shall be turned into Sheol, and all the Goyim that forget Elohim.

18.verse: For the needy shall not always be forgotten; the tikveh of the poor shall not perish forever.

19.verse: Arise, Hashem; let not enosh (mankind) prevail; let the Goyim be judged in Thy sight.

20.verse: Put them in terror, Hashem; that the Goyim may know themselves to be but enosh. Selah.

1.verse: Why standest Thou afar off, Hashem? Why hidest Thou Thyself in times of tzoros?

2.verse: The reshah in his ga’avah (haughtiness) doth persecute the ani (poor, see Zech 9:9 where ani is Moshiach); let them be caught in the devices that they have schemed.

3.verse: For the reshah boasteth of his ta’avat nefesh (soul’s lust), and blesseth the covetous, whom Hashem abhorreth.

4.verse: The reshah, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after Him; Elohim is not in all his thoughts.

5.verse: His ways are always prosperous; Thy mishpatim are on high, out of his sight; as for all his enemies, he sneers at them.

6.verse: He hath said in his lev, I shall not be shaken; throughout all generations I shall never be in trouble.

7.verse: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud; under his leshon (tongue) is trouble and iniquity.

8.verse: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages; in the places for ambush doth he murder the naki (innocent); his eyes are secretly set against the poor.

9.verse: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den; he lieth in wait to catch the poor; he doth catch the poor when he draweth him into his reshet.

10.verse: He crouches, and stoops, that the poor may fall by his atzum (might).

11.verse: He hath said in his lev, El hath forgotten; He hideth his face; He will never see it.

12.verse: Arise, Hashem; O El, lift up Thine yad; forget not the aniyim.

13.verse: For why doth the reshah renounce Elohim? He hath said in his lev, Thou wilt not call me to account.

14.verse: Thou hast seen it; for Thou beholdest trouble and ka’as (grief), to requite it with Thy yad; the helpless committeth himself unto Thee; Thou art the Ozer (helper) of the yatom (orphan).

15.verse: Break Thou the zero’a of the reshah and the evil man; call to account his wickedness that would not be found out.

16.verse: Hashem is Melech olam va’ed; the Goyim are perished out of His land.

17.verse: Hashem, Thou hast heard the desire of the aniyim; Thou wilt strengthen their lev, Thou wilt cause Thine ear to hear;

18.verse: To judge the yatom (orphan) and the oppressed, that enosh of the earth may no more strike terror.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Of Dovid.) In Hashem do I take refuge; how say ye to my nefesh, Flee as a bird to your mountain?

2.verse: For, hinei, the resha’im bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may secretly shoot at the yishrei lev (upright in heart).

3.verse: If the foundations be destroyed, what can the tzaddik do?

4.verse: Hashem is in His Heikhal Kodesh, Hashem’s kisse is in Shomayim; His eyes examine, His eyelids try, Bnei Adam.

5.verse: Hashem trieth the tzaddik, but the resha’im and him that loveth chamas (violence) His Nefesh hateth.

6.verse: Upon the resha’im He shall rain snares, eish and gofrit, and a burning wind; this shall be the portion of their kos (cup).

7.verse: For Hashem is tzaddik (righteous), Hashem loveth tzedakot; His countenance doth behold the yashar (upright).

1.verse: (For the one directing. According to the Sheminit. Mizmor Dovid) Help, Hashem; for the chasid is no more; for the emunim (faithful ones) vanish from among Bnei Adam.

2.verse: They speak vanity every one with his re’a (neighbor); with flattering lips and with a double heart do they speak.

3.verse: Hashem shall cut off all flattering lips, and the leshon that speaketh gedolot;

4.verse: Who have said, With leshoneinu (our tongue) will we prevail; our lips are our own: who is Adon over us?

5.verse: For the oppression of the aniyim, for the groaning of the needy, now will I arise, saith Hashem; I will set him in safety from him that sneers at him.

6.verse: The words of Hashem are amarot tehorot (pure words); as kesef refined in the furnace on the earth, purified seven times.

7.verse: Thou shalt be shomer over them, Hashem, Thou shalt preserve him [see 5(6)] from this generation forever.

8.verse: The resha’im strut on every side, when the vilest among the Bnei Adam are exalted.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Mizmor Dovid) How long wilt Thou forget me, Hashem? Netzach (forever?) How long wilt Thou hide Thy face from me?

2.verse: How long shall I take counsel in my nefesh, having sorrow in my lev daily? How long shall mine oyev be exalted over me?

3.verse: Consider and hear me, Hashem Elohai; enlighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of mavet;

4.verse: Lest mine oyev say, I have prevailed against him; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am defeated.

5.verse: But I have trusted in Thy chesed; my lev shall rejoice in Thy Yeshuah (salvation).

6.verse: I will sing unto Hashem, because He hath dealt bountifully with me.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Of Dovid) The naval (fool) hath said in his lev, There is no Elohim. They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, ein oseh tov (there is none that doeth good).

2.verse: Hashem looked down from Shomayim upon Bnei Adam, to see if there is any with seichel, that seeketh Elohim.

3.verse: They are all turned aside, they are all together become corrupt; there is none that doeth tov, no, not one.

4.verse: Have all the workers of iniquity no da’as? Who eat up my people as they eat lechem, and call not upon Hashem.

5.verse: There they shall be in great dread, for Elohim is with the dor tzaddik.

6.verse: Would ye confound the etzah (counsel, plan) of the oni (poor), for Hashem is indeed his refuge!

7.verse: Oh that the Yeshuah (salvation) of Yisroel were come out of Tziyon! When Hashem turns misfortune and brings back the captives of His people, Ya’akov shall rejoice, and Yisroel shall be glad.

1.verse: (Mizmor Dovid) Hashem, who shall abide in Thy Ohel? Who shall dwell in Thy Har Kodesh?

2.verse: He that walketh blamelessly, and worketh tzedek, and speaketh emes from his lev.

3.verse: He that backbiteth not with his leshon, nor doeth ra’ah to his re’a, nor taketh up a slur to discredit his neighbor.

4.verse: In whose eyes a vile person is despicable; but he honoreth them that fear Hashem. He that sweareth to his own hurt, and changeth not.

5.verse: He that putteth not out his kesef to neshekh (usury), nor taketh bribes against the naki (innocent). He that doeth these things shall never be shaken.

1.verse: (A mikhtam Dovid). Be shomer over me, O El: for in Thee do I hide myself.

2.verse: I said unto Hashem, Thou art Adonoi of me; besides Thee I have no good;

3.verse: But to the Kedoshim that are in ha’aretz, they are the glorious ones, in whom is all my delight.

4.verse: Their sorrows shall be multiplied that hasten after other g-ds; their nesakhim (drink offerings) of dahm will I not offer, nor take up their shmot (names [of idols]) on my lips.

5.verse: Hashem is the chelek (allotted share) of mine inheritance and of my kos (cup [of blessing]); Thou maintainest my goral (lot, allotment by the divine will).

6.verse: The boundary lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places; yea, I have a goodly nachalah (inheritance).

7.verse: I will bless Hashem, Who hath given me counsel; my mind also instructs me in the night seasons.

8.verse: I have set Hashem always before me; because He is at my right hand, I shall not be shaken.

9.verse: Therefore my lev is glad, and my kavod rejoiceth; my basar also shall dwell securely [see 1Th 5:23 OJBC].

10.verse: For Thou wilt not abandon my nefesh in Sheol; neither wilt Thou allow Thine Chasid to see shachat (corruption, the pit, the grave, the abyss of corruption; see Ac 2:24).

11.verse: Thou wilt show me the Orach Chayyim (the path of life); in Thy presence is fulness of joy, at Thy right hand there are pleasures netzach (for evermore).

1.verse: (Tefillah of Dovid) Hear the tzedek (righteous plea of a just cause), Hashem, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my tefillah, that goeth not out of lips of mirmah (deceit).

2.verse: Let my mishpat (right) come forth from Thy presence; let Thine eyes behold the things that are right.

3.verse: Thou hast probed mine lev; Thou hast visited me in the lailah; Thou hast tested me and shalt find nothing; I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.

4.verse: Concerning the works of men, by the Devar of Thy lips I have kept myself from the paths of the cruel.

5.verse: Uphold my goings in Thy paths, that my footsteps stumble not.

6.verse: I have called upon Thee, for Thou wilt hear me, O El; incline Thine ear unto me, and hear my prayer.

7.verse: Show Thy marvellous chesed, O Thou Moshi’a Who saves by Thy right hand them which put their trust in Thee from those that rise up against them.

8.verse: Be shomer over me as the apple of Thy eye; hide me in the shadow of Thy wings,

9.verse: From the resha’im that oppress me, from my deadly enemies threatening my nefesh, who surround me.

10.verse: They have closed up callously and mercilessly against me; with their mouth they speak with ge’ut (pride).

11.verse: At every step they have surrounded me; their purpose is to strike down to ha’aretz;

12.verse: Like aryeh eager to tear his prey, and like a young lion lurking in ambush.

13.verse: Arise, Hashem, confront him, cast him down; deliver my nefesh from the resha with Thy cherev;

14.verse: From men with Thy yad, Hashem, from men of the world, whose portion is in this life, and with Thy treasures Thou fillest their belly; they are satisfied with children, and leave their abundance to their babes.

15.verse: As for me, in tzedek I will behold Thy face; I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with Thy temunah (form; see Num 12:8).

1.verse: (For the one directing. Of Dovid Eved Hashem who sang to Hashem the lyrics of this shirah on the day Hashem delivered him from the hand of all his oyevim and from the hand of Sha’ul; and he said) I will love Thee, Hashem, my strength.

2.verse: Hashem is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; Eli my Tzur (rock), in whom I take refuge; my mogen, and the keren of my salvation, and my misgav (high place as a refuge).

3.verse: I will call upon Hashem, Who is worthy to be praised; so shall I be saved from mine oyevim.

4.verse: The chevlei mavet entangled me, and the floods of Beliya’al terrorized me.

5.verse: The chevlei Sheol snaked around me; the snares of mavet confronted me.

6.verse: In my distress I called upon Hashem, and cried unto Elohai; He heard my voice out of His Heikhal, and my cry came before Him, even into His ears.

7.verse: Ha’aretz shook and trembled; the foundations also of the mountains quaked and were shaken, because He was angry.

8.verse: Smoke went up from His nostrils, and eish out of His mouth devoured; coals were kindled by it.

9.verse: He parted Shomayim, and descended, and dark clouds were under His feet.

10.verse: And He rode upon a keruv (cherub), and did fly; yea, He soared upon the wings of the ruach.

11.verse: He made choshech His secret place; His sukkah round about Him was dark waters and thick clouds of the skies.

12.verse: Out of the brightness that was before Him there broke through barad (hailstones) and coals of eish out of His clouds.

13.verse: Hashem also thundered in Shomayim, and Elyon gave His voice amid barad and coals of eish.

14.verse: Yea, He sent out His khitzim (arrows), and scattered them; and He shot out great lightning bolts, and did put them to rout.

15.verse: Then the channels of waters were exposed, and the foundations of the tevel (world) were laid bare at Thy rebuke, Hashem, at the blast of the ruach of Thy nostrils.

16.verse: He sent from on high, He took hold of me, He drew me out of mayim rabbim (many waters).

17.verse: He delivered me from my strong oyev, and from them which hated me; for they were too strong for me.

18.verse: They confronted me in the day of my calamity; but Hashem was my stay.

19.verse: He brought me forth also into a place merkhav (spacious); He delivered me, because He delighted in me.

20.verse: Hashem dealt with me according to my tzedek; according to the cleanness of my hands hath He recompensed me.

21.verse: For I have been shomer regarding the Darkhei Hashem, and have not wickedly departed from Elohai.

22.verse: For all His mishpatim were before me, and I did not put away His chukkot from me.

23.verse: I was also tamim (blameless) before Him, and I kept myself from mine avon.

24.verse: Therefore hath Hashem recompensed me according to my tzedek, according to the cleanness of my hands before His eyes.

25.verse: With the chasid Thou wilt show Thyself chesed; with a perfect man Thou wilt show Thyself perfect;

26.verse: With the pure Thou wilt show Thyself pure; and with the ikesh (crooked, perverted, false) Thou wilt show Thyself shrewd.

27.verse: For Thou wilt save the ani (poor); but wilt bring down low haughty looks.

28.verse: For Thou wilt light my ner; Hashem Elohai will enlighten my choshech.

29.verse: For by Thee have I scattered a troop; and by Elohai have I leaped over a wall.

30.verse: As for El, His derech is tamim (perfect); the word of Hashem is tzerufah (tested and proved flawless, inerrant); He is a mogen to all those that take refuge in Him.

31.verse: For who is Elohim besides Hashem? Or who is Tzur but Eloheinu?

32.verse: It is El that armeth me with chayil, and maketh my derech tamim (perfect).

33.verse: He maketh my raglayim like deer feet, and setteth me upon my high places.

34.verse: He traineth my hands for milchamah, so that a keshet-nechushah mine arms can bend.

35.verse: Thou hast also given me the mogen of Thy salvation; and Thy right hand hath held me up, and Thy lowliness hath made me great.

36.verse: Thou hast made rakhav (broad) the place for my footsteps under me, that my ankles did not turn.

37.verse: I have pursued mine oyevim, and overtaken them; neither did I turn back till they were consumed.

38.verse: I have crushed them that they were not able to rise; they are fallen under my raglayim.

39.verse: For Thou hast armed me with chayil unto the milchamah; Thou hast made bow down under me those that rose up against me.

40.verse: Thou hast also given me the necks of mine oyevim; that I might destroy them that hate me.

41.verse: They cried for help, but there was no Moshi’a to save them, even unto Hashem, but He answered them not.

42.verse: Then did I beat them small as the dust before the ruach; I did empty them out as the dirt in the chutzot (streets).

43.verse: Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people; and Thou hast made me the Rosh (head) of the Goyim (nations); an Am (people) whom I have not known shall serve me.

44.verse: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me; the Bnei Nekhar (foreigners) shall submit themselves unto me.

45.verse: The Bnei Nekhar shall fade away, and come forth trembling out of their misgerot (stongholds, fastnesses, secure places).

46.verse: Hashem chai; and baruch be my Tzur; and let the Elohei of my salvation be exalted.

47.verse: It is El that avengeth me, and subdueth the nations under me.

48.verse: He saveth me from mine oyevim; yea, Thou liftest me up above those that rise up against me; Thou hast delivered me from the ish chamas.

49.verse: Therefore will I give thanks unto Thee, Hashem, among the Goyim, and sing praises unto Shimecha.

50.verse: Great deliverance giveth He to His Melech; and showeth chesed to His Moshiach, to Dovid, and to his Zera ad olam.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Mizmor Dovid) HaShomayim declare the kavod of G-d; and the raki’a (firmament) showeth His handiwork.

2.verse: Yom unto yom uttereth speech, and lailah unto lailah showeth da’as.

3.verse: There is no speech nor devarim (language), where their voice is not heard.

4.verse: Their measuring line is gone out through kol ha’aretz, and their words to the end of the tevel (world). In them hath He set an ohel for the shemesh,

5.verse: Which is like a choson coming out of his chuppah, and rejoiceth as a gibbor to run a race.

6.verse: Its going forth is from the end of HaShomayim, and its circuit unto the ends of it; and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.

7.verse: The torah of Hashem is temimah (perfect), reviving the nefesh; the edut of Hashem is ne’emanah (sure), making wise the simple.

8.verse: The precepts of Hashem are yasharim (right), rejoicing the lev; the mitzvat Hashem is bara (clear, pure), enlightening the eyes.

9.verse: The yirat Hashem (fear of the L-rd) is tehorah (clean), enduring forever; the mishpatim of Hashem are emes and righteous altogether.

10.verse: More to be desired are they than zahav, yea, than much fine gold; sweeter also than devash and the honeycomb.

11.verse: Moreover by them is Thy eved warned; and in being shomer over them there is great reward.

12.verse: Who can discern his errors? Cleanse Thou me from nistarot (secret ones).

13.verse: Keep back Thy eved also from presumptuous sins; let them not have dominion over me; then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent from the peysha rav (great transgression).

14.verse: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my lev, be acceptable in Thy sight, O Hashem, my Tzur (rock), and Go’ali (my Redeemer).

1.verse: (For the one directing. Mizmor Dovid) Hashem hear thee in the Yom Tzarah (day of trouble); the Shem Elohei Ya’akov set thee up on high [i.e., out of reach of your enemies];

2.verse: Send thee help from the Kodesh (Holy Sanctuary), and strengthen thee out of Tziyon;

3.verse: Remember all thy minchot, and accept thy olat; Selah.

4.verse: Grant thee according to thine own levav, and fulfil kol etzah (plan, counsel) of thine.

5.verse: We will shout for joy at thy Yeshuah (salvation), and in the Shem of Eloheinu we will lift up our banners; Hashem grant all thy requests.

6.verse: Now I have da’as that Hashem hoshi’a (He saves) His Moshiach; He will answer him from His Sh’mei Kodesh (Holy Heaven) with the saving strength of His right hand.

7.verse: Some trust in chariots, and some susim: but we will trust in the Shem Hashem Eloheinu.

8.verse: They are brought down and fallen, but we are risen up, and stand firm.

9.verse: Hoshi’ah, Hashem, HaMelech! May He hear us on the day when we call.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Mizmor Dovid) Melech shall have simcha in Thy strength, Hashem; and in Thy Yeshuah (salvation) how greatly shall he rejoice!

2.verse: Thou hast given him the desire of his lev, and hast not withheld the request of his lips. Selah.

3.verse: For Thou meeteth him with the birkhot tov; Thou settest an ateret of pure gold on his head.

4.verse: He asked Chayyim of Thee, and Thou gavest it him, even length of yamim olam va’ed [see 1C 15:4; Ps 16:10];

5.verse: Gadol is his kavod in Thy Yeshuah (salvation); hod v’hadar hast Thou bestowed upon him.

6.verse: For Thou hast made him birkhot forever; Thou hast made him exceeding glad with simcha in Thy presence.

7.verse: For HaMelech trusteth in Hashem, and through the chesed of Elyon he shall not be moved.

8.verse: Thine yad shall find out all thine enemies; thy right hand shall find out those that hate thee.

9.verse: Thou shalt make them like an oven of eish in the time of thine presence; Hashem shall swallow them up in His wrath, and the eish shall devour them.

10.verse: Their fruit shalt Thou destroy from ha’aretz, and their zera from among Bnei Adam.

11.verse: For they intended ra’ah against Thee; they devised a plot, which they are not able to perform.

12.verse: Ki (therefore) shalt Thou make them turn their backs, when Thou shalt aim Thine bowstrings at their faces.

13.verse: Be Thou exalted, Hashem, in Thine Own Strength; so will we sing and praise Thy gevurah (power).

1.verse: (For the one directing. To the Deer of the Dawn. Mizmor Dovid.) Eli, Eli, lamah azavtani? [See Mt 27:46 OJBC] Why art Thou so far from my yeshuah, and from the words of my groaning?

2.verse: Elohai, I cry yomam, but Thou hearest not; and v’lailah, and am not silent.

3.verse: But Atah Kadosh, O Thou enthroned on the tehillot Yisroel.

4.verse: Avoteinu trusted in Thee; they had bitachon, and Thou didst deliver them.

5.verse: They cried unto Thee, and were delivered; they had bitachon in Thee, and were not disappointed.

6.verse: But I am a tola’at, and no ish; a reproach of men, and despised of the people [see Yeshayah 53:3 on the despised Moshiach].

7.verse: All they that see me mock me; they shoot out the lip, they shake the rosh, saying,

8.verse: He trusted in Hashem; let Hashem rescue him; let Him deliver him, since He delights in him.

9.verse: But Thou art He that took me out of the womb; Thou didst make me trust when I was upon the breasts of immi.

10.verse: I was cast upon Thee from the womb; Thou art Eli from the womb of immi.

11.verse: Be not far from me; for tzoros is near; and there is none to help.

12.verse: Parim rabbim (many bulls) have encompassed me; strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round about.

13.verse: They opened wide their mouths upon me, like an aryeh roaring and tearing prey.

14.verse: I am poured out like mayim, and all my atzmot are out of joint; my lev is like wax; it is melted away within me.

15.verse: My ko’ach is dried up like baked clay; and my leshon cleaveth to my jaws; and Thou layest me in the aphar mavet (dust of death).

16.verse: For kelavim have surrounded me; the Adat Mere’im (congregation of evil men) have enclosed me; ka’aru yadai v’ragelai (they pierced my hands and my feet; see Isa 53:5; Zech 12:10 and medieval Hebrew Scripture manuscripts as well as the Targum HaShivim).

17.verse: I can count all my atzmot; the people stare and gloat at me.

18.verse: They divide up my garments among them, and for my clothing they cast goral (lots) [Mt 27:35; Lk 23:34; Yn 19:24].

19.verse: But be not Thou far from me, Hashem; O my strength, hasten Thee to help me.

20.verse: Deliver my nefesh from the cherev, my yechid (only one, only [nefesh]) from the power of the kelev (dog).

21.verse: Hoshieini from the mouth of the aryeh; for Thou hast heard me from the karnayim of the wild bulls.

22.verse: I will declare Thy Shem unto my Achim; in the midst of the Kahal will I praise Thee.

23.verse: Ye that fear Hashem, praise Him; all ye Zera Ya’akov, give Him kavod; and fear Him, all ye Zera Yisroel.

24.verse: For He hath not despised nor disdained the enut ani (affliction of the afflicted); neither hath He hid His face from him; but when he cried unto Him, He heard.

25.verse: My tehillah shall be from Thee in the Kahal Rav; I will fulfill my nedar before them that fear Him.

26.verse: The anavim (meek) shall eat and be satisfied; they that seek Him shall praise Hashem. Let your levav live forever!

27.verse: All the ends of HaAretz shall remember and turn unto Hashem; and all the mishpechot of the Goyim shall bow down in worship before Thee.

28.verse: For the Meluchah is Hashem’s: and He is the Moshel over the Goyim.

29.verse: All they that thrive upon HaAretz shall eat and worship; all they that go down to the aphar (dust) shall bow before Him; even he who cannot keep alive his own nefesh.

30.verse: Zera shall serve Him; it shall be told to the generation [to come] concerning Adonoi.

31.verse: They shall come, and shall declare His tzedek unto an Am Nolad (a [future] people that shall be born), that He hath done this.

1.verse: (Mizmor of Dovid). Hashem is my Ro’eh (Shepherd); I shall not lack.

2.verse: He maketh me to lie down in green pastures; He leadeth me beside the mei menuchot (tranquil waters).

3.verse: He restoreth my nefesh; He guideth me in the paths of tzedek l’ma’an Shmo (righteousness for the sake of His Name).

4.verse: Yea, though I walk through the Gey Tzalmavet (Valley of the Shadow of Death), I will fear no rah (evil); for Thou art with me; Thy shevet (rod) and Thy staff they comfort me.

5.verse: Thou preparest a shulchan before me in the presence of mine enemies: Thou anointest my head with shemen (olive oil); my kos runneth over.

6.verse: Surely tov and chesed shall follow me kol y’mei chaiyyai (all the days of my life): and I will dwell in the Bais Hashem l’orech yamim (for length of days, whole life

1.verse: long, forever). (Mizmor of Dovid) Ha’aretz is Hashem’s, and the fullness thereof; the tevel (world), and they that dwell therein.

2.verse: For He hath founded it upon the yamim (seas), and established it upon the waters.

3.verse: Who shall ascend the Har Hashem? Or who shall stand in His Makom Kodesh?

4.verse: He that hath clean hands, and a bar levav (pure heart); who hath not lifted up his nefesh unto shahv (vanity), nor sworn l’mirmah (deceitfully).

5.verse: He shall receive the brocha (blessing) from Hashem, and tzedakah from Elohei Yisho (the G-d of his Salvation).

6.verse: This is the generation of them that seek Him, that seek Thy face, O Ya’akov. Selah.

7.verse: Lift up your heads, O ye she’arim; and be ye lifted up, ye Pitchei Olam (everlasting doorways); and Melech HaKavod shall come in.

8.verse: Who is this Melech HaKavod? Hashem strong and mighty, Hashem Gibbor Milchamah.

9.verse: Lift up your heads, O ye she’arim; even lift them up, ye Pitchei Olam; and Melech HaKavod shall come in.

10.verse: Who is this Melech HaKavod? Hashem Tzva’os, He is Melech HaKavod. Selah.

1.verse: (Of Dovid) [Aleph] Unto Thee, Hashem, do I lift up my nefesh.

2.verse: [Bais] O Elohai, I trust in Thee: let me not be ashamed, let not mine oyevim triumph over me.

3.verse: [Gimel] Yea, let none that wait [hoping in] Thee be ashamed; let them be ashamed which transgress without cause.

4.verse: [Dalet] Show me Thy ways, Hashem; teach me Thy paths.

5.verse: [Heh Vav] Lead me in Thy emes, and teach me; for Thou art the Elohei of my Salvation; on Thee do I wait kol hayom.

6.verse: [Zayin] Remember, Hashem, Thy rachamim and Thy lovingkindnesses; for they have ever been of old.

7.verse: [Chet] Remember not the chattot of my youth, nor my peysha’im; according to Thy chesed remember Thou me for the sake of Thy goodness, Hashem.

8.verse: [Tet] Tov and yashar is Hashem; therefore will He teach chatta’im in the Derech.

9.verse: [Yod] The meek will He guide in mishpat; and the aniyim will He teach His way.

10.verse: [Kaph] All the paths of Hashem are chesed and emes unto such as keep His Brit (covenant) and His Edot (covenant demands, urgings, reminders, testimonies).

11.verse: [Lamed] For the sake of Thy Shem, Hashem, pardon mine iniquity; for it is great.

12.verse: [Mem] What man is he that feareth Hashem? Him shall He teach in the Derech that he shall choose.

13.verse: [Nun] His nefesh (soul) shall dwell in prosperity; and his zera shall inherit the earth.

14.verse: [Samech] The secret of Hashem is with them that fear Him; and He will show them His Brit (covenant).

15.verse: [Ayin] Mine eyes are ever toward Hashem; for He shall pluck my feet out of the reshet (net).

16.verse: [Peh] Turn Thee unto me, and be gracious unto me; for I am yachid (alone, lonely) and afflicted.

17.verse: [Tzade] The tzoros of my lev are multiplied; O bring Thou me forth out of my distresses.

18.verse: [Resh] Look upon mine affliction and my pain; and take away all my chattot.

19.verse: Resh] Look upon mine enemies; for they are increased; and they hate me with sinas chamas.

20.verse: Shin] Be shomer over my nefesh, and deliver me; let me not be ashamed; for I take refuge in Thee.

21.verse: [Tav] Let tohm (integrity, guilelessness) and uprightness preserve me; for I wait on Thee.

22.verse: Redeem Yisroel, O Elohim, out of all his tzoros.

1.verse: (Of Dovid) Vindicate me, Hashem; for I have walked in mine tohm (guilelessness); I have trusted also in Hashem without wavering.

2.verse: Examine me, Hashem, and prove me; try my heart and my mind.

3.verse: For Thy chesed is before mine eyes; and I have walked in Thy emes.

4.verse: I do not sit with meteishav (men of vanity), neither will I go in with dissemblers.

5.verse: I have hated the kehal mere’im (congregation of evil doers); and will not sit with the resha’im.

6.verse: I will wash mine hands in nikkayon (innocency, cleanness, freedom from punishment); so will I encompass Thine Mizbe’ach, Hashem;

7.verse: That I may publish with the voice of todah, and tell of all Thy wondrous works.

8.verse: Hashem, I have loved the ma’on of Thy Bais [HaMikdash], and the Mishkan where Thine kavod dwelleth.

9.verse: Take not away my nefesh with chatta’im (sinners), nor my Chai (life) with anshei damim;

10.verse: In whose hands is zimmah (wicked plans), and their right hand is full of shochad (bribery).

11.verse: But as for me, I will walk in mine integrity; redeem me, v’chaneini (and be merciful and gracious unto me).

12.verse: My regel standeth on level ground; in the great assemblies unto Hashem will I render brocha.

1.verse: (Of Dovid) Hashem is my ohr and Yishi (my Salvation); whom shall I fear? Hashem is the ma’oz (stronghold) of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?

2.verse: When the resha’im, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to devour my basar, they stumbled and fell.

3.verse: Though an army should encamp against me, my lev shall not fear; though milchamah should break out against me, in this will I be confident.

4.verse: One thing have I asked of Hashem, that will I seek after: that I may dwell in the Bais Hashem all the days of my life, to behold the gracefulness of Hashem, and to inquire in His Heikhal.

5.verse: For in the Yom Ra’ah (day of evil) He shall keep me safe in His Sukkah; in the shelter of His Ohel shall He conceal me; He shall set me up upon a Tzur (rock).

6.verse: And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies around about me; therefore will I offer in His Ohel sacrifices with shouts of joy; I will sing, yea, I will make music unto Hashem.

7.verse: Shema, Hashem, when I call with my voice; chaneini also upon me, and answer me.

8.verse: When my lev said of Thee, Seek ye My face, my lev said unto Thee, Thy face, Hashem, will I seek.

9.verse: Hide not Thy face far from me; turn not Thy eved away in anger; Thou hast been my ezer; leave me not, neither forsake me, Elohei Yishi (G-d of my Salvation).

10.verse: When avi and immi forsake me, then Hashem will take me up.

11.verse: Teach me Thy Derech, Hashem, and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.

12.verse: Deliver me not over unto the desire of mine enemies; for edei sheker are risen up against me, and such as breathe out chamas.

13.verse: Did I not believe to see Hashem’s goodness in the Eretz Chayyim!

14.verse: Wait for Hashem: Chazak! And strengthen thine lev. Wait, I say, for Hashem.

1.verse: (Of Dovid) Unto Thee will I cry, Hashem my Tzur; do not turn a deaf ear to me: lest, if Thou be silent to me, I become like them that go down into the pit.

2.verse: Shema (hear) kol (voice) of my supplications, when I cry unto Thee, when I lift up my hands toward Thy Devir Kodesh (Innermost Sanctuary, Kodesh HaKodashim).

3.verse: Draw me not away with the resha’im, and with the workers of iniquity, which speak shalom to their neighbors, but malice is in their hearts.

4.verse: Give to them according to their deeds, and according to the wickedness of their endeavors; give them after the work of their hands; render to them their gemul (deserts).

5.verse: Because they regard not the Pe’ulot Hashem, nor the Ma’aseh of His hands, He shall tear them down, and not build them up.

6.verse: Baruch Hashem, because He hath heard the kol (voice) of my supplications.

7.verse: Hashem is my strength and my mogen; my lev trusts in Him, and I am helped; therefore my lev greatly rejoiceth; and with my song will I thank Him.

8.verse: Hashem is their oz (strength), and He is the Ma’oz Yeshu’ot (saving refuge) of His Moshiach.

9.verse: Save Thy people, and bless Thine nachalah; shepherd them also, and carry them ad olam.

1.verse: (Mizmor of Dovid) Ascribe unto Hashem, O ye bnei elim (sons of the mighty), ascribe unto Hashem kavod and oz (strength).

2.verse: Ascribe unto Hashem the Kavod Shmo; worship Hashem in the Hadrat Kodesh (beauty of holiness).

3.verse: The voice of Hashem is upon the waters; El HaKavod thundereth; Hashem is over the mayim rabbim.

4.verse: The voice of Hashem is in Ko’ach; the voice of Hashem is in hadar (majesty).

5.verse: The voice of Hashem breaketh the cedars; Hashem breaketh the cedars of the Levanon.

6.verse: He maketh them also to skip like an egel (calf); Levanon and Siryon, like a young reimim (wild ox).

7.verse: The voice of Hashem hews out with flashes of eish.

8.verse: The voice of Hashem shaketh the midbar; Hashem shaketh the Midbar Kadesh.

9.verse: The voice of Hashem causes the deer to calve, and strips bare the ye’arot (forests); and in His Heikhal doth everyone say, Kavod!

10.verse: Hashem sitteth upon the mabbul (flood); yea, Hashem sitteth enthroned as Melech l’olam.

11.verse: Hashem will give oz (strength) unto His people; Hashem will bless His people with shalom.

1.verse: (Mizmor. Shir Chanukat HaBeis. Of Dovid) I will exalt Thee, Hashem, for Thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to gloat over me.

2.verse: Hashem Elohai, I cried unto Thee, and Thou hast healed me.

3.verse: Hashem, Thou hast brought up my nefesh from Sheol; Thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.

4.verse: Sing unto Hashem, O ye chasidim of His, and give thanks to His Zekher Kodesh.

5.verse: For His anger endureth but a rega; in His favor is Chayyim; weeping may endure for an erev, but joy cometh in the boker.

6.verse: And in my shalvah (security) I said, I shall never be moved.

7.verse: Hashem, by Thy favor Thou hast made my mountain to stand firm; Thou didst hide Thy face, and I was troubled.

8.verse: I cried to Thee, Hashem; and unto Adonoi I made supplication.

9.verse: What profit is there in my dahm, in my going down into the pit? Shall the aphar (dust) praise Thee? Shall it declare Thy emes?

10.verse: Shema, Hashem, and channeini; Hashem, be Thou my helper.

11.verse: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing; Thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with simcha;

12.verse: That kavod (my glory, my soul) may sing praise to Thee, and not be silent. Hashem Elohai, I will give thanks unto Thee l’olam.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Mizmor Dovid) In Thee, Hashem, do I take refuge; let me never be put to shame; deliver me in Thy tzedakah.

2.verse: Incline Thine ear to me; deliver me speedily; be Thou for me a Tzur Ma’oz, a Bais Metzudot (fortress) to save me.

3.verse: For Thou art my Sela (rock) and my Metzudah (fortress); therefore for the sake of Thy Name, lead me, and guide me.

4.verse: Pull me out of the reshet (trap, net) that they have laid for me; for Thou art my ma’oz (stronghold).

5.verse: Into Thine yad I commit my ruach; Thou hast redeemed me, Hashem El Emes [Lk 23:46; Ac 7:59].

6.verse: I hate them that are the shomrim of lying vanities [i.e., idols]; but I trust in Hashem.

7.verse: I will be glad and rejoice in Thy chesed; for Thou hast seen my affliction; Thou hast known the tzoros (troubles) of my nefesh;

8.verse: And hast not shut me up into the yad of the oyev (enemy); Thou hast set my feet in a merkhav (large place, spacious or broad place).

9.verse: Channeni, Hashem, for I am in tzoros; mine eye is consumed with ka’as (grief), my nefesh and my beten.

10.verse: For my life is spent with grief, and my years with groaning; my ko’ach faileth because of mine avon (iniquity), and my atzmot waste away.

11.verse: I was a cherpah (reproach, scorn, disgrace) among all mine enemies, but especially among my shchenim (neighbors), and a dread to mine acquaintance; they that did see me outside fled from me.

12.verse: I am forgotten like a dead man out of mind; I am like a keli oved (broken vessel).

13.verse: For I have heard the dibbah (evil report, slander) of many; terror was on every side; while they conspire against me, they plot to take my nefesh.

14.verse: But I trust in Thee, Hashem; I said, Thou art Elohai.

15.verse: My times are in Thy yad; deliver me from the yad of mine oyevim (enemies), and from them that persecute me.

16.verse: Make Thy face to shine upon Thy eved; hoshi’eini (save me) for the sake of Thy chesed.

17.verse: Let me not be put to shame, Hashem; for I have called upon Thee; let the resha’im be put to shame, and let them keep silent in Sheol.

18.verse: Let the siftei sheker (lying lips) be put to silence; which speak insolent things with ga’avah (pride) and contemptuously against the tzaddik.

19.verse: Oh how great is Thy goodness, which Thou hast stored up for them that fear Thee; which Thou hast wrought for them that take refuge in Thee before the Bnei Adam!

20.verse: Thou shalt hide them b’seter (in the shelter) of Thy presence from the intrigues of ish; Thou shalt keep them safe in a sukkah from the riv l’shonot (the strife of tongues, contentious lashon hora, backbiting, slander).

21.verse: Baruch Hashem! For He hath showed me His wondrous chesed in an Ir Matzor (besieged city).

22.verse: For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before Thine eyes; nevertheless Thou heardest the voice of my tachanun (supplications) when unto Thee I cried for help.

23.verse: O love Hashem, all ye His Chasidim; for Hashem preserveth the emunim (the faithful ones), but He pays back in full the oseh ga’avah (the one acting in pride, haughtily).

24.verse: Chazak! Be strong, let your levav take courage, all ye that hope in Hashem.

1.verse: (Of David. A maskil). Ashrei is he whose peysha (rebellion) is forgiven, whose chata’ah (sin) is covered.

2.verse: Ashrei is the adam unto whom Hashem imputeth not avon (iniquity), and in whose ruach there is no remiyyah (guile, deceit).

3.verse: When I kept silent [i.e., refused to confess my sin, which was still naked and uncovered (see 32:1) and had no kapporah covering for my guilt before G-d], my atzmot wasted away through my groaning kol hayom (all the day).

4.verse: For yomam valailah Thy yad was heavy upon me; my strength was sapped as by the droughts of kayitz (summer). Selah.

5.verse: I acknowledge my chattat unto Thee, and mine avon (iniquity) have I not covered up. I said, I will confess my peysha’im (rebellions) unto Hashem; and Thou forgavest the avon (iniquity) of my chattat. Selah.

6.verse: Therefore shall every Chasid pray unto Thee in a time when Thou mayest be found; surely in the floods of mayim rabbim they shall not overtake him.

7.verse: Thou art my seter (hiding place, shelter); Thou shalt preserve me from tzoros; Thou shalt envelop me with songs of deliverance. Selah.

8.verse: I will instruct thee and teach thee in the Derech which thou shalt go; I will counsel thee with Mine eye.

9.verse: Be ye not like the sus, or like the pered (mule), which have no binah; whose mouth must be harnassed with bit and bridle, else they come not near thee.

10.verse: Many sorrows shall be to the resha’im, but he that trusteth in Hashem, chesed shall envelop and cover him.

11.verse: Be glad in Hashem, and rejoice, ye tzaddikim; and shout for joy, all ye yishrei lev (upright in heart).

1.verse: Sing with joy in Hashem, O ye tzaddikim; for tehillah is fitting for the yesharim (upright ones).

2.verse: Hodu l’Hashem with kinnor (harp); make music unto Him with the ten stringed nevel (lyre).

3.verse: Sing unto Him a shir chadash (new song); play skillfully with a teru’ah (shout of joy).

4.verse: For the Devar Hashem is yashar; and kol ma’aseihu (all His deeds) are done in emunah (faithfulness).

5.verse: He loveth Tzedakah and Mishpat; ha’aretz is full of the chesed Hashem.

6.verse: By the Devar Hashem were Shomayim made; and all the tz’va (host) of them by the ruach (breath) of His mouth [MJ 11:3; Yn 1:1; Psa 56:5].

7.verse: He gathereth the mey hayam (waters of the sea) like a mound; He layeth up the tehomot (ocean depths) in otzarot (storehouses, vaults).

8.verse: Let kol ha’aretz fear Hashem; let kol yoshvei tevel (all the inhabitants of the world) stand in awe of Him.

9.verse: For He spoke, and it was done; He commanded, and it stood firm.

10.verse: Hashem annuls the atzat Goyim (plan of the Goyim); He foils the machsh’vot Amim (schemes of the peoples).

11.verse: The atzat Hashem standeth firm l’olam, the machsh’vot of His lev l’dor va’dor (from generation to generation).

12.verse: Ashrei is the Goy whose Elohav is Hashem; and HaAm whom He hath chosen for His own nachalah.

13.verse: Hashem looketh down from Shomayim: He beholdeth kol Bnei HaAdam.

14.verse: From the place of His habitation He looketh upon kol yoshvei ha’aretz.

15.verse: He formeth their hearts yachad; He considereth all their ma’asim (deeds).

16.verse: There is no melech saved by the multitude of an army; a gibbor is not delivered by rav ko’ach.

17.verse: A sus is a sheker (vain, false thing) for teshu’ah (deliverance, salvation, safety); neither shall it save any by its great strength.

18.verse: Hinei, the eye of Hashem is upon them that fear Him, upon them that hope in His chesed;

19.verse: To deliver their nefesh from mavet (death), and to keep them alive in ra’av (famine).

20.verse: Our nefesh waiteth for Hashem; He is ezrienu (our help) and moginneinu (our shield).

21.verse: For libeinu (our heart) shall rejoice in Him, because we have trusted b’Shem Kadsho (in His holy Name).

22.verse: Let Thy chesed, Hashem, be upon us, even as we have hoped in Thee.

1.verse: (Of Dovid, when he feigned insanity before Avimelech, who drove him away, and he went out) I will make a bracha of praise unto Hashem at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth.

2.verse: My nefesh shall make its boast in Hashem; the anavim (humble) shall hear thereof, and be glad.

3.verse: O magnify Hashem with me, and let us exalt Shmo together.

4.verse: I sought Hashem, and He heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.

5.verse: They looked unto Him, and were radiant; and their panim were not ashamed.

6.verse: The oni (poor man) cried, and Hashem heard him, and saved him out of all his tzoros.

7.verse: The Malach Hashem encampeth round about them that fear Him, and delivereth them.

8.verse: O taste and see that Hashem is tov; ashrei is the man that taketh refuge in Him.

9.verse: O fear Hashem, ye His Kedoshim; for there is no lack to them that fear Him.

10.verse: The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger; but they that seek Hashem shall not lack any good thing.

11.verse: Come, ye banim, pay heed unto me; I will teach you the fear of Hashem.

12.verse: What ish is he that desireth chayyim, and loveth many days, that he may see tov?

13.verse: Keep thy tongue from rah, and thy lips from speaking mirmah (guile, see Isaiah 53:9 where it says Moshiach will lack mirmah).

14.verse: Depart from rah, and do tov; seek shalom, and pursue it.

15.verse: The eyes of Hashem are upon the tzaddikim, and His ears open to their cry.

16.verse: The face of Hashem is against them that do rah, to cut off the zekher (remembrance) of them from ha’aretz.

17.verse: The tzaddikim cry, and Hashem heareth, and delivereth them out of all their tzoros.

18.verse: Hashem is near unto them whose lev is broken; and saveth such whose ruach is contrite.

19.verse: Many are the afflictions of the tzaddik; but Hashem delivereth him out of them all.

20.verse: He keepeth shomer over all his bones; not one of them is broken [Yn 19:36].

21.verse: Evil shall slay the resha’im; and they that hate the tzaddik shall be desolate.

22.verse: Hashem redeemeth the nefesh of His avadim; and none of them that take refuge in Him shall be condemned [see Ro 5:1; 8:1 OJBC].

1.verse: (Of Dovid) Contend, Hashem, with them that contend with me; fight against them that fight against me.

2.verse: Take hold of mogen and tzinnah (large shield) and arise to my aid.

3.verse: Draw out also the khanit (spear), and block the way against them that persecute me; say unto my nefesh, I am Thy Yeshuah (salvation).

4.verse: Let them be put to shame and disgraced that seek after my nefesh; let a rout in retreat be theirs and let them be brought to dismay that plot my ruin.

5.verse: Let them be like motz (chaff) before the ruach; and let the Malach Hashem drive them away.

6.verse: Let their derech be choshech and slippery; and let the Malach Hashem pursue them.

7.verse: For without cause have they hid for me their reshet (net) in a shachat (pit), which without cause they dug for my nefesh.

8.verse: Let sho’ah (disaster) come upon him unawares; and let his own reshet (net) that he hath hid ensnare him; into that very sho’ah let him fall.

9.verse: And my nefesh shall rejoice in Hashem; it shall be joyful in His Yeshuah (salvation).

10.verse: All my atzmot shall say, Hashem, mi khamocha (who is like Thee), Who deliverest the oni (poor) from him that is too strong for him, yes, the oni and the evyon (needy) from him that despoileth him?

11.verse: Edei chamas (witnesses of violence, false witnesses) rise up; they lay to my charge things, questioning me of that which I have no da’as.

12.verse: They repay me ra’ah for tovah to the forlornness of my nefesh.

13.verse: But as for me, when they were choleh (ill), my clothing was sackcloth; I humbled my nefesh with tzom (fasting); and my tefillah (prayer) turned back on mine own kheyk (bosom).

14.verse: I went about as though he had been my re’a or ach; I bowed in sadness, as one that mourneth for his em.

15.verse: But at mine stumbling they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together; yes, the attackers gathered themselves together against me, and I had no da’as; they did tear at me [with slander], and ceased not:

16.verse: Like chanef (hypocritical) mockers at cake, they gnashed upon me with their teeth.

17.verse: Adonoi, how long wilt Thou look on? Rescue my nefesh from their destructions, my yechidah (only one, my life) from the lions.

18.verse: I will give Thee thanks in the kahal rav (great congregation); I will praise Thee among the mighty throng.

19.verse: Let not them that are mine oyevim gloat over me; neither let them wink with the eye that have sinas chinom (baseless hatred) toward me.

20.verse: For they speak not shalom, but they scheme divrei mirmot (deceitful matters) against the rigei eretz (them that are quiet in the land).

21.verse: Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me, and said, Aha, aha, our eye hath seen it.

22.verse: This Thou hast seen, Hashem; keep not silent; Adonoi, be not far from me.

23.verse: Stir up Thyself, and awake to my mishpat, even to my cause, Elohai and Adonoi.

24.verse: Vindicate me, Hashem Elohai, according to Thy tzedakah; and let them not gloat over me.

25.verse: Let them not say in their lev, Ah, so would we have it; let them not say, We have swallowed him up.

26.verse: Let them be put to shame and brought to confusion together that gloat at mine ra’ah (disaster, distress); let them be clothed with boshet (shame) and kelimah (dishonor, disgrace) that exalt themselves against me.

27.verse: Let them sing for joy, and be glad, that favor my tzedek (righteousness, vindication); yes, let them say tamid (continually), Let Hashem be magnified, which hath pleasure in the shalom (welfare) of His eved.

28.verse: And my leshon (tongue) shall speak of Thy tzedek (righteousness) and of Thy tehillah (praise) kol hayom (all the day).

1.verse: (For the one directing. Of Dovid, the eved Hashem) Peysha speaketh to the rashah within my lev, that there is no pachad Elohim (fear of G-d) before his eyes.

2.verse: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, until his avon (iniquity) be found to be hateful.

3.verse: The words of his mouth are iniquity and mirmah (deceit); he hath ceased to be wise, and to do tov (good).

4.verse: He deviseth evil upon his mishkav (bed); he setteth himself in a derech that is not tov; he abhorreth not rah.

5.verse: Thy chesed, Hashem, is in HaShomayim; and Thy emunah (faithfulness) reacheth unto the clouds.

6.verse: Thy tzedakah is like the great mountains; Thy mishpatim are tehom rabbah (a great deep); Hashem, Thou preservest adam (man) and behemah (beast).

7.verse: How precious is Thy chesed, O Elohim! Therefore the Bnei Adam find refuge under the shadow of Thy wings.

8.verse: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the abundance of Thy Beis [Hamikdash]; and Thou shalt give them to drink of Thy river of delight.

9.verse: For with Thee is the Makor Chayyim (fountain of life); in Thy Ohr shall we see ohr.

10.verse: O continue Thy chesed unto them that know Thee; and Thy tzedakah to the yishrei lev (the ones upright of heart).

11.verse: Let not the regel ga’avah (foot of pride) come against me, and let not the yad of the resha’im drive me away.

12.verse: There are the po’alei aven (workers of iniquity) fallen; they are thrown down, and shall not be able to rise.

1.verse: (Of Dovid) Fret not thyself because of re’im (evildoers); neither have thou kina (jealousy, envy) of the workers of iniquity.

2.verse: For they shall soon be cut down like the khatzir (grass), and wither as the green desheh (herb, plant).

3.verse: Trust in Hashem, and do tov; so shalt thou dwell in the Eretz (land), ure’eh emunah (and thou be pastured securely).

4.verse: Delight thyself also in Hashem, and He shall give thee the desires of thine lev.

5.verse: Commit thy derech (road, way) unto Hashem; trust also in Him; and He shall bring it to pass.

6.verse: And He shall bring forth thy tzedakah (righteousness) as the ohr (light), and thy mishpat (justice) as the tzohorayim (noonday).

7.verse: Rest in Hashem, and wait patiently for Him; fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his derech, because of the ish who bringeth wicked schemes to pass.

8.verse: Cease from anger, and forsake chemah (wrath); fret not thyself in any wise to do rah.

9.verse: For evildoers shall be cut off; but those that wait upon Hashem, they shall inherit the Eretz (land).

10.verse: For yet a little while, and the rasha shall not be; yes, thou shalt watch his place, and he will not be.

11.verse: But the anavim (meek ones) shall inherit Eretz; and shall delight themselves in rov shalom (great peace; see Psa 119:165).

12.verse: The rasha plotteth against the tzaddik, and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.

13.verse: Adonoi shall laugh at him, for He seeth that his yom is coming.

14.verse: The resha’im have drawn out the cherev, and have bent their keshet, to cast down the oni (poor) and evyon (needy), and to slay such as be yishrei derech (upright ones on the road, that walk uprightly).

15.verse: Their cherev shall enter into their own lev, and their keshatot (bows) shall be broken.

16.verse: A little that a tzaddik hath is better than the riches of resha’im rabbim.

17.verse: For the zero’ot (arms, powers) of the resha’im shall be broken; but Hashem upholdeth the tzaddikim.

18.verse: Hashem knoweth the yamim of the temimim (blameless ones); and their nachalah (inheritance) shall be l’olahm (forever).

19.verse: They shall not be put to shame in time of evil; and in the days of famine yisba’u (they shall be satisfied, enjoy plenty).

20.verse: But the resha’im shall perish, and the oyvei Hashem (enemies of Hashem) shall be like the glory of the meadows; they shall disappear like ashan (smoke), they shall vanish.

21.verse: The rasha borroweth, and repayeth not; but the tzaddik showeth chonen (generosity), and giveth.

22.verse: For such as be blessed of Him shall inherit Eretz; and they that be cursed of Him shall be cut off.

23.verse: The steps of a gever (man) konanu (are ordered, made firm) by Hashem and He delighteth in his derech.

24.verse: Though he stumble, he shall not utterly fall; for Hashem upholdeth him with His yad (hand, power).

25.verse: I have been na’ar (young), and now am old; yet I have not seen the tzaddik forsaken, nor his zera begging lechem.

26.verse: He is ever chonen (generous, merciful; see verse 21), and lendeth; and his zera is blessed.

27.verse: Depart from rah, and do tov; and dwell l’olahm (for evermore).

28.verse: For Hashem loveth mishpat, and forsaketh not His chasidim; they are preserved l’olahm; but the zera resha’im shall be cut off.

29.verse: The tzaddikim shall inherit Eretz, and dwell therein forever.

30.verse: The mouth of the tzaddik speaketh chochmah, and his leshon uttereth mishpat.

31.verse: The torat Elohav is in his lev; no steps of his shall slip.

32.verse: The rashah lieth in wait to ambush the tzaddik, and seeketh to slay him.

33.verse: Hashem will not leave him in his yad (hand, power), nor condemn him b’hishshafto (when he is judged, brought to trial).

34.verse: Wait on Hashem, and be shomer over His Derech, and He shall exalt thee to inherit Eretz; when the resha’im are cut off, thou shalt see it.

35.verse: I have seen the violently powerful rashah, spreading himself like an indigenous green tree.

36.verse: Yet he passed away, and, hinei, he was no more; yes, I sought him, but he could not be found.

37.verse: Mark the blameless man, and observe the yashar (upright); for the end of that ish is shalom.

38.verse: But the poshe’im (rebels, transgressors) shall be made shmad together; the latter end [i.e., future] of the resha’im shall be cut off.

39.verse: But the Teshu’at Tzaddikim is of Hashem; He is their ma’oz (stronghold, refuge) in the time of tzoros.

40.verse: And Hashem helps them, and delivers them; He shall deliver them from the resha’im, and save them, because they take refuge in Him.

1.verse: (Mizmor Dovid. For the memorial portion of the mincha) Hashem, rebuke me not in Thy wrath; neither chasten me in Thy hot displeasure.

2.verse: For Thine khitzim (arrows) pierce me, and Thy Yad presseth upon me.

3.verse: There is no health in my basar because of Thine anger; neither is there any shalom in my atzmot because of my chattat.

4.verse: For mine avonot (iniquities) are gone over mine head; as a weighty massa (burden) they are too heavy for me.

5.verse: My chaburot (wounds) are foul and festering because of my wicked folly.

6.verse: I am bent down; I am brought low ad me’od; I go about mourning all day long.

7.verse: For my loins are filled with burning; and there is no health in my basar.

8.verse: I am feeble and broken ad me’od; I have groaned by reason of the disquietness of my lev.

9.verse: Adonoi, all my ta’avah (desire, longing) is before Thee; and my groaning is not hid from Thee.

10.verse: My lev panteth, my ko’ach faileth me; as for the ohr of mine eyes, it also is gone from me.

11.verse: My loved ones and my re’a stand aloof from my nega [see Isa 53:8 on Moshiach’s nega]; and my neighbors stand afar off.

12.verse: They also that seek after my nefesh lay snares for me; and they that seek my hurt speak of ruin, and plot mirmot (deceptions, deceits) all the day long.

13.verse: But I, like a cheresh (deaf man), heard not; and I was like a mute that openeth not his mouth.

14.verse: Thus I was like an ish that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no tokhachot (reproofs).

15.verse: For I wait for Thee, Hashem; Thou wilt hear, Adonoi Elohai.

16.verse: For I said, Hear me, lest otherwise they should gloat over me; when my regel slippeth, they magnify themselves against me.

17.verse: For I am ready to fall, and my sorrow is before me tamid.

18.verse: For I will declare mine avon; I will be in anguish over my chattat.

19.verse: But mine oveyim are chayyim (vigorous), and they are strong; and they that hate me sheker (wrongfully) are multiplied.

20.verse: They also that repay ra’ah for tovah are mine adversaries; because I pursue the thing that is tov.

21.verse: Forsake me not, Hashem Elohai; be not far from me.

22.verse: Make haste to help me, Adonoi Teshuati (L-rd of my salvation).

1.verse: (For the one directing, even to Yedutun. Mizmor Dovid). I said, I will be shomer over my ways, that I sin not with my leshon; I will be shomer over my mouth with a muzzle, while the rashah is before me.

2.verse: I was dumb with silence, I held my peace for the sake of tov; and my distress grew severe.

3.verse: My lev became hot within me; while I was musing the eish burned; then I spoke with my leshon,

4.verse: Hashem, make me to know mine end, and the measure of my yamim, what it is; that I may have da’as of how chadel (fleeting, frail) I am.

5.verse: Hinei, Thou hast made my yamim as a handbreadth, and mine lifespan is as nothing before Thee; verily kol adam stand as kol hevel (altogether vanity). Selah.

6.verse: Surely every ish walketh in a tzel (shadow); surely they are in turmoil in vain; he heapeth up riches, and hath no da’as of who shall gather them.

7.verse: And now, Adonoi, what do I wait for? My hope is in Thee.

8.verse: Save me from all my peysha’im; make me not the reproach of the foolish.

9.verse: I was silent, I opened not my mouth; because Atah (Thou) did it.

10.verse: Remove Thy nega (stroke, scourge) away from me; I am consumed by the blow of Thine yad.

11.verse: When Thou with rebukes dost correct man for avon (iniquity), Thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely kol adam are hevel (vanity). Selah.

12.verse: Hear my tefillah, Hashem, and give ear unto my cry; hold not Thy peace at my weeping; for I am a ger with Thee, and a sojourner, as were all my Avot.

13.verse: O spare me from Thy frown, that I may recover strength, before I depart, v’eineni (and I be no more). [T.N. Animal sacrifices cannot take away sin; they are only a shadow of the korban nefesh of Moshiach. See Ps 40 and MJ chp 10; Isa 53:10.]

1.verse: (40:2)(For the one directing, Of Dovid. Mizmor) I waited patiently for Hashem; and He inclined unto me, and heard my cry.

2.verse: Hashem brought me up also out of a horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, and established my goings.

3.verse: And He hath put a shir chadash in my mouth, even tehillah (hymn of praise) unto Eloheinu; many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in Hashem.

4.verse: Ashrei is that man that maketh Hashem his trust, and looketh not to the proud ones, nor such as turn aside to lies (false g-ds).

5.verse: Many, O Hashem Elohai, are Thy wonderful works which Thou hast done, and Thy thoughts which are to us-ward; they cannot be recounted unto Thee; if I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.

6.verse: Zevach and minchah Thou didst not desire; mine ears hast Thou pierced [cf Psa 22:17]; olah (burnt offering) and chata’ah (sin offering) hast Thou not required.

7.verse: Then said I, Hinei, I come; in the megillat sefer it is written of me [cf MJ 10:5-7],

8.verse: I delight to do Thy will, O Elohai; yea, Thy torah is within my heart.

9.verse: I have preached tzedek in the kahal rav (great congregation); hinei, I have not restrained my lips, O Hashem, Thou knowest.

10.verse: I have not hid thy tzedek within my lev; I have declared Thy emunah (faithfulness) and Thy teshuah (salvation); I have not concealed Thy chesed and Thy emes from the kahal rav.

11.verse: Withhold not Thou thy rachamim from me, O Hashem; let Thy chesed and Thy emes continually preserve me.

12.verse: For innumerable evils have compassed me about; mine avonot (iniquities) have overtaken me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of mine head; therefore my lev faileth me.

13.verse: Be pleased, O Hashem, to deliver me; O Hashem, make haste to help me.

14.verse: Let them be ashamed and mutually confounded that seek after my nefesh to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.

15.verse: Let them be appalled because of their boshet (shame) that say unto me, Aha, aha.

16.verse: Let all those that seek Thee rejoice and be glad in Thee; let such as love Thy teshuah say continually, Hashem be magnified.

17.verse: But I am poor and needy; yet Adonoi thinketh upon me; Thou art my ezer and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O Elohai.

1.verse: (For the one directing, Mizmor of Dovid).

2.verse: Blessed is he that considereth the helpless; Hashem will deliver him in time of ra’ah (evil, trouble).

3.verse: Hashem will be shomer over him, and keep him alive; and he shall be blessed in ha’aretz; and Thou wilt not surrender him unto the desire of his enemies.

4.verse: Hashem will support him upon the sickbed; in his illness, all his bedridden languishing Thou wilt change (i.e., toward recovery).

5.verse: I said, Hashem, channeni (be gracious unto me); heal my nefesh; for I have sinned against Thee.

6.verse: Mine enemies speak rah (evil) of me: When will he die, and shmo (his name) perish?

7.verse: And if one cometh to see me, he speaketh falsely; his lev gathereth wickedness to itself; when he goeth lachutz (outside, around) he telleth it.

8.verse: All that hate me whisper together against me; against me do they devise my hurt.

9.verse: A thing of beliya’al (a wicked fate, i.e., a terminal illness), say they, cleaveth fast unto him, that when he lieth he shall rise up no more.

10.verse: Yea, mine own ish shalom (familiar friend, close friend), in whom I trusted, which did eat of my lechem, hath lifted up his heel (i.e., deceitfully showed enmity) against me [see Yn 13:18].

11.verse: But Thou, O Hashem, channeni (be gracious, merciful unto me), and raise me up, that I may repay them.

12.verse: By this I know that Thou favorest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.

13.verse: And as for me, Thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before Thy face l’olam (forever).

1.verse: (For the one directing, Maskil, for the Bnei Korah). As the deer panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my nefesh after Thee, O Elohim.

2.verse: My nefesh thirsteth for Elohim, for El Chai. When shall I come and appear before Elohim [in the Beis Hamikdash]?

3.verse: My tears have been my lechem yomam valailah, while they continually say unto me, Where is Eloheicha?

4.verse: When I remember these things, I pour out my nefesh within me; for I had gone with the multitude, I went with them to the Beis Elohim with the voice of rinnah and todah, with the multitude keeping Chag (holy day, pilgrim feast).

5.verse: Why art thou cast down, O my nefesh? And why groanest thou (i.e., murmuring in discouragement) within me? Hope thou in (i.e., wait for) Elohim; for I shall yet give Him thanks, for He is the yeshuah (salvation) of my countenance and Elohai.

6.verse: My nefesh is cast down within me; therefore will I remember Thee from Eretz Yarden, and from Chermon’s peaks, from Har Mitzar [mountain near Mt Chermon].

7.verse: Tehom el Tehom ([oceanic] deep unto [oceanic] deep) calleth at the noise of Thy waterfalls; all Thy breakers and Thy billows are passed over me.

8.verse: Yet Hashem will command His chesed by day, and in the night His shir (song) shall be with me, my tefillah (prayer) unto the El Chayyai (G-d of my life).

9.verse: I will say unto El Sali (G-d my Rock), Why hast Thou forgotten me? Why go I mourning because of the oppression of the oyev (enemy)? [Mt 27:46]

10.verse: As with the crushing of my atzamot (bones), mine tzorer (vexers, harassers) reproach me; while they say all day long unto me, Where is Eloheicha?

11.verse: Why art thou cast down, O my nefesh? And why art thou disquieted within me? Hope thou in (wait for) Elohim; for I shall yet give Him thanks, for He is the yeshuah (salvation) of my countenance and Elohai.

1.verse: Vindicate me, O Elohim, and plead my cause against a nation lo chasid; O deliver me from the ish mirmah v’avlah (deceitful and unjust man).

2.verse: For Thou art the Elohei Ma’oz of me. Why dost Thou cast me off? Why must I go mourning because of the oppression of the oyev?

3.verse: O send out Thy Ohr and Thy Emes; let them guide me; let them bring me unto Thy Har Kodesh, and to Thy Mishkan.

4.verse: Then will I go unto the Mizbe’ach of Elohim, unto El my exceeding joy; yea, upon the kinnor will I praise Thee, O Elohim Elohai.

5.verse: Why art thou cast down, O my nefesh? And why art thou disquieted within me? Hope in Elohim; for I shall yet praise Him, Who is the Yeshu’ot of my countenance, and Elohai.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Of the Bnei Korach. A maskil). We have heard with our oznayim, O Elohim, Avoteinu have told us, what po’al (work) Thou hast wrought in their days, in the times of old.

2.verse: How Thou didst drive out the Goyim with Thy Yad, but plantedst them; how Thou didst afflict the people, but for them Thou madest room.

3.verse: For they got not eretz in possession by their own cherev, neither did their own zero’a save them, but Thy Yamin (Right Hand), and Thine Zero’a, and the ohr (light) of Thy countenance, because Thou favored them.

4.verse: Thou art my Melech, O Elohim; command yeshu’ot (deliverances) for Ya’akov.

5.verse: Through Thee will we push down our enemies; through Thy Shem will we trample them under that rise up against us.

6.verse: For I will not trust in my keshet (bow), neither shall my cherev save me.

7.verse: But Thou hast saved us from tzareinu (our enemies), and hast put them to shame that hated us.

8.verse: In Elohim we boast kol hayom, and praise Thy Shem l’olam (forever). Selah.

9.verse: But Thou hast cast off, and disgraced us; and goest not forth with tzivoteinu (our armies).

10.verse: Thou makest us to turn back from before the tzar (enemy); and they which hate us have taken plunder for themselves.

11.verse: Thou hast given us up like tzon appointed for food; and hast scattered us among the Goyim.

12.verse: Thou sellest Amecha (Thy People) for a mere nothing, and art not enriched by their price.

13.verse: Thou makest us a cherpah (reproach) to our shchenim (neighbors), a scorn and a derision to them that are all around us.

14.verse: Thou makest us a mashal (byword) among the Goyim, a shaking of the rosh among the peoples.

15.verse: Kol hayom my dishonor is continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,

16.verse: At the voice of him that reproacheth and revileth; by reason of the oyev (enemy) and avenger.

17.verse: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten Thee, neither have we dealt falsely in Thy Brit.

18.verse: Libenu (our heart) is not turned back, neither have our steps departed from Thy way;

19.verse: Though Thou hast crushed us in the makom (place, home, haunt) of jackals, and covered us with the tzalmavet (shadow of death).

20.verse: If we have forgotten the Shem of Eloheinu, or stretched out our palms [in worship] to an el zar (foreign g-d);

21.verse: Shall not Elohim search this out? For He knoweth the secrets of the lev.

22.verse: Yes, for Thy sake are we killed kol hayom; we are counted as tzon (sheep) for the tivchah (slaughter).

23.verse: Awake. Why sleepest Thou, Adonoi? Arise, cast us not off lanetzach (forever).

24.verse: Why hidest Thou Thy face, and forgettest our oni (misery, affliction) and our oppression?

25.verse: For our nefesh is bowed down to the aphar (dust); our beten (belly, body) has deveykus with the dirt.

26.verse: Arise for our help, and redeem us for the sake of Thy chesed.

1.verse: (For the one directing upon Shoshannim, for the Bnei Korach. A Maskil. Shir yedidot, i.e., a love song). My lev is stirred with davar tov; I speak my verses to HaMelech; my leshon (tongue) is the et (pen, stylus) of a sofer mahir (ready scribe, skillful writer).

2.verse: Thou art fairer than Bnei Adam; chen (grace, favor) is poured upon Thy sfatayim (lips); therefore Elohim hath blessed Thee l’olam. [T.N. The coming Messianic King is called Elohim [Ps 45:6(7)] just as this coming personage is called El Gibbor in Isa 9:5; see MJ 1:8; The Targumist renders Psa 45:2(3) as a reference to Moshiach.]

3.verse: Gird Thy cherev upon Thy side, O Gibbor [See Isaiah 9:5(6)], with Thy hod (glory, splendor) and Thy hadar (majesty).
