4.verse: And in Thy hadar (majesty) ride forth victoriously for the sake of emes and anavah and tzedek; and Thy Yamin (Right Hand) shall guide Thee to nora’ot (things of awe).

5.verse: Thine khitzim (arrows) are sharp in the lev oyvei HaMelech (in the heart of the King’s enemies); the Amim (nations) fall under Thee.

6.verse: Thy kisse (throne), O Elohim, is olam va’ed; the shevet (sceptre) of Thy Malchut is a shevet of uprightness.

7.verse: Thou lovest tzedek, and hatest resha; therefore Elohim, Eloheicha, hath anointed Thee with shemen sasson (the oil of gladness) above Thy chaverim.

8.verse: All Thy robes smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia; out of the ivory heikhalim stringed instruments have made Thee glad.

9.verse: Banot Melachim were among Thy ladies of honor; upon Thy Yamin (Right Hand) is stationed the Shegal (Queen consort, spouse of the reigning monarch) in golden jewelry of Ophir.

10.verse: Pay heed, O Bat (daughter), and consider, and incline thine ear; forget also thine own people, and thy Bais Avi;

11.verse: Then shall HaMelech be enthralled with thy beauty; since He is thy Adon, hishtachavi lo (bow to Him).

12.verse: And the Bat Tzor (Tyre) shall be there with a minchah (gift); even the ashirim (rich ones) among the people shall entreat thy favor.

13.verse: The Bat Melech is all glorious within; her clothing is zahav embroidered.

14.verse: She shall be brought unto HaMelech in woven apparel; the betulot (virgins), her companions that follow her, shall be brought unto Thee.

15.verse: With simchah and gladness shall they be led forth; they shall enter into the Heikhal Melech.

16.verse: Instead of thy avot shall be thy sons, whom thou mayest make sarim (princes) in kol ha’aretz.

17.verse: I will make Thy Shem to be remembered kol dor vador; therefore shall the Amim (nations) praise Thee l’olam va’ed.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Of the Bnei Korach. Al- alamot [after the manner of virgins, i.e., in the treble]. Shir.) Elohim is our refuge and strength, a very present help in tzoros.

2.verse: Therefore we will not fear, though eretz be shaken, and though the harim (mountains) fall into the lev yamim (heart of the seas);

3.verse: Though the mayim thereof roar and be troubled, though the harim shake with the surging thereof. Selah.

4.verse: There is a nahar (river), the streams whereof shall make glad the Ir Elohim, the Kedosh Mishkenei Elyon (the holy dwelling of the Most High).

5.verse: Elohim is in the midst of it [i.e., the Ir Elohim}; it shall not be moved; Elohim shall help it at early boker.

6.verse: The Goyim raged, the kingdoms totter; He uttered His voice, eretz melted.

7.verse: Hashem Tzva’os is with us; Elohei Ya’akov is our stronghold. Selah.

8.verse: Come, behold the works of Hashem, what desolations He hath made in ha’aretz.

9.verse: He maketh milchamot to cease unto the end of ha’aretz; He breaketh the keshet (bow), and cutteth the khanit (spear); He burneth the chariots in the eish.

10.verse: Be still, and know that I am Elohim: I will be exalted among the Goyim, I will be exalted in ha’aretz.

11.verse: Hashem Tzva’os is with us; Elohei Ya’akov is our stronghold. Selah.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Of the Bnei Korach. A Mizmor.) O clap your hands, all ye nations; shout unto Elohim with the voice of joy.

2.verse: For Hashem Elyon is awesome; He is Melech Gadol over kol ha’aretz.

3.verse: He shall subdue the peoples under us, and the nations under our raglayim.

4.verse: He shall choose nachalateinu for us, the ga’on Ya’akov (pride, glory of Jacob) whom He loves. Selah.

5.verse: Elohim is ascended with a shout of joy, Hashem with the sound of a shofar.

6.verse: Sing praises to Elohim, sing praises; sing praises unto Malkeinu, sing praises.

7.verse: For Melech kol ha’aretz is He; sing ye praises with understanding.

8.verse: Elohim reigneth over the Goyim; Elohim sitteth upon the Kisse Kadsho.

9.verse: The princes of the nations are gathered together, even the Am Elohei Avraham; for the moginei Eretz (shields of the Earth) belong unto Elohim; He is greatly exalted.

1.verse: (Shir. Mizmor. Of the Bnei Korach.) Gadol is Hashem, and greatly to be praised in the Ir Eloheinu, in His Har Kodesh.

2.verse: Yafeh in its loftiness, the joy of kol ha’aretz, is Mt Tziyon, on the sides of the north, the City of Melech Rav.

3.verse: Elohim is in her citadels, known as her fortress.

4.verse: For, hinei, the melachim were assembled, they advanced together.

5.verse: They saw, and ken (thus) they marvelled; they were troubled, and fled.

6.verse: Trembling took hold upon them sham (there), and pain, as of a woman in labor.

7.verse: Thou breakest the ships of Tarshish with an east wind.

8.verse: As we have heard, so have we seen in the Ir Hashem Tzvaos, in the Ir Eloheinu; Elohim will establish it ad olam. Selah.

9.verse: We meditate on Thy chesed, O Elohim, in the midst of Thy Heikhal.

10.verse: According to Thy Shem, O Elohim, so is Thy tehillah unto the ends of ha’aretz; Thy right hand is full of tzedek.

11.verse: Let Mt Tziyon rejoice, let the Banot Yehudah (Daughters of Judah) be glad, because of Thy mishpatim.

12.verse: Walk about Tziyon, and go around her; count the towers thereof.

13.verse: Mark ye well her ramparts, consider her citadels; that ye may tell it to the dor acharon.

14.verse: For this Elohim is Eloheinu olam vaed; He will be our guide even unto death. [T.N. Notice v.8(9)-9(10) in Psa 49, which tells why Moshiach can not be a mere man, in which case he could not redeem another, or be Hashem’s Isa 53 redemption lamb or the Isa 53 sa’ir l’azazel kapporah.]

1.verse: (For the one directing. A Mizmor for the Bnei Korach). Hear this, kol HaAmim; give ear, all ye inhabitants of the cheled (world, duration):

2.verse: Bnei Adam and bnei ish, ashir (rich) and evyon (poor) alike,

3.verse: My mouth shall speak chochmot; and the meditation of my lev tevunot (understanding).

4.verse: I will incline mine ear to a mashal; I will disclose my dark saying upon the kinnor (harp).

5.verse: Why should I fear in the days of rah, when the avon (iniquity) of my akev (supplanters, deceivers) surrounds me?

6.verse: They that trust in their chayil (wealth), and boast themselves in the rov of their oshir (riches);

7.verse: A brother cannot by any means redeem ish (man), nor give to Elohim a kofer (ransom) for him—

8.verse: For the pidyon [ransom] of their nefesh is costly, and is forever beyond their power to pay—

9.verse: That he should live on lanetzach, and not see shachat (corruption, decay, the pit [cf Psa16:10]).

10.verse: For he seeth that chachamim die, likewise the kesil (foolish) and the ba’ar (brutish, senseless person, dolt) perish, and leave their chayil (wealth) to others.

11.verse: Their inward thought is, that their batim (houses) shall continue l’olam and their mishkenot (dwelling places) l’odor vador; though they call their lands by their shmot (names).

12.verse: Nevertheless adam in his pomp endureth not; he is like the behemot (beasts) that perish.

13.verse: This is their derech, kesel (folly, imprudent confidence) is theirs; and the fate after them of those who approve their words.

14.verse: Like tzon they are destined for She’ol; mavet shall pasture them; and the yesharim (upright ones) shall have dominion over them in the boker; and their tzir (form) shall waste away to Sheol, so there is no dwelling place for it.

15.verse: But Elohim will redeem my nefesh from the yad (hand, power) of Sheol; for He shall receive me. Selah.

16.verse: Be not thou afraid when one is made an ish oishir, when the kavod of his bais is increased;

17.verse: For in his mot (death), he shall carry nothing away; his kavod (glory, wealth) shall not descend after him.

18.verse: Though his nefesh during his life yevarech (he blessed)—for they praise thee when thou doest well for thyself—

19.verse: He shall go to the dor (generation) of his avot; they shall never see ohr (light).

20.verse: Adam that is in his pomp, and understandeth not, is like the behemot (beasts) that perish.

1.verse: (Mizmor of Asaph) El Elohim, even Hashem, hath spoken, and called Eretz from the mizrach shemesh (rising of sun) unto the going down thereof.

2.verse: Out of Tziyon, the perfection of yofi, Elohim shineth forth.

3.verse: Eloheinu shall come, and shall not keep silent; an eish shall devour before Him, and it shall be tempestuous me’od round about Him.

4.verse: He shall summon Shomayim from above, and ha’aretz, that He may judge His people.

5.verse: Gather My chasidim together unto Me; those that have cut a Brit (covenant) with Me by zevach (blood sacrifice, T.N. cf Gn 4:5 on the true Jewish religion).

6.verse: And Shomayim shall declare His tzedek; for Elohim Shofet hu. Selah.

7.verse: Hear, O My people, and I will speak; O Yisroel, and I will testify against thee; I am Elohim, even Eloheicha.

8.verse: I will not reprove thee for thy zevakhim. And thy olot are before Me tamid.

9.verse: I will accept no par (bull) from thy bais, nor he-goats out of thy folds.

10.verse: For every beast of the ya’ar (forest) is Mine, and the behemot upon a thousand hills.

11.verse: I know kol oph (every bird) of the harim; and the animals of the wild are Mine.

12.verse: If I were hungry, I would not tell thee; for the tevel is Mine, and the fulness thereof.

13.verse: Will I eat the basar of bulls, or drink the dahm of goats?

14.verse: Sacrifice unto Elohim todah; and pay thy nedarim (vows, pledges) unto Elyon;

15.verse: And call upon Me in the Yom Tzarah; I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify Me.

16.verse: But unto the rasha, Elohim saith, What right hast thou to declare My chukkot, or that thou shouldest take My Brit in thy mouth?

17.verse: Seeing thou hatest musar (correction), and casteth My devarim behind thee.

18.verse: When thou sawest a ganav (thief), then thou consentedst with him, and hast taken thy chelek (lot) with mena’afim (adulterers).

19.verse: Thou lettest loose thy mouth to ra’ah, and thy leshon frameth mirmah (deceit).

20.verse: Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine own ben immecha.

21.verse: These things hast thou done, and I kept silent; thou thoughtest that I was altogether like thee; but I will reprove thee, and set the charge before thine eyes.

22.verse: Now consider this, ye that forget Elo’ah (G-d), lest I tear you to pieces, and there be none to rescue.

23.verse: Whoso offereth todah glorifieth Me; and to him that ordereth his derech aright will I show the Salvation of Elohim.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Mizmor Dovid. When Natan HaNavi confronted him after he went into Bat- Sheva—2Sm. 11:2) Have mercy upon me, O Elohim, according to Thy chesed; according unto the multitude of Thy rachamim blot out my peysha’im (transgressions, rebellions).

2.verse: Wash me thoroughly from mine avon (iniquity), and cleanse me from my chattat (sin).

3.verse: For I acknowledge my peysha’im (transgressions, rebellions); and my chattat (sin) is ever before me.

4.verse: Against Thee, Thee only, have I sinned, and done the rah in Thy sight; that Thou mightest be found just when Thou speakest, and be blameless when Thou judgest.

5.verse: Surely, I was brought forth in avon; and in chet did immi conceive me [i.e., I was a sinner from conception].

6.verse: Surely Thou desirest emes in the inward parts; and in the inmost place Thou shalt make me to know chochmah.

7.verse: Purge me with ezov (hyssop), and I shall be tahor; wash me, and I shall be whiter than sheleg (snow).

8.verse: Make me to hear sasson and simchah; that the atzmot which Thou hast broken may rejoice.

9.verse: Hide Thy face from my chatta’im, and blot out all mine avonot.

10.verse: Create in me a lev tahor, O Elohim; and renew a ruach nekhon (steadfast spirit [i.e., regeneration Ezek 36:26; Yn 3:3,6]) within me.

11.verse: Cast me not away from Thy presence; and take not Thy Ruach Hakodesh from me.

12.verse: Restore unto me the sasson of Thy salvation; and uphold me with a ruach nedivah (a willing spirit; see Jer 31:31-34).

13.verse: Then will I teach poshe’im (transgressors) Thy drakhim; and chatta’im (sinners) shall be converted [have a spiritual turnaround; see Isa 6:10] unto Thee.

14.verse: Save me from damim (bloodguiltiness), O Elohim, Thou Elohei Teshuati; and my leshon shall sing aloud of Thy tzedakah.

15.verse: Adonoi, open Thou my lips; and my mouth shall show forth Thy tehillah (praise).

16.verse: For Thou desirest not zevach (sacrifice); else would I give it; Thou delightest not in olah (burnt offering).

17.verse: The zivkhei Elohim are a ruach nishbarah (broken spirit); a broken and contrite lev, O Elohim, Thou wilt not despise.

18.verse: Do good in Thy good pleasure unto Tziyon; build Thou the chomot Yerushalayim.

19.verse: Then shalt Thou be pleased with zivkhei tzedek (true sacrifices, sacrifices of righteousness), with olah (burnt offering) and whole burnt offering; then shall they offer parim (bulls) upon Thine Mizbe’ach. [T.N. This Psalm, Ps 51, teaches the doctrine of Chet Kadmon from which comes the seminal corrupting human condition necessitating hitkhadshut for all fallen Bnei Adam]

1.verse: (For the one directing. A maskil of Dovid. When Doeg HaAdomi [the Edomite] went to Sha’ul and said to him, Dovid has gone to Bais Achimelech). Why boastest thou thyself in ra’ah, O gibbor? The chesed El is kol hayom.

2.verse: The leshon (tongue) deviseth treachery; like a sharp ta’ar (razor), working remiyyah (deceit).

3.verse: Thou lovest rah more than tov; and sheker rather than to speak tzedek. Selah.

4.verse: Thou lovest all devouring words, O thou leshon mirmah (deceitful tongue).

5.verse: El shall likewise demolish thee for netzach (eternity), He shall break thee, and pluck thee out of thy ohel, and uproot thee out of the Eretz Chayyim. Selah.

6.verse: The tzaddikim also shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him:

7.verse: Hinei, this is the gever (man) that made not Elohim his ma’oz; but trusted in the abundance of his osher (riches), and strengthened himself in his treachery.

8.verse: But I am like a green zayit (olive tree) in the Beis Elohim; I trust in the chesed Elohim olam va’ed.

9.verse: I will give Thee thanks l’olam, because Thou hast done it; and I will wait on Shimecha; for it is tov before Thy chasidim.

1.verse: (For the one directing. According to ma’alot. Maskil of Dovid). The naval (fool) hath said in his lev, Ein Elohim (There is no G-d). Corrupt are they, and have done abominable iniquity; there is none that doeth tov.

2.verse: Elohim looked down from Shomayim upon Bnei Adam, to see if there were any of seichel, that did seek Elohim.

3.verse: Every one of them has fallen away; they are altogether perverse; there is none that doeth tov, no, not echad (one).

4.verse: Have the workers of iniquity no da’as? Who eat up My people as they eat lechem; they have not called upon Elohim.

5.verse: There were they in great pachad (fear), pachad such as never was; for Elohim hath scattered the atzmot of him that encampeth against thee; thou [Yisroel] hast put them to shame, because Elohim hath rejected them.

6.verse: Oh that the Yeshuat Yisroel would come out of Tziyon! When Elohim bringeth back the captivity of Amo (His people), Ya’akov shall rejoice, and Yisroel shall be glad.

1.verse: (For the director. With stringed instruments. A maskil. For Dovid, when the Ziphim came and said to Sha’ul, Dovid is in hiding among us.) Hoshieini (save me), O Elohim, by Shimecha, and vindicate me by Thy gevurah (might, power).

2.verse: Hear my tefillah, O Elohim; give ear to the words of my mouth.

3.verse: For zarim (strangers) are risen up against me, and oppressors seek after my nefesh; they have not set Elohim before them. Selah.

4.verse: Hinei, Elohim is mine Ozer (helper); Adonoi is with them that uphold my nefesh.

5.verse: He shall recompense the rah (evil) unto mine enemies; in Thy emes cut them off.

6.verse: I will sacrifice a nedavah (freewill offering) unto Thee; I will praise Shimecha, Hashem; for it is tov (good).

7.verse: For He hath delivered me out of all my tzoros; and mine eye hath looked in triumph upon mine oyevim (enemies.)

1.verse: (For the one directing. With Neginos. Maskil of Dovid) Give ear to my tefillah, O Elohim; and veil not Thyself from my techinnah (supplication).

2.verse: Attend unto me, and hear me; I wander restlessly in my si’ach (anxiety), and aloud I groan;

3.verse: Because of the voice of the oyev (enemy), because of the oppression of the rasha (evildoer); for they cast aven (iniquity) upon me, and in af (wrath, anger) cherish their malice against me.

4.verse: My lev writhes within me; and the terrors of mavet are fallen upon me.

5.verse: Yirah va’ra’ad (fear and trembling) are come upon me, and pallatzut (horror, shuddering) overwhelmed me.

6.verse: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a yonah! For then would I fly away and be at rest.

7.verse: Hinei, then would I flee far off and lodge in the midbar. Selah.

8.verse: I would hasten to my place of shelter from the ruach so’ah (wind of the tempest) and storm.

9.verse: Destroy, Adonoi, and confuse their leshon; for I see chamas (violence) and riv (strife) in the Ir (city, i.e., Jerusalem).

10.verse: Yomam and lailah they go about her [Yerushalayim] upon the chomot thereof; aven also and amal are in the midst of her [Yerushalayim].

11.verse: Ruin is in the midst thereof; oppression and mirmah (guile, fraud, deceit) depart not from her rechov.

12.verse: For it was not an oyev (enemy) that reproached me; then I could bear it; neither was it he that had sinah (hatred) for me that did exalt himself against me; then I could have hid myself from him;

13.verse: But it was thou, an enosh (a man) equally [valued with myself], my aluf (intimate, friend), and me’yuda’i (deep acquaintance, familiar friend, see Psalm 41:9)

14.verse: Together we took sweet sod (intimate conversation, fellowship, counsel), and walked unto the Beis Elohim with the throng.

15.verse: Let mavet seize upon them, and let them go down chayyim into Sheol; for ra’ot (evils) are in their dwellings, and among them.

16.verse: As for me, I will call upon Elohim; and Hashem shall save me.

17.verse: Erev, and boker, and at tzohorayim (noon), will I pray, and cry aloud; and He shall hear my kol (voice).

18.verse: He hath redeemed my nefesh in shalom from the battle that was against me; for there were rabbim against me.

19.verse: El (G-d) shall hear, and afflict them, even He that abideth kedem (of old, forever). Selah. Because they do not change, therefore they fear not Elohim.

20.verse: He [the faithless friend of verse 13-14] hath laid his hands on such as are at shalom with him; he hath broken his Brit.

21.verse: The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his lev; his devarim were softer than shemen, yet they were drawn swords.

22.verse: Cast thy burden upon Hashem, and He shall sustain thee; He shall never suffer the tzaddik to be moved.

23.verse: But Thou, O Elohim, shalt bring them down into the pit of shachat; anshei damim umirmah (bloody and deceitful men) shall not live out half their yamim; but I will trust in Thee.

1.verse: (For the director. Set to The Silent, Distant Yonah. Of Dovid. A mikhtam—when the Pelishtim seized him in Gat.) Chaneini (be merciful) unto me, O Elohim: for enosh (man) tramples upon me; kol hayom they press their attack against me.

2.verse: Mine adversaries kol hayom trample me; for they be rabbim that fight against me, Marom (Most High).

3.verse: What time I am afraid, I will trust in Thee.

4.verse: In Elohim I will praise His Word [See Yn 1:1,14]. In Elohim I have put my trust; I will not fear what basar can do unto me.

5.verse: Kol hayom they twist my words; all their machsh’vot (thoughts) are against me for rah (evil).

6.verse: They gather themselves together, they hide themselves, they are shomer over my steps, when they wait for my nefesh.

7.verse: Shall they escape by iniquity? In Thine anger cast down the amim (peoples), O Elohim.

8.verse: Thou hast acted as a sofer, recording my wanderings; put Thou my tears into Thy wineskin; are they not in Thy Sefer (Book)?

9.verse: On the day when I cry unto Thee, then shall mine oyevim turn back; of this I have da’as; for Elohim is for me [Ro 8:31].

10.verse: In Elohim will I praise His Word; in Hashem will I praise His Word [Yn 1:1; Mishlei 30:4; Ps 33:6; Mishlei 8:30].

11.verse: In Elohim have I put my trust; I will not be afraid. What can adam do unto me?

12.verse: Thy nederim are upon me, O Elohim; I will render todot (thank offerings) unto Thee.

13.verse: For Thou hast delivered my nefesh from mavet (death). Wilt not Thou deliver my feet from stumblimg, that I may walk before Elohim in the Ohr HaChayyim (the light of the living)?

1.verse: (For the one directing. Set to Do Not Destroy. Mikhtam of Dovid, when he had fled from Sha’ul into the me’arah [cave]). Channeni, O Elohim, channeni; for my nefesh taketh refuge in Thee; yes, in the tzel (shadow) of Thy wings will I make my refuge, until these devastations pass by.

2.verse: I will cry out unto Elohim Elyon; unto El that fulfilleth all things for me.

3.verse: He shall send from Shomayim, and save me from the disgrace of him that would swallow me up. Selah. Elohim shall send forth His chesed (lovingkindness) and His emes (truth).

4.verse: My nefesh is among lions, and I lie even among them that devour Bnei Adam, whose shinayim (teeth) are spears and khitzim (arrows), and their leshon a sharp cherev.

5.verse: Be Thou exalted, O Elohim, above Shomayim; let Thy kavod be above kol ha’aretz.

6.verse: They have prepared a reshet (net) for my steps; my nefesh is bowed down; they have dug a pit before me, into the midst whereof they are fallen themselves. Selah.

7.verse: My lev is nachon (steadfast), O Elohim, my lev is nachon; I will sing and make music.

8.verse: Awake, my kavod (glory, soul, life); awake, nevel and kinnor; I myself will awake the shachar (dawn).

9.verse: I will give thanks unto Thee, Adonoi, among the peoples; I will sing of Thee among the peoples.

10.verse: For Thy chesed is gadol unto Shomayim, and Thy emes unto the heights.

11.verse: Be Thou exalted, O Elohim, above Shomayim; let Thy kavod be above kol ha’aretz (all the earth).

1.verse: (For the one directing. Set to Do Not Destroy. Mikhtam Dovid). Do ye indeed decree tzedek, O elim (g-ds, Ex 22:28[27])? Do ye judge uprightly the Bnei Adam?

2.verse: No, in lev (heart) ye work wickedness; ye weigh out the chamas (violence) of your hands in Ha’Aretz.

3.verse: The resha’im are perverted from the rekhem (womb); gone astray from birth are they, speaking kazav (lie, falsehood).

4.verse: Their venom is like the venom of a nachash; they are like the deaf adder that stoppeth its ear;

5.verse: That it may not pay heed to the voice of charmers, casting spells ever so cunningly.

6.verse: Break their teeth, O Elohim, in their mouth; tear out the fangs of the young lions, Hashem.

7.verse: Let them melt away like draining mayim; when he bendeth his bow to shoot his khitzim (arrows), let them be crumbled to pieces.

8.verse: As a snail which melteth, let every one of them pass away; like the stillborn child of an isha, that they may not see the shemesh.

9.verse: Before your sirot (pots) can feel the burning thorns, may He with a whirlwind blow them away, both green and dry alike.

10.verse: The tzaddik shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance; he shall wash feet in the dahm harasha.

11.verse: So that adam shall say, Verily there is a reward for the tzaddik; verily yesh Elohim Shofetim ba’aretz (there is a G-d that judgeth in the earth).

1.verse: (For the one directing. Set to Do Not Destroy. Mikhtam Dovid. When Sha’ul sent and they watched [Dovid’s] bais to kill him) Save me from mine enemies, O Elohai; protect me from them that rise up against me.

2.verse: Deliver me from the po’alei aven (workers of iniquity), and save me from anshei damim (bloody men).

3.verse: For, hinei, they lie in wait for my nefesh; the fierce stir up strife against me; not for my peysha, nor for my chattat, Hashem.

4.verse: They run and prepare themselves without my avon (wrong, fault); awake to help me, and see.

5.verse: Thou therefore, Hashem Elohim Tzva’os, Elohei Yisroel, rouse Thyself to visit [in punishment] kol HaGoyim; be not merciful to any bogedei aven (wicked boged [traitor]). Selah.

6.verse: They return at erev; they growl like a kelev (dog), and prowl around the Ir.

7.verse: Hinei, they belch out with their mouth; charavot (swords) are in their sfatot (lips); for who, say they, doth hear?

8.verse: But Thou, Hashem, shalt laugh at them; Thou shalt have all the Goyim in derision.

9.verse: O my Strength, I will be shomer to watch for Thee; for Elohim is my stronghold.

10.verse: The G-d of my chesed shall come to meet me; Elohim shall let me see [the end] of my shorer (watchers, [i.e., slandering foes insidiously fixated on me and lying in wait]).

11.verse: Slay them not, lest my people forget; scatter them by Thy power; and bring them down, Adonoi mogineinu (our Shield).

12.verse: For the chattat of their mouth and the davar of their sfatayim let them even be caught in their ga’on (pride); and for the cursing and lying which they speak.

13.verse: Consume them in chemah (wrath), consume them, till they are no more; and let them know that Elohim ruleth in Ya’akov unto the ends of ha’aretz. Selah.

14.verse: And at erev let them return; and let them growl like a kelev, and prowl around the Ir.

15.verse: Let them wander up and down for okhel (food), and howl if they be not satisfied.

16.verse: But I will sing of Thy oz; yes, I will sing aloud of Thy chesed in the boker; for Thou hast been my stronghold and refuge in the day of my tzoros.

17.verse: Unto Thee, O my Strength, will I sing; for Elohim is my strongold, and the Elohim of my chesed.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Set to The Shushan of the Edut. Mikhtam Dovid to instruct. When he fought Aram Naharayim and Aram Tzovah and when Yo’av returned and struck down 12,000 of Edom in the Gey Melach.) O Elohim, Thou hath rejected us, scattered us; Thou hast been angry; O restore us!

2.verse: Thou hast made eretz to tremble; Thou hast torn it asunder, heal the fractures thereof; for it tottereth.

3.verse: Thou hast showed Thy people kashah (hard times); Thou hast made us to drink the yayin of tarelah (bewilderment, reeling).

4.verse: Thou hast set up a nes (banner) to them that fear Thee, that it may be unfurled on account of the truth. Selah.

5.verse: That Thy Yedidot (beloved ones) may be saved; save with Thy Yamin (Right Hand) and hear me.

6.verse: Elohim hath spoken in His Kodesh (Holiness); I will exult, I will parcel Shechem as chelek, and measure out the Valley of Sukkot.

7.verse: Gil‘ad is Mine, and Menasheh is Mine; Ephrayim also is the ma’oz of Mine Rosh; Yehudah is My Mekhokek (prescriber of laws, lawgiver; see Gn 49:10; Isa 42:4 on Moshiach’s torah).

8.verse: Moav is My washpot; over Edom will I cast My sandal; over Philistia I shout in triumph.

9.verse: Who will bring me to the Ir Matzon (city of fortification)? Who will bring me to Edom?

10.verse: Wilt not Thou, O Elohim, which hadst cast us off? And Thou, O Elohim, which didst not go out with tzivoteinu (our armies)?

11.verse: Give us help against the enemy; for vain is the teshuat adam (help, salvation of or from Man).

12.verse: In Elohim shall we obtain the victory; for He it is that shall tread down tzareinu (our enemies, oppressors).

1.verse: (For the one directing. With stringed instruments. Of Dovid). Hear my cry, Elohim; attend unto my tefillah.

2.verse: From the end of ha’aretz will I call unto Thee, when my lev is overwhelmed; lead me to the Tzur that is higher than I.

3.verse: For Thou hast been a refuge for me, and a migdal oz (tower of strength) from the enemy.

4.verse: I will abide in Thy ohel forever; I will take refuge in the covert of Thy wings. Selah.

5.verse: For Thou, Elohim, hast heard my nederim; Thou hast given me the yerushat yirei Shemecha (inheritance of those that fear Thy Name).

6.verse: Thou wilt prolong days of the Melech, and his shanot dor vador.

7.verse: He shall abide before Elohim forever; O appoint chesed and emes, to preserve him.

8.verse: So will I sing praise unto Shimecha forever, that I may yom yom (daily) perform my nederim.

1.verse: (For the one directing. According to Yedutun. Mizmor of Dovid.) Truly my nefesh waiteth silently [in submission] upon Elohim; from Him cometh my Yeshuah (salvation).

2.verse: Truly He is my Tzur and my Yeshuah (salvation); He is my stronghold; I shall not be greatly shaken.

3.verse: How long will ye rush to attack an ish? To thrust at, all of you, as at a leaning kir (wall), and as at a tottering gader (fence).

4.verse: Truly they consult to bring down a person of prominence; they delight in kazav (lie, falsehood, deceptive thing); they make a brocha with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.

5.verse: Truly in Elohim wait silently [in submission], my nefesh, for my tikvah (hope) is from Him.

6.verse: Truly He is my Tzur and my Yeshuah (salvation); He is my stronghold; I shall not be shaken.

7.verse: In Elohim is my salvation and my Kavod: the Tzur of my strength, and my refuge, is in Elohim.

8.verse: Trust in Him at all time; ye people, pour out your lev before Him; Elohim is a refuge for us. Selah.

9.verse: Truly Bnei Adam (those of low estate) are hevel (vanity), and Bnei Ish (those who are highborn) are kazav (a lie); they go up in the balances; they are altogether lighter than hevel (vanity).

10.verse: Trust not in oshek (oppression, extortion) and become not vain in gazel (the thing taken as plunder); if riches increase, set not your lev upon them.

11.verse: Elohim hath spoken once; twice have I heard this; that oz (strength) belongeth unto Elohim.

12.verse: Also unto Thee, Adonoi, belongeth chesed; for Thou renderest to ish (every man) according to his ma’asim (deeds).

1.verse: (Mizmor Dovid. When he was in the midbar Yehudah). O Elohim, Thou art Eli; early will I seek Thee; my nefesh thirsteth for Thee; my basar longeth for Thee in a dry and thirsty land, where no mayim is;

2.verse: To see Thy oz (might, power) and Thy kavod, as I have beheld Thee in the Kodesh (holy place, sanctuary).

3.verse: Because Thy chesed is better than chayyim, my lips shall praise Thee.

4.verse: Thus will I bless Thee while I live; I will lift up my hands b’Shimcha (in Thy Name.)

5.verse: My nefesh shall be satisfied as with chelev (fat) and deshen (abundance); and my mouth shall praise Thee with lips of joyful singing;

6.verse: When I remember Thee upon my bed, and meditate on Thee in the ashmurot (night watches).

7.verse: Because Thou hast been my help, therefore in the tzel (shadow) of Thy wings will I sing with joy.

8.verse: My nefesh followeth hard after Thee; Thy Yamin (Right Hand) upholdeth me.

9.verse: But those that seek my nefesh, to destroy it, shall go into the abysses of ha’aretz.

10.verse: They deliver him into the power of the cherev; they shall be a portion for jackals.

11.verse: But HaMelech shall rejoice in Elohim; every one that sweareth by Him shall glory; but the mouth of them that speak sheker shall be stopped.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Mizmor of Dovid). Hear my voice, O Elohim, in my si’akh (complaint); preserve my life from the pachad (terror) of the oyev (enemy).

2.verse: Hide me from the sod (secret counsel, conspiracy) of the re’im; from the rigshah (insurrection, noisy crowd, assembly) of the workers of iniquity;

3.verse: Who whet their tongue like a cherev, and aim their khitzim (arrows), even davar mar (bitter words);

4.verse: That they may shoot in secret at the tam (innoent); pitom (suddenly) do they shoot at him, and fear not.

5.verse: They encourage themselves in a davar rah (an evil plan); they speak in order to set mokshim (snares, hidden traps); they say, Who shall see them?

6.verse: Or search out their iniquities? They have accomplished a cunningly devised plot; for the mind of ish (man) and the lev (heart) are deep,

7.verse: But Elohim shall shoot at them with a khetz (arrow); pitom (suddenly) shall their wounds be.

8.verse: So the leshon of them will bring ruin upon them; all that see them shall shake their head.

9.verse: And kol adam shall fear, and shall declare the po’al Elohim (work of G-d); for they shall ponder His ma’aseh.

10.verse: The tzaddik shall be glad in Hashem, and shall take refuge in Him; and all the yishrei lev (upright of heart) shall glory.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Mizmor Dovid. Shir). Tehillah (praise) is due Thee, O Elohim, in Tziyon; And unto Thee shall the neder (vow) be performed.

2.verse: O Thou that hearest tefillah (prayer), unto Thee shall kol basar come.

3.verse: Divrei avonot (instances of iniquity) overwhelm me; as for peysha’einu (our transgressions), Thou hast made kapporah for them.

4.verse: Ashrei is the one whom Thou choosest, and causest to come near unto Thee, that he may dwell in Thy khatzerot; we shall be satisfied with the tov of Thy Beis, even of Thy Heikhal Kodesh.

5.verse: By nora’ot (awesome deeds, awe-inspiring things) of tzedek (justice) wilt Thou answer us, O Elohei Yish’einu (G-d of our salvation); Who art the hope of all the ends of eretz, and of them that are on the farthest seas;

6.verse: Which by His ko’ach established the harim (mountains), being girded with gevurah;

7.verse: Which stilleth the roar of the seas, the roar of their waves, and the tumult of the Amim (peoples, nations).

8.verse: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at Thy otot (signs); Thou makest the outgoing exits of boker and erev to resound with joy.

9.verse: Thou visitest ha’aretz, and waterest it; Thou greatly enrichest it with the peleg Elohim (fountain of G-d), which is full of mayim; Thou preparest them dagan (grain), for so Thou didst prepare it.

10.verse: Thou waterest the furrows thereof abundantly; Thou settlest the ridges thereof; Thou makest it soft with showers; Thou blessest the tzemach (sprout, branch, see Zech 6:12) thereof.

11.verse: Thou crownest shnat tovatecha (the year with Thy goodness, bounty); and Thy paths drip with plenty.

12.verse: They drip upon the pastures of the midbar; and the hills are enrobed with gladness.

13.verse: The meadows are clothed with tzon; the amakim (valleys) also are covered over with grain; they shout for joy, they also sing.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Shir. Mizmor.) Make a joyful shout unto Elohim, kol HaAretz;

2.verse: Sing forth the kavod Shmo; make kavod (glorious) His tehillah (praise).

3.verse: Say unto Elohim, How norah (awesome) art Thou in Thy ma’asim (works)! Through the greatness of Thy oz (might) shall Thine oyevim cower before Thee.

4.verse: Kol ha’aretz shall prostrate before Thee, and shall sing unto Thee; they shall sing praise to Shimecha. Selah.

5.verse: Come and see the works of Elohim; He is norah (awesome) in deed toward Bnei Adam.

6.verse: He turned the yam into yabashah (dry land; see Gn 1:10); they passed through the nahar on regel; there did we rejoice in Him.

7.verse: He ruleth by His gevurah (power) olam (forever); His eyes are a watchman’s eyes over the Goyim; let not the sorerim (rebellious ones) exalt themselves. Selah.

8.verse: Barchu Eloheinu, Amim, and make the kol (sound) of His tehillah (praise) to be heard.

9.verse: He is the One who set nafsheinu in chayyim and does not permit ragleinu (our foot) to slip.

10.verse: For Thou, Elohim, hath tested us and hast proved us; Thou hast put us in the crucible’s refining and refined us as kesef.

11.verse: Thou broughtest us into the metzudah (prison); Thou laidst a mu’akah (burden) upon our loins.

12.verse: Thou hast caused enosh (mankind) to ride over rosheinu (our head); we went through eish and through mayim; but Thou broughtest us out into plenty.

13.verse: I will come into Thy Beis [HaMikdash] with olot; I will fulfill for Thee my nedarim,

14.verse: Which my sfatayim have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in tzoros.

15.verse: I will offer unto Thee olot mekhim (burnt offerings of fat animals), with the ketoret (incense, offering) of rams; I will offer bakar with goats. Selah.

16.verse: Come and hear, Kol Yirei Elohim, and I will declare what He hath done for my nefesh.

17.verse: I cried unto Him with my mouth, and He was extolled with my leshon.

18.verse: If I regard avon (iniquity, sin) in my lev, Adonoi will not hear me;

19.verse: But surely Elohim hath heard me; He hath attended to the kol tefillati (voice of my prayer).

20.verse: Baruch Elohim, Who hath not turned away my tefillah, nor His chesed from me.

1.verse: (For the one directing. On Neginot. With stringed instruments. Mizmor. Shir.) Elohim be channun (gracious) unto us, and put a brocha upon us; and may He make His face to shine upon us. Selah.

2.verse: That Thy Derech may be known upon HaAretz, Thy Yeshuah (salvation) among kol Goyim.

3.verse: Let the Amim praise Thee, O Elohim; let kol Amim praise Thee.

4.verse: O let the peoples be glad and sing for joy, for Thou shalt judge the people righteously, and govern the peoples upon HaAretz. Selah.

5.verse: Let the people praise Thee, O Elohim; let kol Amim praise Thee.

6.verse: Then shall eretz yield her yevul (increase, produce, harvest); and Elohim, even Eloheinu, shall put a brocha upon us.

7.verse: Elohim shall bless us; and kol afsei aretz (all the ends of the earth) shall fear Him.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Of Dovid. Mizmor. Shir.) Let Elohim arise, let His oyevim be scattered; let them also that hate Him flee before Him.

2.verse: As ashan (smoke) is blown away, so drive them away; as wax melteth before the eish, so let the resha’im perish at the presence of Elohim.

3.verse: But let the tzaddikim have simchah; let them rejoice before Elohim; and, let them rejoice with simchah.

4.verse: Sing unto Elohim, sing praises to Shmo; extol Him that rideth on the clouds by Shmo Hashem, and rejoice before Him.

5.verse: Avi yetomim (father of orphans), and a dayan (judge) of almanot (widows), is Elohim in His Ma’on Kodesh.

6.verse: Elohim setteth the yechidim (alone ones) in a family; He bringeth out those which are asirim (prisoners, those bound with chains); but the sorerim (rebels) dwell in a dry land.

7.verse: O Elohim, when Thou wentest forth before Thy people, when Thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah;

8.verse: Eretz shook, Shomayim also poured rain at the presence of Elohim; even Sinai itself was moved at the presence of Elohim, Elohei Yisroel.

9.verse: Thou, O Elohim, didst send a plentiful geshem (rain), whereby Thou didst restore Thine nachalah, when it was parched.

10.verse: Thy congregation hath dwelt therein; Thou, O Elohim, hast prepared of Thy bounty for the oni.

11.verse: Adonoi gave the word; rav (great) was the tzava (company, army) of the mevaserot (heralds, those that published it, the lady evangelists).

12.verse: Melachim of tzeva’ot (armies) shall flee, they flee; and she that tarried at home shall divide the plunder.

13.verse: Though ye have lain among the cooking pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a yonah covered with kesef, and her feathers with glistening gold.

14.verse: When Shaddai scattered melachim therein, it was white as snow in Tzalmon.

15.verse: The Har Elohim is the Har Bashan; a mountain of peaks is the Har Bashan.

16.verse: Why gaze ye in envy, ye many-peaked harim? This is the har which Elohim hath chosen to dwell in; indeed, Hashem will dwell in it lanetzach (forever).

17.verse: The merkavot of Elohim are myriads, a thousand thousands; Adonoi is among them, as in Sinai, in kodesh (holiness).

18.verse: Thou hast ascended on marom (high), Thou hast led captivity captive; Thou hast received mattanot among adam; yes, even from the sorerim (the rebellious) also, that Hashem Elohim might dwell [there].

19.verse: Baruch Adonoi, Who yom yom bears us up, even HaEl Yeshuateinu (the G-d of our salvation). Selah.

20.verse: Our G-d is a G-d who saves; and from Hashem Adonoi come escapes from mavet (death).

21.verse: But Elohim shall shatter the rosh of His oyevim, and the hairy kodkod (crown of the head, scalp) of such a one as continueth on in his trespasses.

22.verse: Adonoi said, I will bring back from Bashan, I will bring back from the depths of the sea;

23.verse: That thy regel may be bathed in dahm, that the leshon of thy klavim (dogs) may partake of the oyevim.

24.verse: They have seen Thy processions, O Elohim; even the goings of my G-d, my Melech, in the Kodesh.

25.verse: The sharim (singers) went before, the nogenim (players on instruments) followed after; among them were the alamot (young unmarried virgins) playing timbrels.

26.verse: Barchu Elohim in the congregations, even Hashem, out of the Makor Yisroel (Fountain of Israel).

27.verse: There is Binyamin, the youngest at the head; the sarim (princes) of Yehudah and the throng of them, the sarim (princes) of Zevulun, and the sarim (princes) of Naphtali.

28.verse: Eloheicha hath commanded thy oz; strengthen, O Elohim, that which Thou hast wrought for us.

29.verse: Because of Thy Heikhal at Yerushalayim shall melachim bring offerings unto Thee.

30.verse: Rebuke the company of spearmen, the adat (herd) of bulls, with the agalim (calves) of the nations, till every one prostrate himself with ingots of kesef; He scatters the people that delight in wars.

31.verse: Magnates shall come out of Mitzrayim; Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands unto Elohim.

32.verse: Sing unto Elohim, ye mamlechot of ha’aretz; O sing praises unto Adonoi. Selah.

33.verse: To Him that rideth upon the skies of Shomayim of old; lo, He doth send out His voice, and that a kol oz (mighty voice).

34.verse: Ascribe ye oz (power) unto Elohim; His majesty is over Yisroel, and His oz is in the skies.

35.verse: O Elohim, Thou art norah (awesome, terrible) out of Thy Mikdashim; the El (G-d) of Yisroel is He that giveth oz and strength unto His people. Baruch Elohim.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Al Shoshanim. Of Dovid.) Hoshi’eini, O Elohim; for the mayim are come unto my nefesh (i.e., neck).

2.verse: I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing; I am come into the depths of the mayim, where the floods overflow me.

3.verse: I am weary of my crying out; my garon (throat) is dry; mine eyes fail while I wait for Elohai.

4.verse: They that have sinas chinom (baseless hatred) toward me are more than the hairs of mine rosh; they that would destroy me, being mine oyevim (enemies) sheker (baselessly) are mighty; then I restored that which I did not steal.

5.verse: O Elohim, Thou knowest my folly; and my ashmot (guiltinesses) are not hid from Thee.

6.verse: Let not them that wait on Thee, Adonoi Hashem Tzva’os, be ashamed because of me; let not those that seek Thee be disgraced because of me, O Elohei Yisroel.

7.verse: Because for Thy sake I have borne cherpah; shame hath covered my face.

8.verse: I am become a stranger unto my achim, and a nochri (foreigner) unto the bnei immi (sons of my mother).

9.verse: For kinas Beitcha (zeal for Thy House) hath consumed me; and the cherpot of them that scorned Thee are fallen upon me [Yn 2:17].

10.verse: When I wept, and chastened my nefesh in the tzom (fast), that became my cherpot (reproaches).

11.verse: I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a mashal (byword) to them.

12.verse: They that sit [as judges] in the sha’ar (gate) speak against me; and I was the neginot (drinking songs) of the drunkards.

13.verse: But as for me, may my tefillah be unto Thee, Hashem, in an et ratzon (acceptable time, time of favor); O Elohim, in the multitude of Thy chesed hear me, in the emes of Thy salvation.

14.verse: Save me out of the teet (mire, clay, soil) and let me not sink; let me be saved from them that hate me, and out of the depths of the mayim.

15.verse: Let not the floodwaters overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the be’er (pit) shut her mouth upon me.

16.verse: Hear me, Hashem, for Thy chesed is tov; turn unto me according to the multitude of Thy rachamim;

17.verse: And hide not Thy face from Thy eved; for I am in tzoros. Hear me speedily.

18.verse: Draw near unto my nefesh, and make the go’el redemption of it; deliver me because of mine oyevim (enemies).

19.verse: Thou hast known the cherpah (scorn) I bear, and my shame, and my dishonor; mine adversaries are all before Thee.

20.verse: Reproach hath broken my lev; and I have sickness as unto death; and I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; and for menachamim (comforters), but I found none.

21.verse: They gave me also gall in my food; and in my tzamah (thirst) they gave me chometz (vinegar) to drink [See Mt.27:34,48; Mk.15:23,36; Lk.23:36 Yn.19:28-30 OJBC].

22.verse: Let their shulchan become a pach (snare, trap) before them; and that which should have been for their shlomim (peacefulnesses), let it become a mokesh (trap).

23.verse: Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their loins shake tamid.

24.verse: Pour out Thine indignation upon them, and let Thy charon af (burning wrath) overtake them.

25.verse: Let their habitation be desolate; and let none dwell in their ohalim [See Ac 1:20 OJBC].

26.verse: For they persecute him whom Thou hast struck; and they tell of the makh’ov (pain, grief) of those whom Thou hast wounded.

27.verse: Add avon (iniquity) unto their avon; and let them not come into Thy tzedakah.

28.verse: Let them be blotted out of the Sefer Chayyim, and not be recorded with the tzaddikim.

29.verse: But I am ani (poor) and in pain; let Thy Yeshuah (salvation), O Elohim, set me up on high.

30.verse: I will praise Shem Elohim b’shir (in song), and will magnify Him with todah (thanksgiving).

31.verse: This also shall please Hashem better than shor (ox) or bull that hath keren (horn) and parsah (hoof).

32.verse: Those that have anavah (meekness, humility) shall see this, and have simchah; and your [pl.] lev shall live that seek Elohim.

33.verse: For Hashem heareth the evyonim (needy ones, poor), and despiseth not His prisoners.

34.verse: Let the Shomayim v’Aretz praise Him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.

35.verse: For Elohim yoshi’a (will save) Tziyon, and will build the cities of Yehudah; that they may dwell there, and have it in possession.

36.verse: The zera also of His avadim shall inherit it; and they that love Shmo shall dwell therein.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Mizmor of Dovid. For the memorial portion of the minchah) Make haste, Elohim, to deliver me; make haste to help me, Hashem.

2.verse: Let them have bushah and be confounded that seek my nefesh; let them be turned back, and be put to confusion, that desire my hurt.

3.verse: Let them be turned back for a reward of their bushah that say, Aha, aha.

4.verse: Let all those that seek Thee rejoice and have simcha in Thee; and let such as love Thy Yeshuah (salvation) say continually, Let Elohim be magnified.

5.verse: But I am poor and needy; make haste unto me, Elohim; Thou art my help and my deliverer. Hashem, make no delay.

1.verse: In Thee, Hashem, do I put my trust; let me not be put to shame l’olam.

2.verse: Deliver me in Thy tzedakah, and cause me to escape; incline Thine ear unto me, and hoshi’eini (save me).

3.verse: Be Thou Tzur Ma’on (a rock of habitation), whereunto I may resort tamid (continually); Thou hast given commandment to save me; for Thou art my rock and my fortress.

4.verse: Deliver me, O Elohai, out of the yad of the rasha, out of the palm of the unrighteous and cruel man.

5.verse: For Thou art my tikveh (hope), Adonoi Hashem; Thou art my trust from my youth.

6.verse: By Thee have I been upheld from the beten (womb); Thou art He that took me out of the womb of immi; my tehillah (praise) shall be of Thee tamid (continually).

7.verse: I am as a mofet (portent) unto rabbim (many); but Thou art my strong refuge.

8.verse: Let my mouth be filled with Thy tehillah (praise) and with Thy tiferet (glory) kol hayom.

9.verse: Cast me not off in the time of ziknah (old age); forsake me not when my ko’ach faileth.

10.verse: For mine oyevim speak against me; and they that lay in wait for my nefesh conspire together,

11.verse: Saying, Elohim hath forsaken him; persecute and lay hold of him; for there is none to rescue him.

12.verse: O Elohim, be not far from me; O Elohai, make haste for my help.

13.verse: Let them be ashamed and consumed that are [satanic] adversaries to my nefesh; let them be covered with cherpah (reproach) and dishonor that seek my hurt.

14.verse: But I will hope tamid (continually), and will yet give tehillah to Thee more and more.

15.verse: My mouth shall proclaim Thy tzedakah and Thy Teshuah (salvation) kol hayom; for I know not the limits thereof.

16.verse: I will come in the gevurot (mighty acts) of Adonoi Hashem; I will make mention of Thy tzedakah, even of Thine only.

17.verse: O Elohim, Thou hast taught me from my youth; and hitherto have I declared Thy nifle’ot (wondrous works).

18.verse: Now also when I am in ziknah (old age) and grayheaded, O Elohim, forsake me not; until I have declared Thy zero’a [Moshiach; see Isa 53:1] unto this generation, and Thy gevurah to everyone that is to come.

19.verse: Thy tzedakah also, O Elohim, is ad marom (to the heights). Thou Who hast done gedolot (great things); O Elohim, mi khamocha (who is like unto Thee)?

20.verse: Thou, which hast showed me great and severe tzoros, shalt revive me again, and shalt bring me up again from the tehomot (abysses) of ha’aretz.

21.verse: Thou shalt increase my gedolah, and comfort me on every side.

22.verse: I will also praise Thee with the nevel (lyre), even Thy emes, O Elohai; unto Thee will I sing with the kinnor (harp), O Thou Kadosh Yisroel.

23.verse: My lips shall shout for joy when I sing unto Thee; and my nefesh, which Thou hast purchased for redemption.

24.verse: My leshon also shall tell of Thy tzedakah kol hayom; for they are brought unto shame, they are humiliated that seek my hurt.

1.verse: (Of Sh’lomo). Give HaMelech Thy mishpatim, O Elohim, and Thy tzedakah unto the Ben Melech.

2.verse: He shall judge Thy people with tzedek, and Thy poor with mishpat.

3.verse: The harim (mountains) shall bear shalom to the people, and geva’ot (hills) in tzedakah.

4.verse: He shall judge the poor of the people; yoshia (He shall save) the bnei evyon (children of the needy), and shall break in pieces the oppressor.

5.verse: They shall fear Thee as long as the shemesh and yarei’ach endure, dor dorim (throughout all generations).

6.verse: He shall come down like matar (rain) upon the mown field, as showers watering eretz.

7.verse: In his yamim shall the tzaddik flourish; and abundance of shalom so long as the yarei’ach endureth.

8.verse: He [Moshiach Ben Dovid] shall have dominion also from yam to yam, and from nahar (river) unto the afsei eretz (the ends of the earth).

9.verse: They that dwell in the desert shall bow before him; and his oyevim (enemies) shall lick the aphar (dust).

10.verse: The melachim of Tarshish and of the iyim (islands) shall bring minchah (tribute); the melachim of Sheva and Seva shall offer gifts.

11.verse: Kol melachim shall fall down before him [Moshiach]; kol Goyim shall serve him.

12.verse: For he shall deliver the evyon (needy) when he crieth; the oni (poor, afflicted) also, and him that hath no ozer (helper).

13.verse: He shall pity the weak and evyon (needy), and yoshi’a (he shall save) the nefashot of the evyonim (needy).

14.verse: He shall be the Go’el Redeemer of their nefesh from deceit and chamas; and precious shall their dahm be in his sight.

15.verse: And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the zahav of Sheva; and prayer shall be for him continually; and daily shall a brocha be made on him.

16.verse: There shall be an abundance of grain on ha’aretz upon the top of the harim (mountains); the fruit thereof shall shake [in the trees like in] Levanon; and they of the city shall flourish like esev ha’aretz.

17.verse: Shmo (His Name) shall endure l’olam; Shmo shall be continued as long as the shemesh; and men shall be blessed in him; kol Goyim shall call him blessed.

18.verse: Baruch Hashem Elohim, Elohei Yisroel, who only doeth nifla’ot (wondrous things).

19.verse: And baruch Shem kevodo l’olam (and blessed be His Glorious Name forever); and let the whole earth be filled with His glory. Omein, and Omein.

20.verse: The tefillot Dovid Ben Yishai are ended. [T.N. The next Psalm concerns a revelation received in the Holy Place, namely the fate of the wicked whose prosperity is delusional since the riches of G-d’s house is wealth they can never attain to, revealing their true eternal poverty. See Ps 73:24 on afterlife in G-d’s presence.]

1.verse: (Mizmor of Asaph). Truly Elohim is tov to Yisroel, even to the barei levav (pure of heart).

2.verse: But as for me, my raglayim had almost stumbled; my steps had well near slipped.

3.verse: For I had kina (envy) of the holelim (arrogant ones), when I saw the shalom of the resha’im.

4.verse: For there are no chartzubot (fetters, bonds, pains) in their mot; healthy is their belly.

5.verse: They are not in amal (trouble) as enosh; neither are they plagued like adam.

6.verse: Therefore ga’avah encircleth them like a chain necklace; chamas enwraps them like a garment.

7.verse: Their eyes bulge with chelev; they have more than levav could imagine.

8.verse: They mock, and speak wickedly concerning oshek (oppression); they speak from marom (on high).

9.verse: They set their mouth against Shomayim, and their leshon stalketh in ha’aretz.

10.verse: Therefore their people return here; and mayim to the full are swallowed down by them.

11.verse: And they say, How doth El (G-d) know? And is there knowledge in Elyon?

12.verse: Hinei, these are the resha’im; at ease olam, they increase in riches.

13.verse: Surely in vain have I cleansed my lev, and washed my hands in innocency.

14.verse: For kol hayom have I been plagued, and chastened in the bekarim (mornings).

15.verse: If I say, I will speak thus; hinei, I would have dealt faithlessly with the dor banecha (the generation of Thy children).

16.verse: When I thought to comprehend this, it was amal (difficulty) in my eyes;

17.verse: Until I went into the Mikdeshei El; then I had binah (understanding) of their (the wicked’s) destiny.

18.verse: Surely Thou didst set them in slippery places; Thou castedst them down into mashu’ot (ruins, destruction).

19.verse: How are they brought into desolation, as in a rega (moment)! They are utterly consumed with balahot (terrors).

20.verse: As a chalom when one awaketh; so, Adonoi, when Thou art aroused [in judgment], Thou shalt despise their tzelem (shadowy form).

21.verse: Thus my levav was grieved, and I was pricked in my mind.

22.verse: So senseless was I, and ignorant; I was like behemot before Thee.

23.verse: Nevertheless I am with Thee tamid (always); Thou hast taken hold of me by my yamin.

24.verse: Thou shalt guide me with Thy etzah (counsel), and afterward take me to kavod (glory).

25.verse: Whom have I in Shomayim but Thee? And there is none upon HaAretz that I desire beside Thee.

26.verse: My flesh and my levav may fail; but Elohim is the Tzur of my levav, and my chelek l’olam.

27.verse: For, hinei, they that are far from Thee shall perish; Thou hast destroyed all them that go zoneh (a-whoring) from Thee.

28.verse: But kiravat Elohim (drawing near to Elohim) is tov for me; I make in Adonoi Hashem my refuge, that I may declare all Thy deeds.

1.verse: (A Maskil of Asaph) O Elohim, why hast Thou cast us off lanetzach? Why doth Thine anger smoke against the tzon (sheep) of Thy mireh (pasture)?

2.verse: Remember Thy Edah (congregation), which Thou hast purchased of old; the shevet (tribe) of Thine nachalah, which Thou hast redeemed: this Har Tziyon, wherein Thou hast dwelt.

3.verse: Lift up Thy footsteps unto the mashu’ot netzach (perpetual ruins); even all that the oyev hath done wickedly in the Kodesh [the Beis HaMikdash].

4.verse: Thine enemies roar in the midst of Thy Mo’ed (place of meeting); they set up their banners for otot (signs, i.e., their heathen insignia).

5.verse: It had been as though one lifted up kardumim (axes) upon the thicket of etz.

6.verse: But now they break down the carved panels [of the Beis HaMikdash] at once with hammers and chisels.

7.verse: They have set ablaze Thy Mikdash, burning it to the ground; they have brought chillul to the Mishkan Shemecha (the dwelling place of Thy Name).

8.verse: They said in their hearts, Let us crush them altogether; they have burned up all the Mo’adei El in HaAretz.

9.verse: We see not our otot (signs); there is no longer any navi; neither is there among us any that knoweth ad mah (until when).

10.verse: O Elohim ad mosai, (how long) shall the adversary revile? Shall the oyev (enemy) blaspheme Thy Shem lanetzach (forever)?

11.verse: Why withdrawest Thou Thy Yad, even Thy Yamin (Right Hand)? Take it out of Thy Kheyk (bosom) and destroy [them].

12.verse: For Elohim is my Melech mikedem (from of old), working Yeshuah (salvation) in the midst of Ha’Aretz.

13.verse: Thou didst divide the yam by Thy oz (power); Thou didst break the heads of the sea serpents in the waters.

14.verse: Thou didst break the head of Leviathan in pieces, and gavest him to be ma’akhal (food) to the people inhabiting the wilderness.

15.verse: Thou didst break open the fountain and the flood; Thou driedst up mighty naharot (rivers).

16.verse: The yom is Thine, the lailah also is Thine; Thou hast prepared the ma’ohr (luminary, moon) and the shemesh.

17.verse: Thou hast set all the boundaries of Eretz; Thou hast made kayitz (summer) and choref (winter).

18.verse: Remember this, that the oyev (enemy) hath reproached Hashem, and that the am naval (foolish people) have blasphemed Shimcha.

19.verse: O deliver not the nefesh of Thy turtledove unto the wild beast; forget not the life of Thy aniyim (poor) lanetzach (forever).

20.verse: Have regard unto the Brit (covenant); for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of chamas.

21.verse: O let not the oppressed return in shame; let the oni and evyon praise Thy Shem.

22.verse: Arise, O Elohim, fight for Thine Own cause; remember how the naval (foolish man) revileth Thee kol hayom.

23.verse: Forget not the kol (voice) of Thine enemies, the tumult of those against Thee that rises up tamid (continually). [T.N. Cf Lk 2:23-24 and Ps 74:19 remembering that the turtledove was the sacrifice of the poor, which Moshiach would be, not a rich man but ani, according to Zech 9:9.]

1.verse: (For the one directing. Set to Do Not Destroy. Mizmor Asaph. Shir) Hodinu l’cha Elohim (Unto thee, Elohim, do we give thanks). Hodinu; that Thy Shem is near Thy wondrous works declare.

2.verse: I shall seize the mo’ed (appointed time, Chabakuk 2:3) I will judge uprightly.

3.verse: Eretz and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolving; I, even I, hold up the ammudim (pillars) of it. Selah.

4.verse: I said unto the hollelim (arrogant), Deal not boastfully; and to the resha’im, Lift not up the keren;

5.verse: Lift not up your keren on high; speak not with a stiff neck.

6.verse: For promotion cometh lo (not) from the east, nor from the west, nor from the desert.

7.verse: But Elohim is the Shofet; He bringeth down one, and setteth up another.

8.verse: For in the yad Hashem there is a kos, and the yayin is foaming; full of mixture; and He poureth out of the same; but the dregs thereof, all rishei aretz (wicked of the earth) shall drain them down, and drink them [Lk 22:42].

9.verse: But I will proclaim l’olam; I will sing zemirot to Elohei Ya’akov.

10.verse: All the karnayim of the resha’im also will I cut off; but the karnayim of the tzaddik shall be exalted. [T.N. In this Psalm we see that G-d is Judge. The Bible speaks of a great Assize where there will be a verdict regarding the sheep and the goats, the redeemed and the reprobate. See Rev 19:11 and 20:4-5.]

1.verse: (For the one directing. On stringed instruments. Mizmor of Asaph. Shir.) In Yehudah is Elohim known; Shmo is gadol in Yisroel.

2.verse: In Shalem [i.e., Yerushalayim] also is His Sukkah, and His Ma’on (dwelling place) in Tziyon [see Yochanan chp 14 OJBC].

3.verse: There He broke the flashing arrows, the mogen, and the cherev, and the milchamah. Selah.

4.verse: Thou art more glorious and adir (majestic) than the mountains of prey.

5.verse: The stouthearted are plundered; now their last sleep they sleep; and none of the anshei chayil can find their hands.

6.verse: At Thy rebuke, O Elohei Ya’akov, both the merkavah and sus are cast into a dead sleep.

7.verse: Thou, even Thou, art to be feared; and who may stand in Thy sight when once Thou art angry?

8.verse: Thou didst pronounce din (sentence, judgment) from Shomayim; Eretz feared, and was still,

9.verse: When Elohim arose to mishpat, to save all the meek of Eretz. Selah.

10.verse: Surely the chamat adam (the wrath of man) shall praise Thee; the she’erit (remnant, survivor) of wrath shalt Thou restrain [from doing evil].

11.verse: Make neder (vow), and pay unto Hashem Eloheichem; let all that be around Him bring gifts unto Him that ought to be feared.

12.verse: He shall cut short the ruach of negidim (nobles); He is fearsome to the Malkhei-Aretz (Kings of the Earth).

1.verse: (For the one directing. Set to Yedutun. Mizmor of Asaph) I cried unto Elohim with my voice, even unto Elohim with my voice; and He gave ear unto me.

2.verse: In my yom tzoros (day of trouble) I sought Adonoi; my hand was stretched up in the lailah, and ceased not; my nefesh refused to be comforted.

3.verse: I remembered Elohim, and groaned; I pondered, and my ruach was overwhelmed. Selah.

4.verse: Thou holdest mine eyelids awake; I am so troubled that lo adaber (I cannot speak).

5.verse: I have considered the yamim mikedem (days of old), the shnot olamim (years long past).

6.verse: I called to remembrance my neginah balailah (song in the night); I communed with mine own lev; and my ruach pondered with diligent search.

7.verse: Will Adonoi cast off forever? And will He show favor no more?

8.verse: Is His chesed passed away forever? Is His promise at an end l’dor vador?

9.verse: Hath El (G-d) forgotten to be channot (gracious)? Hath He in anger shut up His rachamim (mercy)? Selah.

10.verse: And I said, This is my affliction; but I will remember the shanot of the Yemin Elyon (Right Hand of the Most High).

11.verse: I will remember the deeds of Hashem; surely I will remember Thy wonders mikedem (of old, of long ago).

12.verse: I will meditate also on kol po’al (all work) of Thine, and consider Thy mighty deeds.

13.verse: Thy Derech, O Elohim, is bakodesh (in holiness). Who is so gadol El as Elohim?

14.verse: Thou art HaEl oseh peleh (the G-d that doest wonders); Thou hast declared Thy oz (strength) among the amim (peoples, nations).

15.verse: Thou hast with Thine zero’a (strong arm) redeemed Thy people, the Bnei Ya’akov and Yosef. Selah.

16.verse: The mayim saw Thee, O Elohim, the mayim saw Thee; they were afraid; the tehomot (ocean depths) also writhed.

17.verse: The clouds poured down mayim; the skies resounded in thunder; Thine khitzim (arrows, i.e., lightning bolts) also went forth

18.verse: The voice of Thy thunder was in the galgal (whirlwind); the lightning lit up the tevel (world); ha’aretz trembled and quaked.

19.verse: Thy derech is in the yam (sea), and Thy path is through the mayim rabbim (great waters), and Thy footsteps are not to be discerned.

20.verse: Thou didst lead Thy people like a tzon (flock) by the yad Moshe and Aharon.

1.verse: (Maskil of Asaph.) Give ear, O my people, to my torah; incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

2.verse: I will open my mouth in a mashal; I will utter dark sayings from of old,

3.verse: Which we have heard and known, and Avoteinu have told us.

4.verse: We will not hide them from their banim, recounting to the dor acharon the tehillot Hashem, and His power, and His nifla’ot (wonderful works) that He hath done.

5.verse: For He established edut in Ya’akov, set torah in Yisroel, which He commanded Avoteinu, that they should make them known to their banim;

6.verse: So that the dor acharon might know them, even the banim which should be born; who should arise and recount them to their banim;

7.verse: That they might put their confidence in Elohim, and not forget the ma’allei El (works of G-d), but keep His mitzvot;

8.verse: And might not be as their Avot, a dor sorer u’moreh (stubborn and rebellious generation); a generation that set not its lev aright, and whose ruach was not faithful to G-d.

9.verse: The Bnei Ephrayim, being armed, and shooting keshet (the bows), turned back in the day of battle.

10.verse: They kept not the Brit Elohim, and refused to walk in His torah;

11.verse: And forgot His works, and His nifla’ot (wonders) that He had shown them.

12.verse: Peleh (marvellous things) did He in the sight of their avot, in Eretz Mitzrayim, in the sadeh (area) of Tzoan.

13.verse: He divided the yam, and caused them to pass through; and He made the mayim to stand like a heap.

14.verse: In the daytime also He led them with an anan, and all the lailah with an ohr of eish.

15.verse: He split the rocks in the midbar, and gave them drink as out of the great tehomot.

16.verse: He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused mayim to run down like rivers.

17.verse: And they sinned yet more against Him by provoking Elyon in the wilderness.

18.verse: And they tested G-d by their lev by demanding ochel for their lust.

19.verse: And they spoke against Elohim; they said, Can G-d spread a shulchan in the midbar?

20.verse: Behold, He struck the Tzur, that the mayim gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can He give lechem also? Can He provide meat for His people?

21.verse: Therefore Hashem heard this, and was in wrath; so an eish was kindled against Ya’akov, and anger also came up against Yisroel;

22.verse: Because they believed not in Elohim, and trusted not in His Yeshuah (salvation);

23.verse: Though He had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the daletei Shomayim (doors of heaven),

24.verse: And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the bread of Shomayim [see Yn 6:31 OJBC].

25.verse: Ish did eat the bread of angels; He sent them lechem to the full.

26.verse: He caused an east wind to blow from Shomayim; and by His oz He brought in the south wind.

27.verse: He rained meat also upon them like aphar, and winged fowls like the chol (sand) of the sea;

28.verse: And He let it fall in the midst of their machaneh, all around their mishkenot (habitations).

29.verse: So they did eat, and were well filled; for He gave them their own ta’avah (evil desire).

30.verse: They were not estranged from their ta’avah. But while their food was yet in their mouths,

31.verse: The Af Elohim (wrath of G-d) came upon them, and slaughtered the stoutest of them, and cut down the bochurim of Yisroel.

32.verse: For all this they sinned still, and believed not in His nifla’ot (wondrous works).

33.verse: Therefore their yamim did He consume in hevel (futility, vanity) and their shanim in terror.

34.verse: When He slaughtered them, then they sought Him; and they returned and inquired diligently after G-d.

35.verse: And they remembered that Elohim was their Tzur, and the El Elyon their Go’el (Redeemer).

36.verse: Nevertheless they did flatter Him with their mouth, and they lied unto Him with their leshon.

37.verse: For their lev was not right with Him, neither were they faithful in His Brit.

38.verse: But He, being full of compassion, made kapporah for their avon and destroyed them not; and He many times turned His anger away, and did not stir up all His wrath.

39.verse: For He remembered that they were but basar; a ruach (wind) that passeth away, and cometh not again.

40.verse: How oft did they provoke Him in the midbar, and grieve Him in the desert!

41.verse: Again and again they turned back and tested G-d, and imposed limits on Kadosh Yisroel.

42.verse: They remembered not His Yad (Hand, Power), nor the yom (day) when He redeemed them from the enemy.

43.verse: How He had wrought His otot in Mitzrayim, and His mofetim in the area of Tzoan.

44.verse: And had turned their rivers into dahm; and their streams, that they could not drink.

45.verse: He sent swarms of flies among them, which devoured them; and tzfarde’a (frogs), which destroyed them.

46.verse: He gave also their crop unto the grasshopper, and their produce unto the arbeh (locust).

47.verse: He destroyed their gefen with barad (hail), and their fig trees with frost.

48.verse: He gave up their cattle also to the barad (hail), and their livestock herds to hot thunderbolts.

49.verse: He cast upon them His charon af, evrah (wrath), and za’am (indignation), and tzarah, by sending malachim ra’im among them.

50.verse: He made a way for His anger; He spared not their nefesh from mavet (death), but gave their beasts over to the dever (plague);

51.verse: And struck all the bechor in Mitzrayim; the reshit (first fruit) of their strength in the ohalim of Cham;

52.verse: But made His own people to go forth like tzon, and guided them in the midbar like an eder (flock).

53.verse: And He led them in safety, so that they had no terror; but the yam overwhelmed their oyevim.

54.verse: And He brought them to His gevul kadosh (His holy border), even to this Har, which His Yamin had purchased.

55.verse: He cast out the Goyim also before them, and divided by measure a nachalah for them, and made the Shivtei Yisroel to dwell in their ohalim.

56.verse: Yet they tested and provoked Elohim Elyon, and were not shomer over His edot;

57.verse: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their avot; they turned like a treacherous keshet.

58.verse: For they provoked Him to anger with their high places, and moved Him to jealousy with their pesilim.

59.verse: When Elohim heard this, He was in wrath, and greatly abhorred Yisroel;

60.verse: So that He forsook the Mishkan of Shiloh, the Ohel which He placed among adam (men);

61.verse: And delivered His oz (strength) into captivity, and His tiferet into the hand of the enemy.

62.verse: He gave His people over also unto the cherev; and was in wrath with His nachalah.

63.verse: The eish consumed their bochurim; and their betulot had no wedding celebration.

64.verse: Their kohanim fell by the cherev; and their almanot made no lamentation.

65.verse: Then Adonoi awaked as one from sleep, and like a gibbor that shouteth from yayin.

66.verse: And He struck down His enemies behind; He put them to cherpat olam (perpetual reproach).

67.verse: Moreover He rejected the Ohel Yosef, and chose not the Shevet Ephrayim;

68.verse: But chose the Shevet Yehudah, Har Tziyon which He loved.

69.verse: And He built His Mikdash like heavenly heights, like Eretz which He hath established l’olam.

70.verse: He chose Dovid also His Eved, and took him from the mikhle’ot tzon (sheepfolds);

71.verse: From following the nursing ewes He brought him to shepherd Ya’akov His people, and Yisroel His nachalah.

72.verse: So he shepherded them according to the tohm (integrity, guilelessness) of his lev; and led them by the skillfulness of his hands.

1.verse: (A Mizmor. Of Asaph) O Elohim, the Goyim are come into Thine Nachalah; Thy Heikhal Kodesh have they defiled; they have reduced Yerushalayim to rubble.

2.verse: The dead bodies of Thy avadim have they given to be food unto the oph HaShomayim, the basar of Thy Chasidim, unto the beasts of the earth.

3.verse: Their shefach dahm (shedding of blood) is like mayim all around Yerushalayim; and there is none to bury them.

4.verse: We are become a reproach to our shekhenim (neighbors), a scorn and derision to them that are around us.

5.verse: How long, Hashem? Wilt Thou be angry lanetzach (forever)? Shall Thy kina (jealousy) burn like eish?

6.verse: Pour out Thy wrath upon the Goyim that have no da’as of Thee, and upon the mamlachot that have not called upon Thy Shem.

7.verse: For they have devoured Ya’akov, and laid waste his naveh (home).

8.verse: O remember not against us avonot rishonim (former iniquities); let Thy rachamim speedily come to us; for we are brought very low.

9.verse: Help us, O Elohei Yisheinu, (G-d of our salvation), for the kavod of Thy Shem; and deliver us, and make kapporah for our sins, for Thy Name’s sake.

10.verse: Why should the Goyim say, Where is Eloheihem? Let there be known among the Goyim in our sight, vengeance for the shefach dahm of Thy avadim.

11.verse: Let the groaning of the asir (prisoner) come before Thee; according to the greatness of Thy Zero’a preserve Thou those that are Bnei Temutah (sons of death, i.e., appointed to die, doomed to die);

12.verse: And repay unto our shekhenim (neighbors) sevenfold into their kheyk their reproach, wherewith they have reproached Thee, Adonoi.

13.verse: So we Thy people and tzon of Thy pasture will give Thee thanks l’olahm (forever); we will show forth Thy praise l’dor vador.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Set to The Lilies of the Edut. Of Asaph. Mizmor.) Give ear, O Ro’eh Yisroel, Thou that leadest Yosef like a tzon; Thou that art enthroned between the Keruvim, shine forth.

2.verse: Before Ephrayim and Binyamin and Menasheh, Stir up Thy gevurah (might), and come and save us.

3.verse: Turn us again, O Elohim, and cause Thy face to shine that we may be saved.

4.verse: Hashem Elohim Tzva’os, ad mosai (how long) wilt Thou be angry against the tefillat amecha (prayer of Thy people)?

5.verse: Thou feedest them with the lechem dimah (bread of tears); and givest them dima’ot (tears) to drink in great measure.

6.verse: Thou makest us a madon (strife, contention) unto shcheneinu (our neighbors), and oyveinu (our enemies) mock us.

7.verse: Turn us again, O Elohim Tzva’os, and cause Thy face to shine that we may be saved.

8.verse: Thou hast brought a gefen (vine) out of Mitzrayim; Thou hast drove out Goyim, and planted it.

9.verse: Thou preparedst room before it, and didst cause it to take deep root, and it filled the eretz.

10.verse: The harim were covered with the tzel (shadow) of it, and the branches thereof were like the mighty cedars.

11.verse: It sent out its branches unto the yam (sea, i.e., Mediterranean Sea) and its shoots unto the Nahar (river, i.e., the Euphrates).

12.verse: Lammah (why) hast Thou then broken down her walls, so that all they which pass by the derech do pluck her?

13.verse: The chazir (wild boar) out of the forest doth lay it waste, and the beasts of the sadeh doth devour it.

14.verse: Shuv nah (return now), we beseech Thee, O Elohim Tzva’os; look down from Shomayim, and behold, and visit gefen zot (this vine);

15.verse: And the stock which Thy Yamin (Right Hand) hath planted, and the Ben that Thou madest strong for Thyself.

16.verse: It is burned with eish, it is cut down; they perish at the ge’arah (rebuke) of Thy countenance.

17.verse: Let Thy Yad be upon the Ish Yeminecha (the Man of your Right Hand), upon the Ben Adam whom Thou madest strong for Thyself [cf Psalm 110:1; Dan 7:13].

18.verse: So will we never turn back from Thee; revive us, and we will call upon Thy Shem.

19.verse: Turn us again, Hashem Elohim Tzva’os; cause Thy face to shine that we may be saved.

1.verse: (For the one directing. On the gittis. Of Asaph.) Sing with joy unto Elohim uzeinu (our strength); make a joyful noise unto Elohei Ya’akov.

2.verse: Begin a song, and bring hither the tambourine, the pleasant kinnor (harp) with the nevel (lyre).

3.verse: Blow the shofar at Rosh Chodesh, at the full moon, on Yom Chageinu.

4.verse: For this was a chok for Yisroel, and a mishpat of the Elohei Ya’akov.

5.verse: This He ordained in Yosef for an edut, when He went out over Eretz Mitzra- yim; where a language of one not known did I hear.

6.verse: I removed his shekhem (shoulder) from the burden; his hands were delivered from the basket.

7.verse: In tzoros thou calledst, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the seter ra’am (secret place of thunder); I tested thee at the waters of Merivah. Selah.

8.verse: Shema, O My people, and I will admonish thee; O Yisroel, if thou wilt pay heed unto Me;

9.verse: There shall no el zar (strange, foreign g-d) be among thee; neither shalt thou worship any el nechar (foreign g-d).

10.verse: I am Hashem Eloheicha Who brought thee out of Eretz Mitzrayim; open thy mouth wide, I will fill it.

11.verse: But My people would not pay heed to My voice; and Yisroel would have none of Me.

12.verse: So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ sherirut (stubbornness); and they walked in their own mo’atzot (counsels).

13.verse: Oh that My people had paid heed unto Me, and Yisroel had walked in My ways!

14.verse: I should soon have subdued their oyevim and turned My Yad (hand, power) against their adversaries.

15.verse: The haters of Hashem should have cringed before Him; their et (time, fate, punishment) endures l’olam.

16.verse: He would have fed them also with the finest of the chittah (wheat); and with devash (honey) from the Tzur would I have satisfied thee.

1.verse: (Mizmor of Asaph.) Elohim standeth in the Adat El; He judgeth among the elohim [See Ps 82:6 and Yn 10:34].

2.verse: Ad mosai (How long) will ye judge unjustly, and show partiality to the resha’im? Selah.

3.verse: Defend the poor and yatom (fatherless); do justice to the oni (afflicted) and needy.

4.verse: Deliver the poor and needy; rid them out of the yad resha’im.

5.verse: They know not, neither will they understand; they walk on in choshech; all the foundations of ha’aretz are shaken.

6.verse: I have said, elohim ye are; and all of you are Bnei HaElyon.

7.verse: But ye shall die like adam, and fall like one of the sarim (princes).

8.verse: Arise, Elohim, judge ha’aretz; for Thou shalt inherit kol HaGoyim.

1.verse: (Shir. Mizmor of Asaph). Keep not Thou silent, O Elohim; hold not Thy peace, and be not still, O El (G-d).

2.verse: For, hinei, Thine oyevim are in tumult; and they that hate Thee have lifted up the rosh.

3.verse: They lay out a crafty conspiracy against Amecha (Thy people), and plot against Tzefunecha (Thy sheltered, protected, hidden ones).

4.verse: They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a goy (nation); that the shem Yisroel may be no more remembered.

5.verse: For they have plotted together with one lev; they cut a brit against Thee;

6.verse: The ohalim Edom, and the Yishm’elim; of Moav, and the Hagerim;

7.verse: Geval, and Ammon, and Amalek; Peleshet (Philistia) with the inhabitants of Tzor;

8.verse: Assyria also is joined with them; they are the zero’a (strong arm) of the Bnei Lot. Selah.

9.verse: Do unto them as unto Midyan; as to Sisra, as to Yavin, at the Wadi Kishon [see Shofetim chp 4-8];

10.verse: Which became shmad at Ein-Dor; they became like domen (dung, fertilizer) for ha’adamah.

11.verse: Make their nobles like Orev, and like Ze’ev; yes, all their princes like Zevach, and like Tzalmunna;

12.verse: Who said, Let us take possession for ourselves of the pasturelands of Elohim.

13.verse: O Elohai, make them like galgal (tumbleweed); like chaff before the ruach (wind).

14.verse: As the eish consumeth the forest, and as the flame setteth ablaze harim;

15.verse: So pursue them with Thy sa’ar (tempest, storm), and make them afraid with Thy storm.

16.verse: Fill their faces with shame; that they may seek Shimcha, Hashem.
