17.verse: Let them be put to shame and dismayed adei ad (forever); yes, let them perish in disgrace;

18.verse: Let them have da’as that Thou alone, Shimcha Hashem, art Elyon al kol HaAretz.

1.verse: (For the one directing. On the gittit. Mizmor for the Bnei Korach). How yedidot (lovely) are thy mishkanot, O Hashem Tzva’os!

2.verse: My nefesh longeth, yea, even fainteth for the khatzrot Hashem (courts of Hashem); my lev and my basar crieth out for El Chai.

3.verse: Yea, the sparrow hath found a bais, and the swallow a ken (nest) for herself, where she may lay her young, even Thine mizbechot, O Hashem Tzva’os Malki v’Elohai.

4.verse: Ashrei are they that dwell in Thy Beis [Hamikdash]; they are ever praising Thee. Selah.

5.verse: Ashrei is the adam whose oz (strength) is in Thee; in whose lev are their highways [to Tziyon; see verse 7(8)].

6.verse: Who passing through the valley of Baca (weeping) make it a ma’ayon (spring, fountain); the moreh (early rain) also covereth it with berakhot (blessings).

7.verse: They go from strength to strength, every one of them who appeareth before Elohim in Tziyon.

8.verse: O Hashem Elohim Tzva’os, hear my tefillah; give ear, O Elohei Ya’akov. Selah.

9.verse: Behold mogineinu (our shield), O Elohim, and look upon the face of Thine Moshiach.

10.verse: For a yom in Thy khatzrot is better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the Beis Elohai, than to dwell in the ohalim resha (tents of wickedness).

11.verse: For Hashem Elohim is a shemesh and a mogen; Hashem will give chen and kavod; no good thing will He withhold from the holekhim b’tamim (them that walk uprightly).

12.verse: O Hashem Tzva’os, ashrei is the adam bote’ach (man that trusteth, hath confident faith) in Thee.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Of the Bnei Korach. Mizmor.) Hashem, Thou hast been favorable unto Thy land; Thou hast brought back the captivity of Ya’akov.

2.verse: Thou hast forgiven the avon (iniquity) of Amecha (Thy people); Thou hast covered all their chattat (sin). Selah.

3.verse: Thou hast withdrawn all Thy wrath; Thou hast turned from Thine charon af.

4.verse: Turn us, O Elohei Yisheinu (G-d of our salvation), and put away Thine ka’as (anger) toward us.

5.verse: Wilt Thou be angry with us l’olam? Wilt Thou draw out Thine anger l’dor vador?

6.verse: Wilt Thou not revive us again; that Amecha (Thy people) may rejoice in Thee?

7.verse: Show us chasdecha (Thy chesed, kindness, steadfast love), Hashem, and grant us Thy salvation.

8.verse: I will hear what HaEl Hashem will say; for He will speak shalom unto His people, and to His Chasidim; but let them not turn again to folly.

9.verse: Surely His salvation is karov (near) them that fear Him; that kavod may dwell in Artzeinu (our land).

10.verse: Chesed and emes will meet together; tzedek and shalom will kiss each other.

11.verse: Emes shall titzmach (sprout forth [T.N. Tzemach—Branch, Sprout—is the code name for Moshiach and the coming Tzemach’s Namesake in Zecharyah 6:11-12 is Yehoshua, Yeshua—see Ezra 3:8; Zech 3:8; 6:11-12. Go to Jer 23:5 and look at all the references. These are among the most important Scriptures in the Bible because it is here that the saving Name of Moshiach Tzidkeinu is prophetically communicated for salvation; the word Tzemach means “Moshiach” and it is the code word par excellence for Moshiach in the post-Exilic references in the minor prophets; this veiled reference to Moshiach was necessary in the situation of the Return under Persian rule when talk of a coming king was a delicate matter.]) out of ha’aretz; and tzedek shall look down from Shomayim.

12.verse: Yes, Hashem shall give that which is tov; and Artzeinu (our land) shall yield her yevul (increase, produce).

13.verse: Tzedek shall go before Him; and shall set us in the Derech of His steps.

1.verse: (A tefillah of Dovid) Incline Thine ear, Hashem; hear me; for I am ani (poor) and evyon (needy).

2.verse: Be shomer over my nefesh; for I am chasid; O Thou Elohai, save Thy eved that trusteth in Thee.

3.verse: Channeni (be merciful) unto me, Adonoi; for I cry unto Thee kol hayom.

4.verse: Samei’ach (rejoice) the nefesh of Thy eved; for unto Thee, Adonoi, do I lift up my nefesh.

5.verse: For Thou, Adonoi, art tov, and ready to forgive; and plenteous in chesed unto all them that call upon Thee.

6.verse: Give ear, Hashem, unto my tefillah (prayer); and attend to the voice of my techinnot (supplications).

7.verse: In my yom tzoros I will call upon Thee; for Thou wilt answer me.

8.verse: Ein kamocha vaelohim (there is none like Thee among the g-ds), Adonoi; nor are there any ma’asim like Thine.

9.verse: Kol Goyim whom Thou hast made shall come and worship before Thee, Adonoi; and shall glorify Shimcha.

10.verse: For Thou art gadol, and doest nifla’ot (wondrous things); Thou alone art Elohim.

11.verse: Teach me Thy Derech, Hashem; I will walk in Thy emes; Yachad (make undivided) levavi (my heart) to fear Thy Shem.

12.verse: I will praise Thee, Adonoi Elohai, with all my lev; and I will glorify Shimecha l’olam.

13.verse: For gadol is Thy chesed toward me; and Thou hast saved my nefesh from the lowermost Sheol.

14.verse: O Elohim, the zedim (arrogant ones, proud, insolent ones) are risen up against me, and the adat aritzim (band of violent men) seek my nefesh; and have not set Thee before them.

15.verse: But Thou, Adonoi, art El Rachum and Channun, slow to anger, and plenteous in chesed and emes.

16.verse: O turn unto me, and be gracious upon me; give Thy oz (strength) unto Thy eved, and save the ben amatecha (the son of Thy handmaid).

17.verse: Show me an ot (sign) for tovah; that they which hate me may see it, and be put to shame; because Thou, Hashem, hast helped me, and comforted me.

1.verse: (Of the Bnei Korach. A mizmor. A shir) On the Harei Kodesh (Holy Mountain) stands His foundation.

2.verse: Hashem loveth the sha’arei Tziyon more than all the mishkenot Ya’akov.

3.verse: Glorious things are spoken of thee, O Ir HaElohim. Selah.

4.verse: To them that know me, I will make mention of Rachav and Babylon; hinei, Philistia, and Tzor, with Ethiopia: this man was born there.

5.verse: But of Tziyon it shall be said, This one and that one were born in her; and Elyon Himself shall establish it.

6.verse: Hashem shall register, when He writeth up the people, that this one was born there. Selah.

7.verse: The sharim (ones singing) as well as the cholelim (players on instruments) shall be there; all my fountains are in thee.

1.verse: (Shir. Mizmor of the Bnei Korach. For the one directing. According to Machalat le‘annot. Maskil of Herman the Ezrachi.) Hashem Elohei Yeshuati (G-d of my salvation), I have cried out yom valailah before Thee.

2.verse: Let my tefillah come before Thee; incline Thine ear unto my cry;

3.verse: For my nefesh is full of troubles; and my life draweth near unto Sheol.

4.verse: I am counted with them that go down into the bor (pit); I am like a gever (man) that hath no strength;

5.verse: Forsaken among the mesim, like the slain that lie in the kever, whom Thou rememberest no more; and nigzaru (they are cut off, excluded; see Isa 53:8) from Thy Yad (hand, power, care).

6.verse: Thou hast laid me in the lowest bor (pit), in darkness, in the deeps.

7.verse: Thy wrath lieth hard upon me, and Thou hast overwhelmed me with kol mishbarecha (all Thy waves, breakers). Selah.

8.verse: Thou hast estranged mine acquaintances far from me; Thou hast made me to’evot unto them; I am shut up, and I cannot escape.

9.verse: Mine eye groweth dim by reason of oni (affliction); Hashem, I have called daily upon Thee, I have stretched up my hands unto Thee.

10.verse: Wilt Thou show wonders to the mesim? Shall the lifeless arise and praise Thee? Selah.

11.verse: Shall Thy chesed be declared in the kever? Or Thy emunah in Avaddon?

12.verse: Shall Thy wonders be known in the choshech? And Thy tzedakah in the Eretz Neshiyyah (land of forgetfulness, oblivion)?

13.verse: But unto Thee have I cried, Hashem; and in the boker shall my tefillah come before Thee.

14.verse: Hashem, why castest Thou off my nefesh? Why hidest Thou Thy face from me?

15.verse: I am afflicted and govei’a (one being close to death) from my youth up; while I suffer Thy terrors I am distraught.

16.verse: Thy charon (fierce wrath) goeth over me; Thy terrors have flayed me.

17.verse: They came round about me daily like mayim; they close in, engulfing me.

18.verse: Ohev (lover) and re’a (companion) hast Thou estranged from me, and mine acquaintances are in darkness. [T.N. Ps 89 is a messianic Ps.]

1.verse: (A maskil of Eitan the Ezrachi). I will sing of the mercies of Hashem olam; with my mouth will I make known Thy emunah (faithfulness) to dor vador.

2.verse: For I have said, Chesed shall be built up olam; Thy emunah (faithfulness) shalt Thou establish in Shomayim itself.

3.verse: I have made a Brit with My Bechir (Chosen one), I have sworn unto Dovid Avdi,

4.verse: Thy Zera will I establish ad olam, and build up thy kisse to dor vador. Selah.

5.verse: And Shomayim shall praise Thy wonders, O Hashem; Thy emunah (faithfulness) also in the Kahal Kedoshim.

6.verse: For who in the heavens can be compared unto Hashem? Who among the bnei elim can be likened unto Hashem?

7.verse: G-d is greatly to be feared in the sod Kedoshim (council of the holy ones), and is awesome over all them that are around Him.

8.verse: Hashem Elohei Tzva’os, who is like Thee, O Mighty One, Hashem? Thy emunah also surrounds Thee!

9.verse: Thou rulest the raging of the yam; when the waves thereof arise, Thou stillest them [see Mk 4:41].

10.verse: Thou hast broken Rachav in pieces, as one that is slain; Thou hast scattered Thine oyevim with Thy strong Zero’a.

11.verse: Shomayim are Thine, Eretz also is Thine; as for the tevel (world) and the fulness thereof, Thou hast founded them.

12.verse: The tzafon (north) and the yamin (south) Thou hast created them; Tavor and Chermon shall sing for joy in Thy Shem.

13.verse: Thou hast a mighty Zero’a; strong is Thy Yad, and exalted is Thy Yamin.

14.verse: Tzedek and mishpat are the foundation of Thy kisse; chesed and emes shall go before Thy face.

15.verse: Ashrei is the people that know the joyful sound; they shall walk, Hashem, in the ohr (light) of Thy countenance.

16.verse: In Thy Shem shall they rejoice kol hayom; and in Thy tzedakah shall they be exalted.

17.verse: For Thou art the tiferet (splendor, glory) of their strength; and in Thy favor our keren shall be exalted.

18.verse: For Hashem is our mogen; and the Kadosh Yisroel is Malkeinu (our king).

19.verse: Then Thou spoke in chazon (vision) to Thy chasidim, and saidst, I have laid ezer (help) upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

20.verse: I have found Dovid Avdi; with My shemen kadosh (holy oil) meshachtiv (I anointed him);

21.verse: With whom My yad shall be established; Mine zero’a also shall strengthen him.

22.verse: The oyev (enemy) shall not ensnare him; nor the ben avlah (son of wickedness) afflict him.

23.verse: And I will beat down his tzar before his face, and strike down them that hate him.

24.verse: But My emunah (faithfulness) and My chesed shall be with him; and in My Shem shall his keren be exalted.

25.verse: I will set his yad also upon the yam, and his yamin upon the neharot (rivers).

26.verse: He shall cry out unto Me, Thou art Avi, Eli, and the Tzur of my Yeshuah (salvation) [Mt 16:16].

27.verse: Also I will make him My Bechor, elyon (most exalted) of the Malkhei Aretz.

28.verse: My chesed will I be shomer over for him forevermore, and My Brit shall stand unfailing with him.

29.verse: His zera also will I make to endure forever, and his kisse as the days of Shomayim.

30.verse: If his banim forsake My torah, walk not in My mishpatim,

31.verse: If they violate My chukkot, and are not shomer over My mitzvot;

32.verse: Then will I visit their peysha with shevet (rod), and their avon (iniquity) with stripes.

33.verse: Nevertheless My chesed will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer My emunah (faithfulness) to fail.

34.verse: My Brit will I not violate, nor alter the thing that is gone out of My lips.

35.verse: Once have I sworn by My Kodesh; I will not lie unto Dovid.

36.verse: His zera shall endure l’olam, and his kisse as the shemesh before Me.

37.verse: It shall be established olam as the yarei’ach, and as an ed ne’eman (a faithful witness) in the heavens. Selah.

38.verse: But Thou hast cast off [mem-alef-samech, see same word Psalm 118:22] and abhorred, Thou hast been in wrath with Thine Moshiach.

39.verse: Thou hast made void the Brit of Thy eved; Thou hast profaned his nezer (diadem) to the ground.

40.verse: Thou hast broken down all his gederot (hedges); Thou hast brought his strongholds to ruin.

41.verse: All that pass by the derech plunder him; he is a cherpah (reproach) to his shchenim [Mt 27:39].

42.verse: Thou hast exalted the yamin of his adversaries; Thou hast made all his oyevim to rejoice.

43.verse: Thou hast also turned back the edge of his cherev, and hast not made him to stand in the milchamah.

44.verse: Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his kisse down to the ground.

45.verse: The days of his youth hast thou shortened; Thou hast covered him with bushah (shame). Selah.

46.verse: How long, Hashem? Wilt Thou hide Thyself lanetzach (forever)? Shall Thy wrath burn like eish?

47.verse: Remember how short my time is. For what vanity hast Thou created kol bnei adam?

48.verse: What gever is he that liveth, and shall not see mavet? Shall he deliver his nefesh from the yad Sheol (power of Sheol)? Selah.

49.verse: Adonoi, where are Thy former lovingkindnesses, which Thou didst swear unto Dovid in Thy emunah?

50.verse: Remember, Adonoi, the reproach of Thy avadim; how I do bear in my kheyk (bosom) the reproach of all rabbim amim (many peoples);

51.verse: Wherewith Thine oyevim have reproached, Hashem; wherewith they have reproached the ikkevot (footsteps) of Thine Moshiach.

52.verse: Baruch Hashem l’olam. Omein and Omein.

1.verse: (Tefillah of Moshe, ish HaElohim) Adonoi, Thou hast been our ma’on (dwelling place) b’dor vador.

2.verse: Before the harim were brought forth, or ever Thou hadst formed eretz and the tevel (inhabited world), even from olam ad olam, Thou art El (G-d).

3.verse: Thou turnest enosh to dakka (dust); and sayest, Shuvu, ye Bnei Adam.

4.verse: For an elef shanim in Thy sight are but as yom etmol (yesterday) when it is past, and as an ashmurah (watch, division of time) in the lailah.

5.verse: Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sheinah (sleep); in the boker they are like khatzir (grass) which withereth.

6.verse: In the boker it flourisheth, and groweth up; in the erev it is cut down, and drieth up.

7.verse: For we are consumed by Thine anger, and by Thy chemah are we troubled.

8.verse: Thou hast set avonoteinu before Thee, our secret sins in the ohr of Thy countenance.

9.verse: For kol yameinu are passed away in Thy evrah (fury); we spend shaneinu (our years) like a sigh.

10.verse: The yamim of shnoteinu (our years, life) are threescore shanah and ten; and if by reason of gevurot they are fourscore shanah, yet is their boast amal (trouble, toil) and sorrow; for it is soon cut off, and we fly away.

11.verse: Who has da’as of the oz (power) of Thine anger? Thy evrah is as great as Thy yirah (fear of, reverence owed G-d).

12.verse: So teach us to number yameinu, that we may apply levav unto chochmah.

13.verse: Shuvah, Hashem. Ad mosai? Have compassion on Thy avadim.

14.verse: O satisfy us baboker with Thy chesed; that we may sing for joy and be glad kol yameinu (all our days).

15.verse: Make us glad according to the days wherein Thou hast afflicted us, and the years wherein we have seen ra’ah.

16.verse: Let Thy work appear unto Thy avadim, and Thy glory unto their banim.

17.verse: And let the no’am (favor, delightfulness) of Adonoi Eloheinu be upon us; and establish Thou the ma’aseh yadeinu upon us; yes, the ma’aseh yadeinu establish Thou it.

1.verse: He that dwelleth in the seter Elyon (covering, hiding place of the Most High) shall abide under the tzel Shaddai (shadow of the Almighty).

2.verse: I will say of Hashem, He is my refuge and my fortress; Elohai (my G-d); in Him will I trust.

3.verse: Surely He shall save thee from the pach yakosh ([deadly] snare of the fowler), and from the devastating dever (plague).

4.verse: He shall cover thee with His evrah (pinion, flight feathers), and under His kenafayim (wings) shalt thou find defense; His Emes shall be thy shield and buckler.

5.verse: Thou shalt not be afraid of the pachad (terror) by lailah; nor of the khetz (arrow) that flieth yomam (by day);

6.verse: Nor for the dever (plague) that walketh in darkness; nor for the ketev (pestilence, destruction) that destroyeth at tzohorayim (noon).

7.verse: An elef (thousand) may fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy yamin (right hand); but it shall not come near thee.

8.verse: Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold and see the shillumah (recompense, retribution) of the resha’im.

9.verse: Because thou hast made Hashem, which is my refuge, even Elyon, thy ma’on (habitation, dwelling; see Yn 14:2 OJBC)

10.verse: There shall no ra’ah (evil, disaster) befall thee, neither shall any nega come near thy ohel.

11.verse: For He shall give charge to His malachim (angels) concerning thee, to be shomer over thee in kol drakhim of thee.

12.verse: They [the malachim of Hashem] shall bear thee up on their palms, lest thou dash thy regel against an even (stone).

13.verse: Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder; the young lion and the tannin (serpent) shalt thou trample under foot.

14.verse: Because he hath set his longing upon Me, therefore will I rescue him; I will set him on high, because he hath da’as of Shmi (My Name).

15.verse: He shall call upon Me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in tzoros; I will deliver him, and honor him.

16.verse: With orech yamim (length of days, long life) will I satisfy him, and show him My Yeshuah (salvation).

1.verse: (Mizmor. Shir. For Shabbos) It is tov to give thanks unto Hashem, and to make music unto Thy Shem, O Elyon;

2.verse: To proclaim Thy chesed in the boker, and Thy emunah baleilot,

3.verse: Upon a ten-stringed instrument, and upon the nevel (lyre); to the melody of the kinnor (harp).

4.verse: For Thou, Hashem, hast made me glad through Thy work; I will joy in the works of Thy hands.

5.verse: Hashem, how great are Thy works! And Thy machshe’vot (thoughts) are very deep.

6.verse: An ish ba’ar (brutish, senseless man, dolt) knoweth not; neither doth a kesil (fool) understand this.

7.verse: When the resha’im spring up like the esev (grass), and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish, it is that they shall be destroyed adei-ad (forever).

8.verse: But Thou, Hashem, art exalted l’olam.

9.verse: For, hinei, Thine enemies, Hashem, for, hinei, Thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

10.verse: But my keren shalt Thou exalt like the keren of a re’eim (wild ox); I shall be anointed with fresh shemen.

11.verse: Mine eye also shall look on mine foes, and mine ears shall hear of the resha’im that rise up against me.

12.verse: The tzaddik shall flourish like the palm tree; he shall grow like a cedar in Levanon.

13.verse: Those that are planted in the Beis Hashem shall flourish in the khatzerot Eloheinu (courts of our G-d).

14.verse: They shall still bear forth fruit in old age; they shall be deshenim (stalwart, vigorous) and ra’ananim (luxuriant, fresh);

15.verse: To proclaim that Hashem is yashar; He is my Tzur, and there is no unrighteousness in Him.

1.verse: Hashem reigneth, He is robed with majesty; Hashem is clothed with strength, wherewith He hath girded Himself; the tevel (world) also is established, that it cannot be moved.

2.verse: Thy kisse is established of old; Thou art me’olam (from everlasting).

3.verse: The floods have lifted up, Hashem, the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift up their waves.

4.verse: Hashem on high is mightier than the noise of mayim rabbim, yea, than the mighty waves of the yam.

5.verse: Thy testimonies are very sure; Kodesh becometh Thine Beis, Hashem, forever.

1.verse: Hashem G-d, to whom vengeance belongeth; O G-d, to whom vengeance belongeth, show Thyself.

2.verse: Rise up, Thou Shofet HaAretz; render gemul (recompense, desert) to the ge’im (proud ones).

3.verse: Ad mosai, Hashem, shall the resha’im, how long shall the resha’im triumph?

4.verse: How long shall they utter and speak malicious lies? And all the po’alei aven (workers of iniquity) glorify themselves?

5.verse: They crush Thy people, Hashem, and afflict Thine nachalah.

6.verse: They slay the almanah and the ger, and murder the yetomim (fatherless, orphans).

7.verse: Yet they say, Hashem shall not see, neither shall the Elohei Ya’akov regard it.

8.verse: Understand, ye brutish among the people; and ye kesilim (fools), when will ye get seichel?

9.verse: He that planted the ozen (ear), shall He not hear? He that formed the ayin (eye), shall He not see?

10.verse: He that chastiseth the Goyim, shall not He reprove? He that is the melamed (teacher) of da’as to adam?

11.verse: Hashem knoweth the machshevot (thoughts) of adam, that they are hevel (vanity, futile).

12.verse: Ashrei (blessed) is the gever whom Thou chastenest, Hashem, and teachest him out of Thy torah;

13.verse: That Thou mayest grant him relief from the days of rah, until a shachat (pit) is dug for the rasha.

14.verse: For Hashem will not cast off His people, neither will He forsake His nachalah.

15.verse: But mishpat shall revert unto tzedek; and all the yishrei lev (upright in heart) shall follow after it.

16.verse: Who will rise up for Me against the evildoers? Or who will take a stand for Me against the po’alei aven (workers of iniquity)?

17.verse: Unless Hashem had been my help, my nefesh had almost dwelt in dumah (silence).

18.verse: When I said, My regel (foot) slippeth, Thy chesed, Hashem, held me up.

19.verse: In the multitude of my anxieties within me Thy comforts delight my nefesh.

20.verse: Shall the kisse of corruption have chavurah (fellowship) with Thee, those, which deviseth evil by a chok (statute)?

21.verse: They band together against the nefesh of the tzaddik, and condemn dahm naki (innocent blood).

22.verse: But Hashem is my stronghold; and Elohai is the Tzur of my refuge.

23.verse: And He shall turn back upon them their own iniquity, and shall destroy them for their own wickedness; Hashem Eloheinu shall destroy them.

1.verse: O come, let us sing unto Hashem; let us make a joyful noise to the Tzur of our salvation.

2.verse: Let us come before His presence with todah, and extol Him with zemirot (joyful songs).

3.verse: For Hashem is El Gadol, and Melech Gadol above kol elohim (g-ds).

4.verse: In His yad are the deep places of ha’aretz; the peaks of the harim are His also.

5.verse: The yam is His, and He made it; and His hands formed the yabashah (dry land).

6.verse: O come, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before Hashem Oseinu (our Maker).

7.verse: For He is Eloheinu; and we are the people of His pasture, and the tzon of His yad. Today if ye will hear His voice,

8.verse: Harden not your lev, as in Merivah, and as in the Yom Massah in the midbar;

9.verse: When your avot tested Me, tried Me, and saw My work.

10.verse: Arba’im shanah was I grieved with this generation, and said, It is a people that do stray in their lev, and they have no da’as of My ways;

11.verse: Unto whom I swore an oath in My wrath that they should not enter into My menuchah.

1.verse: O sing unto Hashem a shir chadash; sing unto Hashem, kol ha’aretz.

2.verse: Sing unto Hashem, barakhu Shmo, show forth His Yeshuah (salvation) from day to day.

3.verse: Declare His kavod among the Goyim, His nifle’ot (marvelous deeds) among all peoples.

4.verse: For Hashem is gadol, and me’od to be praised; He is to be feared above all elohim.

5.verse: For kol elohei HaAmim are elilim (idols); but Hashem made Shomayim.

6.verse: Hod and hadar are before Him; oz and tiferet are in His Mikdash.

7.verse: Render unto Hashem, O ye mishpekhot of the nations, render unto Hashem kavod and oz.

8.verse: Render unto Hashem the kavod due unto Shmo; bring a minchah, and come into His khatzerot (courtyards).

9.verse: O worship Hashem in the hadrat Kodesh; fear before Him, kol ha’aretz.

10.verse: Say among the Goyim that Hashem reigneth; the tevel also is established that it shall not be moved; He shall judge the Amim bemeysharim (in equity, in uprightness).

11.verse: Let Shomayim rejoice, and let ha’aretz be glad; let the yam roar, and the fullness thereof.

12.verse: Let the sadeh be jubilant, and all that is therein; then shall kol atzei ya’ar (all the trees of the forest) sing for joy

13.verse: Before Hashem; for He cometh, for He cometh to judge ha’aretz; He shall judge tevel betzedek (world in righteousness), and Amim with His emunah (truth).

1.verse: Hashem reigneth; let ha’aretz rejoice; let the multitude of isles thereof be glad.

2.verse: Anan and darkness are round about Him; tzedek and mishpat are the foundation of His kisse.

3.verse: Eish goeth before Him, and burneth up His enemies on every side.

4.verse: His lightnings light up the tevel; ha’aretz saw, and trembled.

5.verse: The harim melted like wax at the presence of Hashem, at the presence of Adon kol HaAretz.

6.verse: HaShomayim declare His tzedek, and kol ha’amim see His kavod.

7.verse: Shamed be all they that serve pesel, that boast themselves of elilim; worship Him, kol elohim.

8.verse: Tziyon heard, and was glad; and the banot Yehudah rejoiced because of Thy mishpatim, Hashem.

9.verse: For Thou, Hashem, art Elyon above kol ha’aretz; Thou art exalted far above kol elohim.

10.verse: Ye that love Hashem, hate rah; He preserveth the nefashot of His chasidim; He delivereth them out of the yad resha’im.

11.verse: Ohr dawns for the tzaddik, and simchah for the yishrei lev (upright in heart).

12.verse: Rejoice in Hashem, ye tzaddikim; and give thanks at the remembrance of His kodesh (holiness).

1.verse: (A Mizmor) O sing unto Hashem a shir chadash; for He hath done marvellous things; His right hand, and His zero’a kodesh, hath gotten Him victory.

2.verse: Hashem hath made known His Yeshuah (salvation); His tzedek hath He openly showed in the sight of the Goyim.

3.verse: He hath remembered His chesed and His emes toward the Bais Yisroel; all the ends of ha’aretz have seen the Yeshu’at Eloheinu (salvation of our G-d).

4.verse: Make a joyful noise unto Hashem, kol ha’aretz; make a loud noise, and rejoice, and sing praise.

5.verse: Sing unto Hashem with the kinnor; with the kinnor, and the voice of singing.

6.verse: With trumpets and sound of the shofar make a joyful noise before HaMelech Hashem.

7.verse: Let the yam roar, and the fullness thereof; the tevel, and they that dwell therein.

8.verse: Let the floods clap their hands; let the harim be joyful together

9.verse: Before Hashem; for He cometh to judge ha’aretz; with tzedek shall He judge the tevel, and the people with meisharim (uprightness).

1.verse: Hashem reigneth; let the nations tremble; He sitteth between the keruvim; let ha’aretz be shaken.

2.verse: Hashem is great in Tziyon; and He is high above all the nations.

3.verse: Let them praise Thy Shem gadol v’nora; for it is kadosh.

4.verse: The Mighty King also loveth mishpat; Thou dost establish equity, Thou executest mishpat and tzedakah in Ya’akov.

5.verse: Exalt ye Hashem Eloheinu, and worship at His footstool; for He is kadosh.

6.verse: Moshe and Aharon among His kohanim, and Shmuel among them that call upon Shmo; they called upon Hashem, and He answered them.

7.verse: He spoke unto them in the ammud anan (pillar of cloud); they were shomer over His statutes, and the chok (ordinance) that He gave them.

8.verse: Thou answeredst them, Hashem Eloheinu; Thou wast El (G-d) that forgavest them, though Thou tookest vengeance of their misdeeds.

9.verse: Exalt Hashem Eloheinu, and worship at His Har Kodesh; for Hashem Eloheinu is kadosh.

1.verse: (Mizmor l’todah) Make a joyful shout unto Hashem, all ye lands.

2.verse: Serve Hashem with simchah; come before His presence with joyful singing.

3.verse: Know ye that Hashem He is Elohim; it is He that hath made us, and not we ourselves, His people, the tzon of His pasture.

4.verse: Enter into His she’arim (gates) with todah, and into His khatzerot (courts) with tehillah; be thankful unto Him, and bless Shmo.

5.verse: For Hashem is good; His chesed is l’olam; and His emunah (faithfulness) endureth dor vador.

1.verse: (Of Dovid. Mizmor) I will sing of chesed and mishpat; unto Thee, Hashem, will I sing.

2.verse: I will study the derech tamim. O when wilt Thou come unto me? I will walk within my bais with tam levav.

3.verse: I will set no devar beliyya’al before mine eyes; I hate the work of them that fall away; it shall not cleave to me.

4.verse: A lev ikkesh (perverse heart) shall be far from me; I will not tolerate rah.

5.verse: The one who slandereth ba’seter (in secret) his neighbor, him will I destroy; him that hath haughty einayim (eyes) and a proud levav will I not endure.

6.verse: Mine eyes shall be upon the ne’emenei eretz (faithful of the land), that they may dwell with me; he that walketh in a derech tamim, he shall minister to me.

7.verse: He that worketh remiyyah (deceit) shall not dwell within my bais; he that speaketh shekarim (falsehoods, lies) shall not continue in my presence.

8.verse: In the bokerim I will destroy all rishei eretz (wicked ones of the land); that I may cut off all doers of evil from the Ir Hashem.

1.verse: (A tefillah of one afflicted; when he is faint, he pours out his si’akh [complaint] before Hashem) Hear my tefillah, Hashem, and let my cry for help come unto Thee.

2.verse: Hide not Thy face from me in the yom tzar (day of distress); incline Thine ear unto me; in the yom when I call, answer me speedily.

3.verse: For my yamim are consumed like ashan (smoke), and my atzmot burn like a furnace.

4.verse: My lev is struck, and withered like esev; so that I forget to eat my lechem.

5.verse: By reason of the voice of my groaning my atzmot have deveykus to my basar.

6.verse: I am like a bird of the midbar; I am like an owl of the desert.

7.verse: I keep watch, and am like a tzippor (bird) alone upon the gag (housetop, roof).

8.verse: Mine oyevim (enemies) reproach me kol hayom; and they that revile me curse by me.

9.verse: For I have eaten ashes like lechem, and mingled my drink with tears.

10.verse: Because of Thine za’am (indignation) and Thy ketsef (wrath, anger); for Thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.

11.verse: My days are like a tzel (shadow) that lengtheneth; and I am withered like esev (grass).

12.verse: But Thou, Hashem, shall endure l’olam; and Thy memory unto dor vador.

13.verse: Thou shalt arise, and have mercy upon Tziyon; for the time to favor her, the mo’ed (set time, appointed time) has come.

14.verse: For Thy avadim cherish her avanim (stones), and pity her aphar.

15.verse: So the Goyim shall fear the Shem Hashem, and all the melachim of ha’aretz will revere Thy glory.

16.verse: When Hashem shall build up Tziyon, He shall appear in His Kavod.

17.verse: He will regard the tefillah of the destitute, and not despise their tefillah.

18.verse: This shall be written for a dor acharon (future generation); and the people which shall be created shall praise Hashem.

19.verse: For He hath looked down from the height of His Kodesh; from Shomayim did Hashem behold Eretz;

20.verse: To hear the groaning of the asir (prisoner); to release those that are bnei temutah (men [appointed to] death);

21.verse: To declare the Shem Hashem in Tziyon, and His tehillah (praise) in Yerushalayim;

22.verse: When the peoples are gathered together in assembly, and the mamlachot (kingdoms), to serve Hashem.

23.verse: He bowed down my ko’ach in the derech; He cut short my yamim.

24.verse: I said, O my G-d, take me not away in the midst of my yamim; Thy years are dor dorim (throughout all generations).

25.verse: Of old hast Thou laid the foundation of ha’aretz; and Shomayim is the ma’aseh (work) of Thy hands.

26.verse: They shall perish, but Thou shalt remain; and all of them shall wear out like a beged (garment); like a vesture shalt Thou change them, and they shall be changed;

27.verse: But Thou art the same, and Thy shanot (years) shall have no end.

28.verse: The children of Thy avadim shall dwell, and their zera shall be established before Thee.

1.verse: (Of Dovid). Barachi (Bless) Hashem, O my nefesh; and all that is within me, bless His Shem kodesh.

2.verse: Barachi Hashem, O my nefesh, and forget not all His gmulim (benefits);

3.verse: Who forgiveth all thine avonim (iniquities); Who healeth all thy diseases;

4.verse: Who is the Go’el (Redeemer) of thy life from shachat (corruption, pit, grave); Who crowneth thee with chesed and rachamim;

5.verse: Who satisfieth thy mouth with tov; so that thy ne’urim is made chadash like the nesher.

6.verse: Hashem executeth tzedakot and mishpatim for all that are oppressed.

7.verse: He made known His drakhim unto Moshe, His deeds unto the Bnei Yisroel.

8.verse: Hashem is rachum and channun, slow to anger, and plenteous in chesed.

9.verse: He will not strive l’netzach; neither will He keep His anger l’olam.

10.verse: He hath not dealt with us according to chata’einu (our sins); nor repaid us according to avonoteinu (our iniquities).

11.verse: For as Shomayim is high above ha’aretz, so great is His chesed toward them that fear Him.

12.verse: As far as the mizrach (east) is from the ma’arav (west), so far hath He removed peysha’einu (our transgressions) from us.

13.verse: As an av has compassion on banim so Hashem has compassion on them that fear Him.

14.verse: For He has da’as of yitzreinu (our nature); He remembereth that aphar anachnu (dust we are).

15.verse: As for enosh (mankind), his yamim are like khatzir (green grass, herbage); like tzitz hasadeh (a flower of the field), so he flourisheth.

16.verse: For the ruach (wind) passeth over it, and it is gone; and the place thereof shall remember it no more.

17.verse: But the chesed Hashem is me’olam v’ad olam (from everlasting to everlasting) upon them that fear Him, and His tzedakah unto bnei banim;

18.verse: To such as are shomer over His Brit, and to those that remember His precepts to do them.

19.verse: Hashem hath established His kisse (throne) in Shomayim; and His malchut ruleth over all.

20.verse: Barachu Hashem, ye His malachim, gibborei ko’ach (mighty ones of power), that do His bidding, paying heed unto the voice of His Davar.

21.verse: Barachu Hashem, all ye His Tzivos; ye mesharetim (ministers) of His, that do His ratzon (will).

22.verse: Barachu Hashem, all His ma’asim in all places of His memshalet (dominion); Barachi Hashem, O my nefesh.

1.verse: Barachi (bless) Hashem, O my nefesh. Hashem Elohai, Thou art gadol me’od; Thou art clothed with hod (honor) and hadar (majesty).

2.verse: Who coverest Thyself with ohr (light) as with a garment; Who stretchest out Shomayim like a tent (curtain);

3.verse: Who layeth the beams of His aliyyot (upper rooms) on the mayim; Who maketh the clouds His merkavah; Who walketh upon the wings of the ruach (wind);

4.verse: Who maketh ruchot (spirits, winds) His malachim; His mesharetim (ministers), flaming eish;

5.verse: Who laid the mekhonim (foundations) of ha’aretz, that it should not move out of place olam va’ed.

6.verse: Thou coveredst it with the tehom (deep) as with a garment; the mayim stood above the harim (mountains).

7.verse: At Thy ga’arah (rebuke) they fled; at the voice of Thy thunder they hasted away.

8.verse: They go up by the harim (mountains); they go down by the beka’ot (valleys) unto the makom (place) which Thou hast assigned for them.

9.verse: Thou hast set a boundary that they [the waters] may not pass over; that they return not to cover ha’aretz.

10.verse: He sendeth the ma’ayanim (springs) into the ravines, which run among the harim.

11.verse: They give drink to every beast of the sadeh; the pera’im (donkeys) quench their thirst.

12.verse: By them shall the oph HaShomayim have their habitation, which sing among the branches.

13.verse: He watereth the harim from His aliyyot (upper rooms); ha’aretz is satisfied with the p’ri (fruit) of Thy ma’asim.

14.verse: He causeth the khatzir (grass) to grow for the behemah, and esev for the avodas ha’adam; that he may bring forth lechem out of ha’aretz;

15.verse: And yayin that maketh glad levav enosh, and shemen to make panim (faces) to shine, and lechem which strengtheneth levav enosh.

16.verse: The trees of Hashem are full of sap, the arazim (cedars) of Levanon, which He hath planted;

17.verse: Where the tzipporim (birds) make their nests; as for the khasidah (stork), the beroshim (cypresses) are her bais.

18.verse: The high hills are a makhseh (refuge, shelter) for the wild goats; and the rocks for the gophers.

19.verse: He appointed the yarei’ach for mo’adim; the shemesh knoweth the place of its going down.

20.verse: Thou makest choshech, and it is lailah; wherein all the beasts of the ya’ar (forest) do creep forth.

21.verse: The young lions roar after their teref (prey), and seek their okhel from G-d.

22.verse: The shemesh ariseth, they retreat, and lay themselves down in their me’onot (dwelling places, dens, homes [Yn 14:2 OJBC]).

23.verse: Adam goeth forth unto his work and to his avodah (labor, service) until erev.

24.verse: Hashem, how manifold are Thy ma’asim! In chochmah (wisdom; cf Psa 33:6; Yn 1:1) hast Thou made them all; ha’aretz is full of Thy creatures.

25.verse: So is this gadol (great) and rekhav (wide, spacious) yam (sea), wherein are remes (creeping things), innumerable swarming chayyot (creatures), ketanot and gedolot.

26.verse: There go the oniyyot (ships); there is that Leviathan, whom Thou hast made lesakhek (to play, to sport, to frolic) therein.

27.verse: These wait all upon Thee; that Thou mayest give them their ochel (food) in due season.

28.verse: That Thou givest them they gather; Thou openest Thine yad, they are satisfied with tov.

29.verse: Thou hidest Thy face, they are troubled; Thou takest away their ruach, they expire, and return to their aphar.

30.verse: Thou sendest forth Thy Ruach [Hakodesh], they are created; and Thou renewest the face of adamah (earth).

31.verse: The Kavod Hashem shall endure l’olam; Hashem shall rejoice in His ma’asim (works).

32.verse: He looketh on ha’aretz, and it trembleth; He toucheth the harim, and they smoke.

33.verse: I will sing unto Hashem as long as I live; I will sing praise to Elohai while I have my being.

34.verse: May my si’akh (musing, meditation) be acceptable to Him; I will have simchah in Hashem.

35.verse: Let the chatta’im (sinners) be consumed from ha’aretz, and let the resha’im (wicked) be no more. Baruch Hashem, O my nefesh. Praise Hashem!

1.verse: O give thanks unto Hashem; call upon Shmo; make known His deeds among the amim.

2.verse: Sing unto Him, sing praise unto Him; talk ye of all His nifle’ot (wondrous works).

3.verse: Glory ye in the Shem Kadosh of Him; let the lev of them that seek Hashem be glad.

4.verse: Seek Hashem, and His oz (strength); seek His face tamid.

5.verse: Remember His nifla’ot (marvellous works) that He hath done; His mofetim (wonders), and the mishpatim of His mouth;

6.verse: O ye zera Avraham His eved, ye Bnei Ya’akov His Bechirim (chosen ones).

7.verse: He is Hashem Eloheinu; His mishpatim are in kol ha’aretz.

8.verse: He hath remembered His Brit l’olam, the Dvar which He commanded to an elef dor (a thousand generations)

9.verse: Which Brit He made with Avraham, and His shevu’ah (oath) unto Yitzchak;

10.verse: And confirmed the same unto Ya’akov for a chok (decree), and to Yisroel as Brit Olam;

11.verse: Saying, Unto thee will I give Eretz Kena’an, the chevel (lot, portion) of your nachalah.

12.verse: When they were but few in mispar (number), very few, and gerim (strangers) in it.

13.verse: When they went from one goy (nation) to another, from one mamlachah (kingdom) to am acher (another people);

14.verse: He permitted no adam to oppress them; and He reproved melachim for their sakes;

15.verse: Saying, Touch not Mine meshichim (anointed ones, My Messianics), and do My nevi’im no harm.

16.verse: Moreover He called for a ra’av (famine) upon ha’aretz; He broke the kol matteh (whole staff of, all supply of) lechem.

17.verse: He sent an ish before them, even Yosef, who was sold as an eved (slave);

18.verse: Whose regel they hurt with the kevel (shackle); his nefesh was laid in barzel;

19.verse: Until the time that his dvar (prophecy, word) came to pass; the Imrat Hashem (revelation, word of G-d, i.e., revelation of that which set forth saving promises) had tested him.

20.verse: The Melech sent and released him, the Moshel Amim, and set him free.

21.verse: He made him adon of his bais, and moshel of all his possessions;

22.verse: To bind [in prison] his sarim (princes) at his pleasure; and teach his zekenim chochmah.

23.verse: Yisroel also came into Mitzrayim; thus Ya’akov sojourned in Eretz Cham.

24.verse: And He increased Amo (His people) greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.

25.verse: He turned their lev to hate Amo, to deal cunningly with His avadim.

26.verse: He sent Moshe His Eved; and Aharon whom He had chosen.

27.verse: They showed His Otot (signs) among them, and mofetim (wonders) in Eretz Cham.

28.verse: He sent choshech, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against His Devar.

29.verse: He turned their mayim into dahm, and made their dag (fish) die.

30.verse: Their land brought forth tzfarde’im (frogs) in abundance, even in the chadarim (rooms) of their melachim.

31.verse: He spoke, and there came arov (flies), and kinim (lice) in all their territory.

32.verse: He gave them barad (hail) for geshem (rain), and eish of lightning in their land.

33.verse: He struck down their gefen also and their te’enah (fig tree); and broke the trees of their territory.

34.verse: He spoke, and the arbeh (locusts) came, and grasshoppers, and that without number,

35.verse: And did eat up all the esev (herbs) in their land, and devoured their p’ri adamah (fruit of the ground).

36.verse: He struck down also kol bechor in their land, the reshit (firstfruit) of all their strength.

37.verse: He brought them forth also with kesef and zahav; and there was not one stumbling among His Shvatim (tribes).

38.verse: Mitzrayim was glad when they departed; for the pachad (terror, dread) of them had fallen upon them.

39.verse: He spread an anan for a curtain; and eish to give light in the lailah.

40.verse: The people asked, and He brought slav (quails), and satisfied them with the lechem Shomayim.

41.verse: He opened the Tzur, and the mayim gushed out; it ran in the dry places like a nahar.

42.verse: For He remembered His Davar Kadosh, and Avraham His eved.

43.verse: And He brought forth His people with sasson, and His chosen with joyful shouts;

44.verse: And gave them the lands of the Goyim; and they inherited the amal (labor, toil) of the amim;

45.verse: That they might be shomer over His chukkot, and observe His torot (laws). Praise Hashem.

1.verse: Praise Hashem! O give thanks unto Hashem; for He is tov; for His chesed endureth l’olam.

2.verse: Who can speak of the gevurot (mighty acts) of Hashem? Who can show forth all His tehillah (praise)?

3.verse: Ashrei (happy, blessed) are they who are shomrei mishpat, and he that doeth tzedakah at all times.

4.verse: Remember me, Hashem, with the favor that Thou bearest unto Thy people; O visit me with Thy Yeshuah (salvation);

5.verse: That I may see the good of Bechireicha (Thy chosen ones), that I may rejoice in the simchah of Thy nation, that I may glory with Thine nachalah (the people of Thy inheritance).

6.verse: We have sinned with Avoteinu, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

7.verse: Avoteinu had no seichal concerning Thy nifla’ot (wonders) in Mitzrayim; they remembered not the multitude of Thy mercies but provoked Him at the yam, even at the Yam Suf.

8.verse: Nevertheless He saved them for the sake of Shmo, that He might make His gevu’rot (mighty power) to be known.

9.verse: He rebuked the Yam Suf also, and it dried up; so He led them through the tehomot, as through the midbar.

10.verse: And He saved them from the yad of him that hated them, and He acted to make the go’el redemption from the yad of the oyev (enemy).

11.verse: And the mayim covered their enemies; there was not echad (one) of them left surviving.

12.verse: Then believed they in His Devarim; they sang His tehillah.

13.verse: Then they hurried, they forgot His ma’asim; they waited not for His etzah (counsel, advice, wisdom);

14.verse: But lusted exceedingly in the midbar, and tempted G-d in the desert.

15.verse: And He gave them their she’elah (request); but sent leanness into their nefesh.

16.verse: They envied Moshe also in the machaneh, and Aharon the kadosh Hashem (Aaron the holy one of Hashem).

17.verse: Eretz opened and swallowed up Datan and covered over the Adat Aviram (the company of Aviram).

18.verse: And an eish was kindled in their edah (assembly); the flame burned up the resha’im.

19.verse: They made an egel (a calf) in Chorev, and worshiped a massekhah (molden image).

20.verse: Thus they exchanged their kavod for a tavnit shor (likeness of an ox) that eateth esev (grass).

21.verse: They forgot G-d their Moshi’a, Who had done gedolot in Mitzrayim;

22.verse: Nifla’ot (wondrous works) in Eretz Cham, and nora’ot (awesome things) by the Yam Suf.

23.verse: Therefore He said that He would destroy them, had not Moshe His bechir (chosen one) stood before Him in the peretz (breach), to turn away His wrath, lest He should destroy them.

24.verse: Then they despised the eretz chemdah (desirable land); they believed not His Devar;

25.verse: But murmured in their ohalim, and paid heed not unto the kol (voice) of Hashem.

26.verse: Therefore [in oath] He lifted up His yad against them, that He would overthrow them in the midbar;

27.verse: To make their zera fall also among the Goyim, and to scatter them among the aratzot (lands).

28.verse: They joined themselves also unto Ba’al-Pe’or, and ate the zivkhei mesim (sacrifices offered to the dead).

29.verse: Thus they provoked Him to anger with their inventions; and the magefah (plague) broke out among them.

30.verse: Then stood up Pinchas, and interposed; and so the magefah (plague) was halted.

31.verse: And that was counted unto him for tzedakah l’dor vador ad olam.

32.verse: They angered Him also at the waters of Merivah, so that it went ill with Moshe on their account;

33.verse: Because they provoked His Ruach [Hakodesh] and he [Moshe] spoke unadvisedly with his sfatayim (lips).

34.verse: They did not destroy the amim (peoples), as Hashem commanded them;

35.verse: But they mingled with the Goyim, and learned their ma’asim (works, customs).

36.verse: And they served their atzabim (idols); which were a mokesh (snare) unto them.

37.verse: And, they sacrificed their banim and their banot unto shedim (demons),

38.verse: And they shed dahm naki (innocent blood), even the dahm of their banim and of their banot, whom they sacrificed unto the atzabei Kena’an (idols of Canaan); and HaAretz was polluted with blood-guilt.

39.verse: Thus they made themselves tameh with their own ma’asim, and went awhoring with their own inventions.

40.verse: Therefore was the wrath of Hashem kindled against His people, insomuch that He abhorred His own nachalah.

41.verse: And He gave them into the yad Goyim; and they that hated them ruled over them.

42.verse: Their oyevim also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their yad.

43.verse: Many times did He deliver them; but they provoked Him with their etzah (counsel), and so perished in their avon (iniquity).

44.verse: Nevertheless He regarded their affliction, when He heard their rinnah (cry of grief);

45.verse: And He remembered for their sake His Brit, and relented according to the multitude of His chasadim (lovingkindnesses).

46.verse: He made them also to be pitied with rachamim by all those that carried them away as captives.

47.verse: Hoshieini (save us), Hashem Eloheinu, and gather us from among the Goyim, to give thanks unto Thy Shem Kadosh, and to glory in Thy tehillah (praise).

48.verse: Baruch Hashem Elohei Yisroel min haOlam v’ad haOlam; and let kol HaAm say, Omein. Praise Hashem!

1.verse: O give thanks unto Hashem, for He is tov; ki l’olam chasdo (for His mercy endureth forever).

2.verse: Let the Geulei Hashem (the redeemed of Hashem) say so, whom He hath redeemed from the yad tzar;

3.verse: And gathered them out of the lands, from the mizrach (east), and from the ma’arav (west), from the tzafon (north), and from the yam (sea).

4.verse: They wandered in the midbar in a desolate region; they found no derech to an ir moshav (inhabited city).

5.verse: Re’evim (hungry) and tzeme’im (thirsty), their nefesh fainted within them.

6.verse: Then they cried unto Hashem in their tzoros, and He delivered them out of their distresses.

7.verse: And He led them forth by the derech yesharah that they might go to an ir moshav.

8.verse: Oh that men would praise Hashem for His chesed, and for His nifla’ot (wonderful works) to the Bnei Adam!

9.verse: For He satisfieth the longing nefesh, and filleth the hungry nefesh with the tov.

10.verse: Such as sit in choshech and in tzalmavet, being bound in oni and barzel (iron);

11.verse: Because they rebelled against the words of G-d, and despised the atzat Elyon (counsel of the Most High);

12.verse: Therefore He brought down their lev with amal (toil); they stumbled, and there was no ozer (helper).

13.verse: Then they cried out unto Hashem in their tzoros, and He saved them out of their distresses.

14.verse: He brought them out of choshech and tzalmavet, and broke apart their chains.

15.verse: Oh that men would praise Hashem for His chesed, and for His nifla’ot (wonderful works) to the Bnei Adam!

16.verse: For He hath broken down the dlatot nechoshet, and cut asunder the bars of barzel (iron).

17.verse: Fools because of their derech peysha, and because of their avonot (iniquities), were afflicted.

18.verse: Their nefesh abhorreth all manner of ochel (food); and they drew near unto the sha’arei mavet (gates of death).

19.verse: Then they cried unto Hashem in their tzoros, and He saveth them out of their distresses.

20.verse: He sent His Davar, and healed them, and delivered them from their destructions [See Yn 1:1, 14; Mt 4:23].

21.verse: Oh that men would praise Hashem for His chesed, and for His nifla’ot (wonderful works) to the Bnei Adam!

22.verse: And let them sacrifice the zivkhei todah (sacrifices of thanksgiving), and recount His works with joyful singing.

23.verse: They that go down to the yam in oniyot (ships), that do business on mayim rabbim (great waters);

24.verse: These have seen the ma’asei Hashem, and His nifla’ot (wonders) in the deep.

25.verse: For He commandeth, and raiseth up a ruach sa’arah (stormy wind), which lifteth up the galim (waves) thereof.

26.verse: They [the galim] mount up to Shomayim, they went down again to the tehomot (depths); their nefesh melted in ra’ah (peril, trouble).

27.verse: They reeled and staggered like a shikkor, and were at their wit’s end.

28.verse: Then they cried unto Hashem in their tzoros, and He brought them out of their distresses.

29.verse: He made the sa’arah (storm) a calm, so that the galim (waves) thereof were still [Mk 4:41].

30.verse: Then were they glad because they were quiet; so He brought them unto their makhoz chefetz (desired haven, city, district, boundary).

31.verse: Oh that men would praise Hashem for His chesed, and for His nifla’ot (wonderful works) to the Bnei Adam!

32.verse: Let them exalt Him also in the Kehal Am, and praise Him in the moshav zekenim (council of the elders).

33.verse: He turneth neharot (rivers) into a midbar, and the springs of water into dry ground;

34.verse: An eretz p’ri (fruitful land) into salt wasteland, because of the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

35.verse: He turneth the midbar into an agam (pool, lake) of mayim, and dry ground into springs of water.

36.verse: And there He maketh the hungry to dwell, that they may found an ir moshav (an inhabited city);

37.verse: And sow the sadot, and plant kramim, and acquire p’ri tevu’ah (fruits of increase).

38.verse: He made a brocha on them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and He doth not permit their behemah to decrease.

39.verse: Again, they are diminished and brought low through otzer (oppression), ra’ah (calamity, peril, trouble) and yagon (sorrow, grief).

40.verse: He poureth contempt upon nedivim (nobles), and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no derech.

41.verse: Yet setteth He the evyon (needy) up above oni (affliction), and maketh him mishpekhot like a tzon (flock).

42.verse: The yesharim (upright ones) shall see it, and rejoice with simchah; and all iniquity shall shut its mouth.

43.verse: Whosoever is chacham, and will be shomer over these things, even they shall understand the chasdei Hashem (lovingkindnesses of Hashem).

1.verse: (Shir. Mizmor of Dovid) O Elohim, my lev is nachon; I will sing and make music, even with my kavod (glory, soul).

2.verse: Awake, nevel and kinnor; I will awaken the shachar (dawn).

3.verse: I will praise Thee, Hashem, among the peoples; and I will sing praises unto Thee among the nations.

4.verse: For Thy chesed is gadol above Shomayim; and Thy emes reacheth unto the clouds.

5.verse: Be Thou exalted, Elohim, above Shomayim; and Thy kavod above kol ha’aretz;

6.verse: That Thy beloved may be delivered; hoshiah (save) with Thy Yamin, and answer me.

7.verse: Elohim hath spoken in His Kodesh; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and measure out the Valley of Sukkot.

8.verse: Gil‘ad is Mine; Menasheh is Mine; Ephrayim also is the maoz of Mine rosh; Yehudah is My mechokek (lawgiver);

9.verse: Moav is My washbasin; over Edom will I toss My na’al (sandal); over Philistia will I shout in triumph.

10.verse: Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who will lead me into Edom?

11.verse: Wilt not Thou, Elohim, Who hast cast us off? And wilt not Thou, Elohim, go forth with our Tzivos?

12.verse: Give us help against the enemy; for vain is the teshuat adam (help of man).

13.verse: Through Elohim we shall do valiantly; for He it is that shall tread down our enemies.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Of Dovid. Mizmor) Hold not Thy peace, O Elohei tehillati;

2.verse: For the mouth of the rasha and the mouth of the mirmah are opened against me; they have spoken against me with a leshon sheker (a lying tongue).

3.verse: They surrounded me also with divrei sinah (words of hatred); and attacked me without cause.

4.verse: In return for my ahavah they are my adversaries; but I give myself unto tefillah (prayer).

5.verse: Thus they have laid upon me ra’ah for tovah, and sinah for my ahavah.

6.verse: Set Thou a rasha (wicked man) over him; and let Satan (the Accuser) stand at his yamin (right hand).

7.verse: When he shall be tried, let him be in the judgment condemned; and let his tefillah (prayer) become sin.

8.verse: Let his yamim be few; and let another take his pekuddat [See Ac 1:20 OJBC].

9.verse: Let his banim be yetomim, and his isha an almanah.

10.verse: Let his banim be continually vagabonds, and beg; let them seek from their ruins.

11.verse: Let the nosheh (creditor) seize all that he hath; and let the zarim (strangers) plunder his labor.

12.verse: Let there be none to extend chesed unto him; neither let there be any to favor his yetomim.

13.verse: Let his posterity be cut off; and in the dor acher (generation following) let their shem be blotted out.

14.verse: Let the avon of his avot be remembered before Hashem; and let not the chattat immo be blotted out.

15.verse: Let them be before Hashem tamid, that He may cut off the memory of them from ha’aretz.

16.verse: Because he remembered not to show chesed, but persecuted the ish oni and the evyon, that he might even slay the nikheh levav (brokenhearted person).

17.verse: As he loved kelalah (cursing), so it came on him; as he delighted not in brocha (blessing), so it was far from him.

18.verse: As he clothed himself with kelalah as with his garment, so let it come into his inward parts like mayim, and like shemen into his atzmot.

19.verse: Let it be unto him like a beged which covereth him, and for a belt wherewith he is girded tamid (continually).

20.verse: This is the reward of mine adversaries from Hashem, and of them that speak rah against my nefesh.

21.verse: But Thou O Hashem Adonoi, do with me for the sake of Thy Name; because Thy chesed is tov, deliver Thou me.

22.verse: For I am oni and evyon, and my lev is wounded within me.

23.verse: I am gone like a lengthening tzel (shadow); I am shaken off like the arbeh.

24.verse: My knees are weak from a tzom; and my basar faileth of fatness.

25.verse: I became also a cherpah (reproach) unto them; when they looked upon me, they shaked their heads.

26.verse: Help me, O Hashem Elohai; O hoshi’eini (save me) according to Thy chesed;

27.verse: That they may know that this is Thy Yad; that Thou, Hashem, hast done it.

28.verse: Let them make kelalah (curse), but do Thou make brocha; when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let Thy eved rejoice.

29.verse: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own shame, as with a me’il (cloak).

30.verse: I will greatly praise Hashem with my mouth; and, I will praise Him among the multitude.

31.verse: For He shall stand at the yamin (right hand) of the evyon (needy), to save him from those that judge with condemnation his nefesh [cf Mt 9:10-11].

1.verse: (Of Dovid. Mizmor). Hashem said unto Adoni [i.e., Moshiach Adoneinu; Malachi 3:1], Sit thou at My right hand, until I make thine enemies a footstool for thy feet.

2.verse: Hashem shall stretch forth the rod of thy might out of Tziyon; rule thou in the midst of thine [Moshiach’s] enemies [i.e., anti-Moshiachs].

3.verse: Thy [Moshiach’s Messianic] people, willing in the Day of thy [Moshiach’s called up] Army, will be arrayed in the splendor of kodesh (holiness); from the womb of the dawn, cometh to thee [Moshiach] thy young men [cf Isa 53:10] as the tal (dew) [Rv 19:14].

4.verse: Hashem hath sworn, and will not relent, Thou [Moshiach] art a kohen l’olam al divrati Malki-Tzedek (kohen forever in respect to the order of Malki-Tzedek; [see Bereshis 14:18; note it is the kohen who makes kapporah for sin—see Leviticus 4:20; Isa 53:8).

5.verse: Adonoi at thy right hand shall dash melachim (kings) in pieces in the Yom Afo (Day of His Wrath).

6.verse: He [Adonoi acting through Moshiach] shall judge among the Goyim, He shall heap up geviyyot (corpses); He shall dash in pieces Rosh (Head; Gn 3:15] al Eretz Rabbah (over Great, Whole Earth, cf 2Th 2:8).

7.verse: Of the brook in the Derech shall he [Moshiach] drink; therefore shall he lift up [as victor] the Rosh [Moshiach’s head; PP 2:8-10; Ep 4:15].

1.verse: Praise Hashem. I will praise Hashem with kol levav, in the Sod (company, council) of the Yesharim (upright ones), and in the Edah (assembly).

2.verse: The ma’asei Hashem are gedolim, derushim (sought out, pondered) of all them that have delight therein.

3.verse: His po’al (deed, work) is glorious and majestic; and His tzedakah (righteousness) endureth forever.

4.verse: He hath caused His nifla’ot (wonderful works) to be remembered; Hashem is channun (gracious) and rachum (compassionate).

5.verse: He hath given food unto them that fear Him; He will be mindful of His Brit (covenant) l’olam.

6.verse: He hath showed His people the ko’ach of His works, that He may give them the nachalat Goyim.

7.verse: The works of His hands are emes and mishpat; all His pikkudim (precepts, commands) are ne’emanim (sure, trustworthy ones).

8.verse: They stand fast la’ad l’olam (forever and ever), and are done in emes and yashar (uprightness).

9.verse: He sent redemption unto His people; He hath ordained His Brit (covenant) l’olam (forever); Kadosh (holy) and Nora (awesome, reverend) is Shmo.

10.verse: The fear of Hashem is the reshit chochmah; seichel tov have all they that live by it; His tehillah (praise) endureth forever.

1.verse: Praise Hashem. Ashrei is the ish that feareth Hashem, that delighteth greatly in His mitzvot.

2.verse: His zera shall be gibbor ba’aretz; the dor (generation) of the Yesharim (upright ones) shall be blessed.

3.verse: Wealth and osher (riches) shall be in his bais; and his tzedakah endureth forever.

4.verse: Unto the Yesharim (upright ones) there ariseth ohr in the choshech; he is channun, and rachum, and tzaddik.

5.verse: A tov ish is generous, and lendeth; he will guide his affairs with mishpat.

6.verse: Surely he shall never falter; the tzaddik shall be in remembrance olam (forever).

7.verse: He shall not be afraid of mishmu’ah ra’ah (news of misfortune, evil tidings); his lev is nachon (steadfast), trusting in Hashem.

8.verse: His lev is samuch (sustained), he shall not be afraid, until he look in triumph upon his foes.

9.verse: He hath contributed freely, he hath given to the evyonim (needy); his tzedakah endureth forever; his keren shall be lifted up in kavod.

10.verse: The rasha shall see it, and be incensed; he shall gnash his teeth, and waste away; the ta’avot resha’im (desire of the wicked ones) shall come to nothing.

1.verse: Praise ye Hashem. Praise O ye avadim of Hashem, praise the Shem of Hashem.

2.verse: Blessed be the Shem of Hashem from this time forth and forevermore.

3.verse: From the rising of the shemesh unto the going down of the same the Shem of Hashem is to be praised.

4.verse: Hashem is high above kol Goyim, and His kavod above HaShomayim.

5.verse: Who is like unto Hashem Eloheinu, Who dwelleth on high,

6.verse: Who stoopeth down to behold the things that are in Shomayim, and in ha’aretz!

7.verse: He raiseth up the poor out of the aphar (dust), and lifteth the needy out of the ash heap;

8.verse: That he may seat him with princes, even with the princes of amo (His people).

9.verse: He settleth the akeret (barren woman) in her bais to be a happy em of banim. Praise ye Hashem.

1.verse: When Yisroel went out of Mitzrayim, Bais Ya’akov from a people of foreign tongue,

2.verse: Yehudah was His kodesh (sanctuary), and Yisroel His dominion.

3.verse: The yam saw it, and fled; Yarden was driven back.

4.verse: The harim skipped like rams, and the little hills like lambs.

5.verse: What ailed thee, O thou yam, that thou didst flee? Thou Yarden, that thou wast driven back?

6.verse: Ye harim, that ye skipped like rams; and ye little hills, like lambs?

7.verse: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of Hashem, at the presence of Elohei Ya’akov;

8.verse: Which turned the rock into a pool of mayim, the flint into a spring of mayim.

1.verse: Not unto us, Hashem, not unto us, but unto Thy Shem give kavod, for the sake of Thy chesed, and for Thy emes.

2.verse: Why should the Goyim say, Where is now their Elohim?

3.verse: But Eloheinu is in Shomayim; He hath done whatsoever He hath pleased.

4.verse: Their atzabim (idols) are kesef and zahav, the ma’aseh (work) of the hands of adam.

5.verse: Peh (mouth) they have, but they speak not; einayim (eyes) have they, but they see not;

6.verse: Oznayim (ears) they have, but they hear not; af (nose) have they, but they smell not;

7.verse: They have hands, but they handle not; raglayim (feet) have they, but they walk not; neither speak they through their garon (throat).

8.verse: They that make them will be like them; so is kol asher bote’ach (every one that trusteth) in them.

9.verse: O Yisroel, trust thou in Hashem. He is their ezrah (help) and their mogen.

10.verse: O Bais Aharon, trust thou in Hashem; He is their ezrah (help) and their mogen.

11.verse: The ones fearing Hashem, trust in Hashem; He is their ezrah (help) and their mogen (shield).

12.verse: Hashem hath been mindful of us; Yevarech. Yevarech es Bais Yisroel; Yevarech es Bais Aharon.

13.verse: Yevarech Yirei Hashem (He will bless those who fear Hashem), the ketanim with the gedolim.

14.verse: May Hashem give you increase, upon you and your banim.

15.verse: May a barukhah be upon you by Hashem, Oseh Shomayim va’Aretz (Maker of Heaven and Earth).

16.verse: The heavens, even Shomayim, is Hashem’s, but HaAretz He gave to the Bnei Adam.

17.verse: The mesim (dead ones) praise not Hashem, neither do any that descend into Dumah (the silent [place of Sheol]).

18.verse: But we will bless Hashem from this time forth v’ad olam (and to forevermore). Praise Hashem.

1.verse: I love Hashem, because He hath heard my kol (voice), even my techinnah.

2.verse: Because He hath inclined His ozen (ear) unto me, therefore will I call upon Him while I have days.

3.verse: Chevlei mavet (pangs of death) encompassed me, and the metzarei She’ol (confines, straitnesses of She’ol) have caught up with me and found me; tzoros and yagon (sorrow) I found.

4.verse: Then called I b’Shem Hashem: O Hashem, save my nefesh!

5.verse: Channun (gracious) is Hashem, and tzaddik; yes, Eloheinu is merciful.

6.verse: Hashem is shomer over the petayim (simple-hearted, helpless); I was in need and li yehoshia (me He saved).

7.verse: Return, my nefesh, to thy menuchah (rest, resting place); for Hashem hath dealt bountifully with thee.

8.verse: For Thou hast saved my nefesh from mavet (death), mine eye from dimah (tears), and mine regel (foot) from stumbling.

9.verse: I will walk before Hashem in the Artzot HaChayim (the Land of the Living). [T.N. Note that I can do that because Moshiach was cut off from there in my place and for my sins—Isa 53:8]

10.verse: He’emaneti (I believed); therefore have I spoken; I was greatly afflicted.

11.verse: I said in my chafaz (haste, alarm, consternation), Kol HaAdam Kozev (all men are liars).

12.verse: How shall I repay Hashem for all His benefits to me?

13.verse: I will raise the Kos Yeshu’ot (the Cup of Salvation), and call upon Hashem b’Shem (by Name).

14.verse: I will fulfill my nederim (vows) now in the presence of all His people.

15.verse: Precious in the eyes of Hashem is the mavet of His Chasidim.

16.verse: O Hashem, truly I am Thy eved; I am Thy eved, ben amatecha (the son of Thy maid servant); Thou hast removed my chains.

17.verse: I will sacrifice to Thee the zevach todah (the thanksgiving offering) and will call on the Shem Hashem.

18.verse: I will fulfill my nederim to Hashem now in the presence of all His people.

19.verse: In the khatzerot Beis Hashem, in the midst of thee, O Yerushalayim. Praise ye Hashem.

1.verse: O praise Hashem, all ye Goyim; praise Him, all ye peoples.

2.verse: For His chesed is mighty toward us; and the Emes Hashem endureth l’olam (forever). Praise ye Hashem.

1.verse: O give thanks unto Hashem; for He is tov; Ki l’olam chasdo (for His mercy endureth forever).

2.verse: Let Yisroel now say, Ki l’olam chasdo.

3.verse: Let the Bais Aharon now say, Ki l’olam chasdo.

4.verse: Let them now that fear Hashem say, Ki l’olam chasdo,

5.verse: I called upon Hashem in distress; Hashem answered me, and set me in a broad place.

6.verse: Hashem is on my side; I will not fear; what can adam do unto me?

7.verse: Hashem taketh my part through them that help me; therefore shall I see my desire upon them that hate me.

8.verse: It is better to trust in Hashem than to put confidence in adam.

9.verse: It is better to trust in Hashem than to put confidence in nedivim (nobles).

10.verse: All Goyim surrounded me; but in the Shem Hashem will I cut them off.

11.verse: They surrounded me; yes, they compassed me about; but in the Shem Hashem I will cut them off.

12.verse: They compassed me about like devorim (bees); they are extinguished like the eish of kotzim (thorns); for in the Shem Hashem I will cut them off.

13.verse: Thou hast hard pushed at me that I fell; but Hashem helped me.

14.verse: Hashem is my oz (strength) and zimrah (song), and He is become my Yeshuah (salvation).

15.verse: The voice of rejoicing and Yeshuah (salvation) is in the ohalim of the tzaddikim; the Yamin Hashem doeth valiantly.

16.verse: The Yamin Hashem is exalted; the Yamin Hashem doeth valiantly.

17.verse: I shall not die, but live, and declare the ma’asim (works) of Hashem.

18.verse: Hashem hath hard chastened me severely; but He hath not given me over unto mavet (death).

19.verse: Open to me the sha’arei tzedek; I will go through them, and I will praise Hashem;

20.verse: This is the sha’ar of Hashem, into which the tzaddikim shall enter.

21.verse: I will praise Thee; for Thou hast heard me, and art become my Yeshuah (salvation).

22.verse: The Even (Stone) which the Bonim (Builders) rejected [mem-alef-samech, see same word Psalm 89:38 (39)] has become the Rosh Pinnah (Cornerstone).

23.verse: This is Hashem’s doing; it is marvellous in our eyes.

24.verse: This is the yom which Hashem hath made; let us rejoice and be glad in it.

25.verse: Save now, we beseech Thee, Hashem; Hashem, we beseech thee, send now prosperity.

26.verse: Baruch habah b’Shem Hashem; we have blessed you from the Beis Hashem.

27.verse: Hashem is G-d, Who hath showed us light; bind the chag (festival offering) with cords, even until [you come to] the karnot of the Mizbe’ach.

28.verse: Thou art my G-d, and I will praise Thee; Thou art Elohai, I will exalt Thee.

29.verse: O give thanks unto Hashem; for He is tov; ki l’olam chasdo (for His mercy endureth forever). [T.N. A ma’amin b’Moshiach will carry Scripture with him at all times, as the following Psalm teaches.]

1.verse: ALEF Ashrei are the blameless ones in the derech, who walk in the torat Hashem.

2.verse: Ashrei are they that keep His edot (testimonies), and that seek Him with kol lev.

3.verse: They also do no iniquity; they walk in His drakhim.

4.verse: Thou hast commanded us to be diligently shomer over Thy pikkudim (precepts).

5.verse: O that my drakhim were directed to be shomer over Thy chukkot (statutes)!

6.verse: Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect unto all Thy mitzvot.

7.verse: I will praise Thee with yosher levav (uprightness of heart) when I shall have learned Thy righteous mishpatim (ordinances).

8.verse: I will keep Thy chukkot; O forsake me not utterly. BEIS

9.verse: How shall a na’ar cleanse his way? By being shomer thereto according to Thy Davar (Word).

10.verse: With my kol lev have I sought Thee; O let me not wander from Thy mitzvot.

11.verse: Thy word have I hid in my lev, lema’an (so that) I might not sin against Thee.

12.verse: Baruch atah, Adonoi; teach me Thy chukkot.

13.verse: With my sfatayim (lips) have I declared all the mishpatim of Thy mouth.

14.verse: I have rejoiced in the derech of Thy edot (testimonies), as much as in all riches.

15.verse: I will meditate in Thy pikkudim, and consider Thy orkhot (paths).

16.verse: I will delight myself in Thy chukkot; I will not forget Thy Davar. GIMEL

17.verse: Deal bountifully with Thy eved, that I may live, and be shomer over Thy Davar.

18.verse: Open Thou mine eyes, that I may behold nifla’ot out of Thy torah.

19.verse: I am a ger on ha’aretz; hide not Thy mitzvot from me.

20.verse: My nefesh is shattered with ta’avah for Thy mishpatim at all times.

21.verse: Thou hast rebuked the zedim (arrogant ones) that are arurim (cursed ones), which do wander from Thy mitzvot.

22.verse: Remove from me cherpah (reproach) and contempt; for I have kept Thy edot (testimonies).

23.verse: Though sarim (princes) also sit and speak slander against me, yet Thy eved meditates on Thy chukkot.

24.verse: Thy edot (testimonies) also are my delight and anshei atzati (my counsellors). DALET

25.verse: My nefesh has deveykus unto the aphar; revive Thou me according to Thy Davar.

26.verse: I have recounted my drakhim, and Thou heardest me; teach me Thy chukkot.

27.verse: Make me to understand the derech of Thy pikkudim; so shall I meditate on Thy nifla’ot.

28.verse: My nefesh drops with heavy sorrow; strengthen Thou me according unto Thy Davar.

29.verse: Remove from me the derech sheker; and graciously grant me Thy torah.

30.verse: I have chosen the derech emunah; thy mishpatim have I accounted worthy.

31.verse: I have deveykus with Thy edot (testimonies); Hashem, let me not be ashamed.

32.verse: I will run the derech of Thy mitzvot, for Thou shalt set my lev free. HEH

33.verse: Teach me, Hashem, the derech of Thy chukkot; and I shall keep it unto the end.

34.verse: Give me understanding, and I shall keep Thy torah; yes, I shall be shomer over it with my kol lev.

35.verse: Make me to go in the path of Thy mitzvot; for therein do I delight.

36.verse: Incline my lev unto Thy edot, and not to betza (covetousness, selfish gain).

37.verse: Turn away mine eyes from beholding shav (vanity); and revive Thou me in Thy derech.

38.verse: Establish Thy word unto Thy eved, which is for the fear of Thee.

39.verse: Turn away my cherpah (reproach) which I fear; for Thy mishpatim are tovim.

40.verse: Hinei, I have longed after Thy precepts; revive me in Thy tzedakah. VAV

41.verse: Let Thy chasadim come also unto me, Hashem, even Thy Teshu’ah (salvation), according to Thy word.

42.verse: So shall I have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me; for I trust in Thy Davar.

43.verse: And take not the devar emes utterly out of my mouth; for I have hoped in Thy mishpatim.

44.verse: So shall I be shomer over Thy torah tamid l’olam va’ed.

45.verse: And I will walk freely in a wide place; for I seek Thy pikkudim.

46.verse: I will speak of Thy edot (testimonies) also before melachim, and will not be ashamed.

47.verse: And I will delight myself in Thy mitzvot, which I love.

48.verse: My palms also will I lift up unto Thy mitzvot, which I love; and I will meditate on Thy chukkot. ZAYIN

49.verse: Remember the davar to Thy eved, on which Thou hast made me hope.

50.verse: This is my comfort in my oni (affliction); for Thy word hath revived me.

51.verse: The zedim (arrogant ones) have had me greatly in derision; yet have I not turned aside from Thy torah.

52.verse: I remembered Thy mishpatim from of old, Hashem; and have comforted myself.

53.verse: Zalafah (indignation) hath taken hold upon me because of the resha’im that forsake Thy torah.

54.verse: Thy chukkot have been my zemirot (songs) in the bais of my pilgrimage.

55.verse: I have remembered Thy Shem, Hashem, in the lailah, and have been shomer over Thy torah.

56.verse: Zot hayetah li, because I kept Thy pikkudim. CHET

57.verse: Thou art my chelek, Hashem; I have said I would be shomer over Thy words.

58.verse: I sought Thy Face with my kol lev; be gracious unto me according to Thy word.

59.verse: I thought on my drakhim, and turned my feet unto Thy edot (testimonies).

60.verse: I made haste, and delayed not to be shomer over Thy mitzvot.

61.verse: The ropes of the resha’im have bound me; but I have not forgotten Thy torah.

62.verse: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto Thee because of Thy righteous mishpatim.

63.verse: I am a chaver of all them that fear Thee, and of them that are shomer over Thy pikkudim.

64.verse: Ha’aretz, Hashem, is full of Thy chesed; teach me Thy chukkot. TET

65.verse: Thou hast dealt well with Thy eved, Hashem, according unto Thy word.

66.verse: Teach me good judgment and da’as; for I have believed in Thy mitzvot.

67.verse: Before I was afflicted I went astray; but now have I been shomer over Thy word.

68.verse: Thou art tov, and doest tov; teach me Thy chukkot.

69.verse: The zedim (arrogant ones) have forged a sheker against me; but I will keep Thy pikkudim with my kol lev.

70.verse: Their lev is callous like chelev; I delight in Thy torah.

71.verse: It is tov for me that I have been afflicted l’ma’an (in order that) I might learn Thy chukkot.

72.verse: The torah of Thy mouth is better unto me than thousands of zahav and kesef. ' YOD

73.verse: Thy hands have made me and established me: give me understanding, that I may learn Thy mitzvot.

74.verse: They that fear Thee will be glad when they see me; for I have hoped in Thy Davar.

75.verse: I know, Hashem, Thy mishpatim are tzedek, and Thou in emunah (faithfulness) hast afflicted me.

76.verse: Let now Thy chesed be for my comfort, according to Thy word unto Thy eved.

77.verse: Let Thy rachamim come unto me, that I may live: for Thy torah is my delight.

78.verse: Let the zedim (arrogant ones) be ashamed; for they dealt perversely with me without a cause: but I will meditate on Thy pikkudim (percepts).

79.verse: Let those that fear Thee turn unto me, and those that have known Thy edot.

80.verse: Let my lev be tamim (blameless, complete) in Thy chukkot; that I be not ashamed. Kaf

81.verse: My nefesh fainteth for Thy salvation: but I hope in Thy davar.

82.verse: Mine eyes fail for Thy word saying, Mosai (when) wilt Thou comfort me?

83.verse: For I am become like a wineskin in the smoke; yet do I not forget Thy chukkot.

84.verse: How many are the days of Thy eved? Mosai (when) wilt Thou execute mishpat on them that persecute me?

85.verse: The zedim (arrogant ones) have dug pits for me, which are not in accordance with Thy torah.

86.verse: All Thy mitzvot are faithful: they persecute me wrongfully; help Thou me.

87.verse: They had almost consumed me ba’aretz; but I forsook not Thy pikkudim.

88.verse: Revive me after Thy chesed; so shall I be shomer over the edut of Thy mouth. Lamed

89.verse: Forever, Hashem, Thy Davar is settled and stands firm in Shomayim.

90.verse: Thy emunah (faithfulness) is to all generations: Thou hast established eretz, and it stands enduring.

91.verse: They continue enduring to this day according to Thine mishpatim: for all things are Thy avadim.

92.verse: Unless Thy torah had been my delight, I should then have perished in mine oni.

93.verse: I will never forget Thy pikkudim: for with them Thou hast revived me.

94.verse: I am Thine, save me: for I have sought out Thy pikkudim.

95.verse: The resha’im have waited for me to destroy me: but I will think on Thy edot.

96.verse: I have seen an end of all perfection: but Thy mitzvah is boundless. Mem

97.verse: O how I love Thy torah! It is my meditation kol hayom.

98.verse: Thou through Thy mitzvot hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they are ever with me.

99.verse: I have more understanding than every melamed of mine: for Thy edot are my meditation.

100.verse: I understand more than the zekenim, for I keep Thy pikkudim.

101.verse: I have refrained my feet from every orakh rah, in order that I might be shomer over Thy Devar.

102.verse: I have not departed from Thy mishpatim: for Thou hast taught me.

103.verse: How sweet are Thy words unto my palate! Sweeter than devash to my mouth!

104.verse: Through Thy pikkudim I get understanding: therefore I hate every orakh sheker. Nun

105.verse: Thy word is a ner unto my feet, ohr unto my path.

106.verse: I have sworn a shevuah, and I will perform it, that I will keep Thy righteous mishpatim.

107.verse: I am afflicted very much: revive me, Hashem, according unto Thy word.

108.verse: Accept the nidvot of my mouth, O Hashem, and teach me Thy mishpatim.
