109.verse: My nefesh is continually in my yad: yet do I not forget Thy torah.

110.verse: The resha’im have laid a pach for me: yet I erred not from Thy pikkudim.

111.verse: Thy edot have I taken as a heritage forever: for they are the sasson lev of me.

112.verse: I have inclined mine lev to perform Thy chukkot forever, even unto the end. Samech

113.verse: I hate the doubleminded: but Thy torah do I love.

114.verse: Thou art my seter (hiding place) and my mogen: I hope in Thy Devar.

115.verse: Depart from me, ye evildoers: for I will keep the mitzvot of Elohai.

116.verse: Uphold me according unto Thy imrah, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed from my hope.

117.verse: Hold Thou me up, and I shall be safe: and I will have respect unto Thy chukkot continually.

118.verse: Thou hast rejected all them that err from Thy chukkot: for their deceitfulness is sheker (falsehood).

119.verse: Thou puttest away all resha’im of eretz like dross; therefore I love Thy edot.

120.verse: My basar trembleth for fear of Thee; and I am afraid of Thy mishpatim. AYIN

121.verse: I have done mishpat and tzedek; leave me not to mine oppressors.

122.verse: Be surety for Thy eved for good; let not the zedim (arrogant ones) oppress me.

123.verse: Mine eyes fail for Thy Yeshuah (salvation), and for the word of Thy tzedakah.

124.verse: Deal with Thy eved according unto Thy chesed, and teach me Thy chukkot.

125.verse: I am Thy eved; give me understanding, that I may know Thy edot (testimonies).

126.verse: It is time for Thee, Hashem, to work; for they have made void Thy torah.

127.verse: Therefore I love Thy mitzvot above zahav; yes, above fine gold.

128.verse: Therefore I esteem right all Thy pikkudim concerning all things; and I hate every orakh sheker. PEH

129.verse: Thy edot (testimonies) are wonderful; therefore doth my nefesh keep them.

130.verse: The petach (entrance, doorway) of Thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding unto the simple.

131.verse: I opened my mouth, and panted; for I longed for Thy mitzvot.

132.verse: Look Thou upon me, and be merciful unto me, as Thy manner is unto those that love Shimcha.

133.verse: Order my footsteps in Thy imrah; and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.

134.verse: Redeem me from the oppression of adam; so will I keep Thy pikkudim.

135.verse: Make Thy face to shine upon Thy eved; and teach me Thy chukkot.

136.verse: Rivers of waters run down mine eyes, for they are not shomer over Thy torah. TZADDI

137.verse: Righteous art Thou, Hashem, and yashar are Thy mishpatim.

138.verse: Thy edot (testimonies) that Thou hast commanded are tzedek and emunah me’od (very faithful).

139.verse: My zeal hath consumed me, because mine enemies have forgotten Thy devarim.

140.verse: Thy word is very tested; therefore Thy eved loveth it.

141.verse: I am small and despised; yet do not I forget Thy pikkudim.

142.verse: Thy tzedakah is tzedek l’olam, and Thy torah emes.

143.verse: Tzoros and anguish have taken hold on me; yet Thy mitzvot are my delight.

144.verse: The tzedek of Thy edot is l’olam; give me understanding, and I shall live. KOPH

145.verse: I cried with my kol lev; hear me, Hashem; I will keep Thy chukkot.

146.verse: I cried unto Thee; save me, and I shall be shomer over Thy edot (testimonies).

147.verse: I rose before the dawn, and cried out for help; I hoped in Thy Davar.

148.verse: Mine eyes are awake through the ashmurot (night watches), that I might meditate on Thy word.

149.verse: Hear my voice according unto Thy chesed; Hashem, revive me according to Thy mishpat.

150.verse: They draw near that follow after wicked schemes; they are far from Thy torah.

151.verse: Thou art karov (near), Hashem; and all Thy mitzvot are emes.

152.verse: Concerning Thy edot (testimonies), I have known of old that Thou hast founded them forever. RESH

153.verse: Consider mine oni (affliction), and deliver me; for I do not forget Thy torah.

154.verse: Plead my cause; for me make go’el redemption; revive me according to Thy word.

155.verse: Yeshuah (salvation) is far from the resha’im, for they seek not Thy chukkot.

156.verse: Great are Thy rachamim, Hashem; revive me according to Thy mishpatim.

157.verse: Many are my persecutors and mine enemies; yet do I not turn aside from Thy edot.

158.verse: I beheld the bogedim, and was grieved because they were not shomer over Thy word.

159.verse: Consider how I love Thy pikkudim; revive me, Hashem, according to Thy chesed.

160.verse: Thy word is emes from the beginning; and every one of Thy righteous mishpatim endureth forever. SHIN

161.verse: Sarim (princes) have persecuted me without a cause; but my lev standeth in awe of Thy Davar.

162.verse: I rejoice at Thy imrah (word), as one that findeth great plunder.

163.verse: I hate and abhor sheker; but Thy torah do I love.

164.verse: Shevah times a day do I praise Thee because of Thy righteous mishpatim.

165.verse: Great shalom have they which love Thy torah; nothing shall cause them to stumble.

166.verse: Hashem, I have hoped for Thy Yeshuah (salvation), and do Thy mitzvot.

167.verse: My nefesh is shomer over Thy edot (testimonies); and I love them exceedingly.

168.verse: I have kept Thy pikkudim and Thy edot; for all my ways are before Thee. TAV

169.verse: Let my cry come near before Thee, Hashem; give me understanding according to Thy Davar.

170.verse: Let my techinnah come before Thee; deliver me according to Thy word.

171.verse: My lips shall utter tehillah, when Thou hast taught me Thy chukkot.

172.verse: My leshon shall speak of Thy word; for all Thy mitzvot are tzedek.

173.verse: Let Thine Yad help me; for I have chosen Thy pikkudim.

174.verse: I have longed for Thy Yeshuah (salvation), Hashem; and Thy torah is my delight.

175.verse: Let my nefesh live, and it shall praise Thee; and let Thy mishpatim sustain me.

176.verse: I have gone astray like a seh oved (lost sheep); seek Thy eved; for I do not forget Thy mitzvot.

1.verse: (Shir HaMa’a- lot [Song of Ascents]) In my tzoros I cried unto Hashem, and He heard me.

2.verse: Save my nefesh, Hashem, from sefat sheker (lying lips), and from lashon remiyyah (a tongue of deceit).

3.verse: What shall be given unto thee? Or what shall be done unto thee, thou lashon remiyyah?

4.verse: Sharp khitzim (arrows) of the gibbor, with burning (charcoal) coals of the broom plant.

5.verse: Woe is me, that I sojourn in Meshech, that I dwell in the ohalim of Kedar!

6.verse: My nefesh hath long dwelt with him that hateth shalom.

7.verse: I am for shalom; but when I speak, they are for milchamah (war).

1.verse: (Shir HaMa’alot) I will lift up mine eyes unto the harim (hills), from whence cometh ezri (my help).

2.verse: Ezri (my help) cometh from Hashem, Oseh Shomayim v’Aretz.

3.verse: He will not allow thy regel to slip; He that is shomer over thee will not slumber.

4.verse: Hinei, He that is shomer over Yisroel shall neither slumber nor sleep.

5.verse: Hashem is the One shomer over thee; Hashem is thy shade upon thy right hand.

6.verse: The shemesh shall not strike thee by day, nor the yarei’ach by night.

7.verse: Hashem shall preserve thee from kol rah; He shall preserve thy nefesh.

8.verse: Hashem shall be shomer over thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth, and even v’ad olam.

1.verse: (Shir HaMa’alot, [Song of Ascents] of Dovid). I was glad when they said unto me, Let us go into the Bais Hashem.

2.verse: Our feet shall stand within thy she’arim, O Yerushalayim.

3.verse: Yerushalayim is built as an Ir bound firmly together;

4.verse: That is where the Shevatim (tribes) go up, the Shivtei Hashem, according to the edut l’Yisroel (the statute to Yisroel), to give thanks unto the Shem of Hashem.

5.verse: For there are set kise’ot l’mishpat (thrones of judgment), the kise’ot of the Bais Dovid.

6.verse: Sha’alu shalom Yerushalayim (pray for the peace of Jerusalem); they shall prosper that love thee.

7.verse: Shalom be within thy wall, and security within thy citadels.

8.verse: L’ma’an (for the sake of) my achim and companions, I will now say, Shalom be within thee.

9.verse: L’ma’an the Bais Hashem Eloheinu I will seek thy tov.

1.verse: (Shir HaMa’alot, [Song of Ascents]) Unto Thee lift I up mine eyes, O Thou that dwellest in Shomayim.

2.verse: Hinei, as the eyes of avadim look unto the yad adoneihem, and as the eyes of a shifchah (maiden) unto the yad of her gevirah; so our eyes wait upon Hashem Eloheinu, until He have channun (favor, grace) upon us.

3.verse: Channenu Hashem, channenu; for we are more than sated with buz (contempt).

4.verse: Nafsheinu (our nefesh) is more than sated with the scorn of those that are at ease, and with the buz (contempt) of the g’eiyonim (proud ones, arrogant ones).

1.verse: (Shir HaMa’alot, [Song of Ascents] of Dovid). If it had not been Hashem Who was lanu (for us, on our side), now may Yisroel say;

2.verse: If it had not been Hashem Who was lanu, when adam (man) rose up against us;

3.verse: Then they had swallowed us up chayyim (alive); when their wrath was kindled against us;

4.verse: Then the mayim would have overwhelmed us, the torrent would have swept over nafsheinu (our nefesh); (Shir HaMa’alot, [Song of

5.verse: Then the mayim hazedonim (treacherous waters) would have swept over nafsheinu (our nefesh).

6.verse: Baruch Hashem, Who hath not given us up as a prey to their shinayim (teeth).

7.verse: Nafsheinu (our nefesh) is escaped as a tzippor (bird) out of the pach (snare of the fowlers); the pach is broken, and we are escaped.

8.verse: Ezreinu (our help) B’Shem Hashem Oseh Shomayim vaAretz.

1.verse: Ascents]). They that trust in Hashem shall be as Mt Tziyon, which is immoveable, and abideth l’olam.

2.verse: As harim (the mountains) surround Yerushalayim, so Hashem surrounds His people from henceforth v’ad olam (and to forever).

3.verse: For the shevet (scepter) of the resha shall not rest upon the goral (allotment, property) of the tzaddikim; lest the tzaddikim put forth their hands unto iniquity.

4.verse: Do good, Hashem, unto the tovim, and to them that are upright in their hearts.

5.verse: As for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways, Hashem shall turn them away with the workers of iniquity; but shalom shall be upon Yisroel.

1.verse: Ascents]) When Hashem brought the return of the captivity of Tziyon, we were like the cholemim (them that dream).

2.verse: Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and leshoneinu (our tongue) with rinnah (Shir HaMa’alot, [Song of (joyful song); then said they among the Goyim, Hashem hath done great things for them.

3.verse: Hashem hath done great things for us; whereof we are glad.

4.verse: Return our captivity and restore our fortunes, Hashem, like torrents in the Negev.

5.verse: They that sow in dimah (tears) shall reap in rinnah (joyful song).

6.verse: He that goeth forth and weepeth, bearing meshek hazara (seed to be sown) shall doubtless come again with rinnah, bearing his alummot (sheaves [of harvest]).

1.verse: (Shir HaMa’alot, of Shlomo). Except Hashem build the bais, they that build it labor in vain; except Hashem is shomer over the city, the shomair (watchman) stands guard in vain.

2.verse: It is vain for you to rise up early, to sit up late, to eat the lechem ha’atzavim (bread of toils); for so He giveth his beloved sleep.

3.verse: Hinei, banim are nachalat Hashem; and the p’ri habeten is a zachar (reward).

4.verse: As khitzim (arrows) are in the yad of a gibbor; so are bnei haneurim (children born in one’s youth).

5.verse: Ashrei hagever that hath his quiver full of them; they shall not be ashamed, but they shall speak with the oyevim basha’ar (enemy at the gate).

1.verse: (Shir HaMa’alot) Ashrei kol yerei (fearers of) Hashem; that walketh in His drakhim.

2.verse: For thou shalt eat the labor of thine hands; happy shalt thou be, and it shall be tov with thee.

3.verse: Thy isha shall be as a fruitful gefen inside thine bais; thy banim like olive shoots around thy shulchan.

4.verse: Hinei, thus shall the gever be blessed that feareth Hashem.

5.verse: Hashem shall bless thee out of Tziyon; and thou shalt see the tov of Yerushalayim all the days of thy life.

6.verse: Yea, thou shalt see thy bnei banim, and shalom upon Yisroel.

1.verse: (Shir HaMa’alot) Many a time have they afflicted me from my ne’ur, may Yisroel now say;

2.verse: Many a time have they afflicted me from my ne’ur (youth); yet they have not prevailed against me.

3.verse: The choreshim (plowers) plowed upon my back; they made long their furrows.

4.verse: Hashem is tzaddik; He hath cut asunder the cords of the resha’im.

5.verse: Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Tziyon [i.e, all anti-Semites].

6.verse: Let them be as the khatzir (grass) upon the housetops, which withereth before it groweth up;

7.verse: With it the kotzer (reaper) filleth not his yad; nor he that gathereth sheaves, his bosom.

8.verse: Neither do they which go by say, Birkat Hashem be upon you; we bless you b’Shem Hashem.

1.verse: (Shir HaMa’alot) Out of the depths have I cried unto Thee, Hashem.

2.verse: Adonoi, hear my voice; let Thine ears be attentive to the voice of my techinnot (supplications).

3.verse: If Thou, Hashem, shouldest record iniquities, Adonoi, who could stand?

4.verse: But there is selichah (forgiveness) with Thee; therefore, Thou art feared.

5.verse: I wait for Hashem, my nefesh doth wait, and in His Devar do I hope.

6.verse: My nefesh waiteth for Adonoi more than the shomrim that watch for the boker; I say, more than the shomrim that watch for the boker.

7.verse: Let Yisroel hope in Hashem; for with Hashem there is chesed, and with Him is plenteous pedut (redemption).

8.verse: And He shall redeem Yisroel from all his iniquities.

1.verse: (Shir HaMa’alot, of Dovid). Hashem, my lev is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty; neither do I exercise myself in gedolot, or in things too high for me.

2.verse: Surely I have stilled and quieted my nefesh, as a child that is weaned of immo; my nefesh is even as a weaned child.

3.verse: Let Yisroel hope in Hashem from henceforth and ad olam.

1.verse: (Shir HaMa’alot) Hashem, remember Dovid, and all his afflictions;

2.verse: How he swore unto Hashem, and vowed unto Avir Ya’akov (the Mighty One of Ya’akov);

3.verse: Surely I will not come into the ohel of my bais, nor go up into my bed;

4.verse: I will not give sleep to mine eyes, nor tenumah (slumber) to mine eyelids,

5.verse: Until I find a makom (place) for Hashem, even mishkanot for the Avir Ya’akov.

6.verse: Hinei, we heard of it at Ephratah; we found it in the sedei Ya’ar (fields of Ya’ar).

7.verse: We will go into His mishkanot; we will worship at the hadom (footstool) of His raglayim.

8.verse: Arise, Hashem, into Thy menuchah (resting place); Thou, and the Aron of Thy oz (might).

9.verse: Let Thy Kohanim be clothed with tzedek; and let Thy chasidim sing for joy.

10.verse: For the sake of Dovid Thy Eved, do not turn away the face of Thine Moshiach [see Isa 52:13; 53:11].

11.verse: Hashem hath sworn in emes unto Dovid; He will not turn from His oath: Of the p’ri (fruit) of thy beten (body) will I set upon thy kisse (throne).

12.verse: If thy Banim are shomer over My Brit and My Edot that I shall teach them, their Banim shall also sit upon thy kisse adei-ad (forevermore).

13.verse: For Hashem hath chosen Tziyon; He hath desired her for His moshav.

14.verse: This is My menuchah (resting place) adei-ad (forever); here will I dwell; for I have desired her.

15.verse: I will place a bountiful brocha on her provision; I will satisfy her poor with lechem.

16.verse: I will also clothe her Kohanim with Yesha (salvation); and her chasidim shall sing aloud for joy.

17.verse: There atzmi’ach (I will make sprout i.e., Tzemach) the Keren of Dovid; I have ordained a ner (lamp) for My Moshiach.

18.verse: His oyevim will I clothe with boshet (shame); but upon him [Moshiach] shall his nezer (crown) be resplendent.

1.verse: (Shir HaMa’alot, of Dovid). Hinei, mah tov umah na’im shevet achim gahm yachad (how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity)!

2.verse: It is like the precious shemen upon the rosh, that ran down upon the beard, even Aharon’s beard; that went down to the collar of his robes;

3.verse: As the tal of Chermon, and as the dew that descended upon the mountains of Tziyon; for there Hashem commanded the brocha, even Chayyim Ad Olam.

1.verse: (Shir HaMa’alot) Hinei, barakhu Hashem, kol avedei Hashem, which balailah stand [ministering] in the Bais Hashem.

2.verse: Lift up your hands in the Kodesh [Beis Hamikdash], and barakhu Hashem.

3.verse: Yevarekhecha Adonoi from Tziyon, Oseh Shomayim v’Aretz (the Maker of Heaven and Earth).

1.verse: Praise Hashem. Halelu Shem Hashem; Halelu, O ye avadim of Hashem.

2.verse: Ye that stand ministering in the Beis Hashem, in the khatzerot Beis Eloheinu.

3.verse: Praise Hashem; for Hashem is tov; sing praise unto Shmo; for it is na’im (lovely, pleasing).

4.verse: For Hashem hath chosen Ya’akov unto Himself, and Yisroel for His segullah (peculiar treasure).

5.verse: For I know that Hashem is gadol, and that Adoneinu is above kol elohim.

6.verse: Whatsoever Hashem pleases, that He does in Shomayim, and in HaAretz, in HaYam, and kol tehomot.

7.verse: He causeth the clouds to ascend at the end of HaAretz; He maketh lightning for the matar (rain); He bringeth the ruach out of His otzarot.

8.verse: Who struck down the Bechorei Mitzrayim, both of adam and behemah.

9.verse: Who sent otot and mofetim into the midst of thee, O Mitzrayim, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his avadim.

10.verse: Who struck down Goyim rabbim, and slaughtered melachim atzumim (powerful kings);

11.verse: Sichon Melech HaEmori, and Og Melech HaBashan, and all the mamlechot Kena’an;

12.verse: And gave their land for a nachalah, an inheritance unto Yisroel Amo (His people).

13.verse: Thy Shem, Hashem, endureth l’olam; and Thy remembrance, Hashem, l’dor vador.

14.verse: For Hashem will vindicate His people; He will have compassion on His avadim.

15.verse: The idols of the Goyim are kesef and zahav, the ma’aseh yedei adam.

16.verse: They have mouths, but they speak not; einayim have they, but they see not;

17.verse: They have oznayim, but they hear not; neither is there any ruach in their mouths.

18.verse: They that oseihem (make them) will be like them; so is every one that trusteth in them.

19.verse: Barakhu Hashem, O Bais Yisroel; barakhu Hashem, O Bais Aharon;

20.verse: Barakhu Hashem, O Bais HaLevi; ye that fear Hashem, barakhu Hashem.

21.verse: Baruch Hashem out of Tziyon, which dwelleth at Yerushalayim. Praise Hashem.

1.verse: O give thanks unto Hashem; for He is tov; ki l’olam chasdo (His chesed indures forever).

2.verse: O give thanks unto Elohei HaElohim; ki l’olam chasdo.

3.verse: O give thanks to Adonei HaAdonim; ki l’olam chasdo.

4.verse: To Him Who alone doeth nifla’ot gedolot; ki l’olam chasdo.

5.verse: To Him that by tevunah (understanding) made HaShomayim; ki l’olam chasdo.

6.verse: To Him that stretched out ha’aretz above the mayim; ki l’olam chasdo.

7.verse: To Him that made ohrim gedolim (great lights); ki l’olam chasdo.

8.verse: The shemesh to rule by yom; ki l’olam chasdo.

9.verse: The yarei’ach and kokhavim to rule by lailah; ki l’olam chasdo.

10.verse: To Him that struck down Mitzrayim in their bechorot (firstborn); ki l’olam chasdo.

11.verse: And brought out Yisroel from among them; ki l’olam chasdo.

12.verse: With a yad chazakah, and with a stretched out zero’a; ki l’olam chasdo.

13.verse: To Him Who divided asunder Yam Suf; ki l’olam chasdo.

14.verse: And made Yisroel to pass through the midst of it; ki l’olam chasdo.

15.verse: But overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Yam Suf; ki l’olam chasdo.

16.verse: To Him Who led His people through the midbar; ki l’olam chasdo.

17.verse: To Him Who struck down melachim gedolim; ki l’olam chasdo.

18.verse: And slaughtered mighty melachim; ki l’olam chasdo.

19.verse: Sichon Melech HaEmori; ki l’olam chasdo.

20.verse: And Og Melech HaBashan; ki l’olam chasdo.

21.verse: And gave their land for a nachalah; ki l’olam chasdo.

22.verse: Even a nachalah unto Yisroel His eved; ki l’olam chasdo.

23.verse: Who remembered us in our low estate; ki l’olam chasdo.

24.verse: And hath released us from our enemies; ki l’olam chasdo.

25.verse: Who giveth lechem to kol basar; ki l’olam chasdo.

26.verse: O give thanks unto the G-d of Shomayim; ki l’olam chasdo.

1.verse: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yes, we wept, when we remembered Tziyon.

2.verse: We hung up our kinnorot (lyres) upon the willows in the midst thereof.

3.verse: For there they that carried us away captive required of us a shir (song); and they that tormented us required of us simchah, saying, Sing us one of the Shir Tziyon.

4.verse: How shall we sing Shir Hashem in an admat nekhar (foreign land).

5.verse: If I forget thee, O Yerushalayim, let my yamin (right hand) forget [i.e., have paralysis].

6.verse: If I do not remember thee, let my leshon cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Yerushalayim above my rosh simchah (chief joy).

7.verse: Remember, Hashem, the Bnei Edom in the Yom Yerushalayim; who said, Raze it, raze it, even to the yesod (foundation) thereof.

8.verse: O Bat Bavel, who art to be destroyed, ashrei shall he be, that repayeth thee the gemul thou hast done to us.

9.verse: Ashrei shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy olalim against the sela.

1.verse: (Of Dovid) I will thank Thee with my whole lev; before the elohim will I sing praise unto Thee.

2.verse: I will worship toward Thy Heikhal Kodesh, and praise Shmecha (Thy Name) for Thy chesed and for Thy emes; for Thou hast magnified Thy Word above Kol Shimcha (all Thy Name; Yn 1:1, 14 OJBC).

3.verse: In the day when I called out, Thou answeredst me, and madest me bold with oz (strength) in my nefesh.

4.verse: Kol Malchei Aretz shall praise Thee, Hashem, when they hear the words of Thy mouth.

5.verse: Yes, they shall sing of the Darkhei Hashem; for gadol is the Kavod Hashem.

6.verse: Though Hashem be on high, yet He looks upon the lowly; but the proud He knoweth from afar.

7.verse: Though I walk in the midst of tzoros, Thou wilt preserve me alive; Thou shalt stretch forth Thine yad against the wrath of mine enemies, and Thy Yamin (Right Hand) shall save me.

8.verse: Hashem will fulfill that which concerneth me; Thy chesed, O Hashem, endureth l’olam; forsake not the works of Thine own yadayim.

1.verse: (For the one directing, Mizmor of Dovid). Hashem, Thou hast searched me, and known me.

2.verse: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, Thou hast binah of my thought from afar off.

3.verse: Thou comprehendeth my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my drakhim.

4.verse: For there is not a milah (word) in my leshon, but, lo, Hashem, Thou knowest it altogether.

5.verse: Thou hast enclosed me achor (behind) and kedem (before), and laid Thine hand upon me.

6.verse: Such da’as is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.

7.verse: To where can I go from Thy Ruach [Hakodesh]? Or to where shall I flee from Thy presence?

8.verse: If I ascend up into Shomayim, Thou art there; if I make my bed in Sheol, hinei, Thou art there.

9.verse: If I take the wings of the shachar (dawn), and dwell in the uttermost acharit yam (the extreme end of the sea);

10.verse: Even there shall Thy yad lead me, and Thy yamin shall hold me.

11.verse: If I say, Surely the choshech shall cover me, even the lailah shall be ohr about me.

12.verse: Even the choshech is not dark to Thee; but the lailah shineth as the yom; the choshech and the ohr are both alike to Thee.

13.verse: For Thou hast created my inmost being; Thou didst interweave me in the beten immi.

14.verse: I will praise Thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made; marvellous are Thy ma’asim; and that my nefesh knoweth very well.

15.verse: My atzamim (bones, frame) were not hid from Thee, when I was made beseter (in secret), and skillfully wrought in the depths of the Eretz.

16.verse: Thine eyes did see my golem (embryo), yet being unformed; and in Thy Sefer (Book) all the yamim (days) ordained for me were written down, when as yet there were none of them.

17.verse: How precious also are Thy thoughts unto me, O El! How great is the sum of them!

18.verse: If I should count them, they are more in number than the chol (sand); when I awake, I am still with Thee.

19.verse: Surely Thou wilt slay the rasha, O Eloah; depart from me therefore, ye anshei damim (bloodthirsty men).

20.verse: For they speak of Thee craftily, and it is taken lashav [Ex 20:7] by Thy enemies.

21.verse: Should not I hate them, Hashem, that hate Thee? And am not I to be at odds with those that rise up against Thee?

22.verse: I abhor them with complete sinah; I count them mine enemies.

23.verse: Search me, O El, and know my levav; test me, and know my thoughts;

24.verse: And see if there be any derech otzev (torturous crooked road) in me, and lead me in the Derech Olam.

1.verse: (For the one directing. Mizmor of Dovid). Deliver me, Hashem, from adam rah; preserve me from ish chamasim (violent men);

2.verse: Which plan ra’ot (evils) in their lev; kol yom they incite milchamot (wars).

3.verse: They have sharpened their leshonot like a nachash; the venom of a spider is under their sfatayim (lips). Selah.

4.verse: Be shomer over me, Hashem, and keep me from the hands of the rashah; protect me from ish chamasim, whose scheme is to cause my steps to trip.

5.verse: The ge’im (proud, arrogant ones [of inordinate ambition]) have hid a pach for me, and chavalim (cords, ropes); they have spread a reshet (net) close by the path; they have set mokshim (traps) for me. Selah.

6.verse: I said unto Hashem, Thou art Eli; hear the kol tachanunai (voice of my supplications), Hashem.

7.verse: Hashem Adonoi, Oz Yeshuati (strength of my (salvation), Thou hast covered my rosh in the Yom Neshek (Day of Arms, Day of Battle).

8.verse: Grant not, Hashem, the desires of the rashah; let not his plot succeed; lest they exalt themselves. Selah.

9.verse: As for the rosh of those that surround me, let the amal (trouble) of their own sfatayim (lips) cover them.

10.verse: Let burning coals fall upon them; let them be cast into the eish; into mahamorot (watery pits), that they rise not up again.

11.verse: Let not an ish lashon (idle talker, slanderer) be established in ha’aretz; rah shall hunt down the ish chamas to overthrow him.

12.verse: I know that Hashem will maintain the din oni (cause of the poor), and the mishpat evyonim (the right of the needy).

13.verse: Surely the tzaddikim shall give thanks unto Thy Shem; the upright shall dwell in Thy presence.

1.verse: (Mizmor of Dovid) Hashem, I cry unto Thee; make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto Thee.

2.verse: Let my tefillah be set forth before Thee like ketoret; and the lifting up of my hands as the minchat erev.

3.verse: Be shomer, Hashem, over my mouth; guard the door of my lips.

4.verse: Let not my lev incline to any evil thing, to practice wicked works with men that work iniquity; and let me not eat of their dainties.

5.verse: Let the tzaddik strike me; it shall be chesed; and let him reprove me; it shall be shemen, which my rosh shall not refuse; for still shall my tefillah be against their evil deeds.

6.verse: Their shofetim are overthrown in stony places; they hear my words; for they are pleasant.

7.verse: Atzameinu (our bones) are scattered at the mouth of Sheol, as when one cutteth and cleaveth wood upon ha’aretz.

8.verse: But mine eyes are unto Thee, Hashem Adonoi; in Thee do I take refuge; leave not my nefesh defenseless.

9.verse: Keep me from the pach (snare, trap) which they have laid for me, and the traps of the workers of iniquity.

10.verse: Let the resha’im fall into their own nets, while I escape safely.

1.verse: (Mashkil of Dovid; A tefillah when he was in the me’arah) I cried out unto Hashem with my voice; with my voice unto Hashem did I make my techinnah (supplication).

2.verse: I poured out my complaint before Him; I showed before Him my tzoros.

3.verse: When my ruach became faint within me, then Thou had da’as of my path. In the way wherein I walked have they laid a pach (snare, hidden trap) for me.

4.verse: I looked on my right, and behold, there was no man that would know me; refuge failed me; no man cared for my nefesh.

5.verse: I cried unto Thee, Hashem; I said, Thou art my refuge and my chelek (portion) in the Eretz HaChayyim.

6.verse: Attend unto my cry; for I am brought very low; save me from my persecutors; for they are stronger than I.

7.verse: Release my nefesh from prison, to praise Shemecha (Thy Name); the tzaddikim shall gather about me; for Thou shalt deal bountifully with me.

1.verse: (Mizmor of Dovid) Hear my tefillah, Hashem, give ear to my techinot (supplications); in Thy emunah answer me, and in Thy tzedakah.

2.verse: And enter not into mishpat with Thy eved; for in Thy sight shall no man living be yitzadak (justified).

3.verse: For the oyev (enemy) hath persecuted my nefesh; he hath struck down my life to the ground; he hath made me to dwell in places of choshech (darkness), like metei olam (those long dead).

4.verse: Therefore is my ruach become faint within me; my lev within me is desolate.

5.verse: I remember yamim mikedem (days of old), I meditate on all Thy works; I muse on the ma’aseh (work) of Thy hands.

6.verse: I stretch forth my hands unto Thee; my nefesh thirsteth after Thee, like an eretz ayefah (a parched, thirsty land). Selah.

7.verse: Hear me speedily, Hashem; my ruach faileth; hide not Thy face from me, lest I be like those that go down into the bor (pit).

8.verse: Cause me to hear Thy chesed in the boker; for in Thee do I trust; cause me to know the Derech wherein I should walk; for I lift up my nefesh unto Thee.

9.verse: Save me, Hashem, from mine oyevim (enemies); I flee unto Thee to hide me.

10.verse: Teach me to do Retzonecha (Thy will); for Thou art Elohai; may Thy Ruach Tov lead me on level ground.

11.verse: Revive me, Hashem, l’ma’an (for the sake of) Thy Shem (Name); in Thy tzedakah bring my nefesh out of tzoros.

12.verse: And in Thy chesed silence mine enemies, and destroy all them that oppress my nefesh; for I am Thy eved.

1.verse: (Mizmor of Dovid). Baruch Hashem my Tzur (rock) which teacheth my hands for war, and my fingers for milchamah (battle);

2.verse: My Chesed, and my Metzudah (Fortress); my Stronghold, and my Deliverer; my Mogen, and He in Whom I take refuge; Who subdueth my people under me.

3.verse: Hashem, what is adam, that Thou takest knowledge of him! Or the ben enosh, that Thou takest account of him!

4.verse: Adam is like hevel; his days are as a tzel that passeth away.

5.verse: Part Thy heavens, Hashem, and come down; touch the harim, and they shall smoke.

6.verse: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them; shoot Thine khitzim (arrows), and destroy them.

7.verse: Send Thine Yad from above; rescue me, and deliver me out of mayim rabbim, from the yad Bnei Nekhar;

8.verse: Whose mouth speaketh shav (lies), and their right hand is a right hand of sheker.

9.verse: I will sing a shir chadash unto Thee, O Elohim; upon a nevel of ten strings will I make music unto Thee.

10.verse: It is He that giveth Teshu’ah (deliverance, salvation) unto melachim; Who delivereth Dovid His eved from the cherev ra’ah.

11.verse: Rescue me, and save me from the yad Bnei Nekhar, whose mouth speaketh shav (lies) and their right hand is a right yad of sheker;

12.verse: In their youth, may baneinu (our sons) be like plants full grown; may benoteinu (our daughters) be like cornerstones, columns wrought for the Heikhal;

13.verse: That our barns may be full, affording all manner of provision; that our tzon may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our meadows;

14.verse: That our oxen may be strong to labor; that there be no peretz (breach) nor golus; that there be no cry of anquish in our streets.

15.verse: Ashrei are such people; Ashrei is the people that Hashem is Elohav.

1.verse: (Tehillah of Dovid). [Alef} I will extol Thee, Elohai HaMelech; and I will bless Thy Shem l’olam va’ed .

2.verse: [Beis] Kol yom will I bless Thee; and I will praise Thy Shem l’olam va’ed.

3.verse: [Gimel] Gadol is Hashem, and me’od to be praised; and His greatness is not cheker (searchable).

4.verse: [Dalet] Dor l’dor (generation to generation) shall praise Thy ma’asim, and shall declare Thy gevurot (mighty acts).

5.verse: [Heh] I will speak of the hadar kavod of Thy hod, and of Thy nifle’ot (wonderful works).

6.verse: [Vav] And men shall speak of the power of Thy norot; and I will declare Thy greatness.

7.verse: [Zayin] They shall utter the zekher (memory, recollection) of Thy rav tov and shall sing of Thy tzedakah.

8.verse: [Chet] Channun (gracious) is Hashem, and full of compassion; erech apayim (slow to anger), and of great chesed.

9.verse: [Tet] Tov is Hashem to all; and His rachamim is over all His ma’asim.

10.verse: [Yod] All Thy ma’asim shall praise Thee, Hashem; and Thy chasidim shall bless Thee.

11.verse: [Khaf] They shall speak of the kavod of Thy Malchus, and tell of Thy gevurah;

12.verse: [Lamed] To make known to the Bnei HaAdam His gevurah, and the kavod hadar of His Malchus.

13.verse: [Mem] Thy Malchus is a Malchus kol olamim, and Thy Memshelet for kol dor vador.

14.verse: [Samekh] Hashem upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all those that are bowed down.

15.verse: [Ayin] The eyes of all look to Thee; and Thou givest them their okhel (food) in its season.

16.verse: [Peh] Thou openest Thine Yad, and satisfiest the ratzon of kol chai.

17.verse: [Tzadi] Tzaddik is Hashem in all His drakhim, and chasid in all His ma’asim,

18.verse: [Koph] Karov (near) is Hashem unto all them that call upon Him, to all that call upon Him in emes.

19.verse: [Resh] He will fulfil the ratzon of them that fear Him; He also will hear their cry, and will save them.

20.verse: [Shin] Shomer is Hashem over all them that love Him; but kol haresha’im will He destroy.

21.verse: [Tav] My mouth shall speak the tehillat Hashem; and let kol basar bless His Shem Kodesh l’olam va’ed. [T.N. See Messianic Psalms which include Ps 2, 22, 45, 72, 110, 47, 93, 96-99, 89 and which indicate Moshiach’s righteous character, experience, ideals, call, and reign.]

1.verse: Praise Hashem. Praise Hashem, O my nefesh.

2.verse: While I live will I praise Hashem: I will sing praise unto Elohai while I have any being.

3.verse: Put not your trust in princes, nor in the ben adam, in whom there is no teshuah (salvation).

4.verse: His ruach departs, he returneth to his adamah; in yom hahu his plans come to nothing.

5.verse: Ashrei is he that hath El Ya’akov for his ezer, whose hope is in Hashem Elohav:

6.verse: Oseh Shomayim vaAretz, the yam, and all that therein is: HaShomer Emes l’olam (Who keepeth Truth forever):

7.verse: Oseh mishpat for the oppressed; Who giveth lechem to the hungry. Hashem mattir asurim (sets free the prisoners):

8.verse: Hashem openeth the eyes of the ivrim: Hashem raiseth them that are bowed down: Hashem loveth the tzaddikim:

9.verse: Hashem shomer over the gerim; He relieveth the yatom (fatherless, orphan) and almanah; but the Derech Resha’im He frustrates.

10.verse: Hashem shall reign l’olam, even thy G-d, O Tziyon, l’dor vador. Praise Hashem.

1.verse: Praise ye Hashem: for it is tov to sing praises unto Eloheinu; for it is na’im (pleasant); and tehillah is fitting.

2.verse: Hashem is the Boneh Yerushalayim (builder of Jerusalem): He gathereth together the nidkhei Yisroel (the outcasts Of Israel, those of the Golus).

3.verse: He is the Rofeh (healer) of the Shevurei-lev (broken in heart), binds up their wounds.

4.verse: He determines the mispar of the kokhavim; He calleth them all by their shemot.

5.verse: Gadol is Adoneinu, and of rav ko’ach; to His tevunah (understanding, intelligence) there is no mispar (number, limit).

6.verse: Hashem lifteth up the anavim (meek ones, humble ones); He casteth the resha’im down to the ground.

7.verse: Sing unto Hashem with todah; make music upon the kinnor (harp) unto Eloheinu:

8.verse: Who covereth Shomayim with clouds, Who prepareth matar (rainfall) for ha’aretz, HaMatzemi’ach (Who maketh to spring up) the khatzir (grass) upon the harim (hills, mountains).

9.verse: He giveth to the behemah her lechem, and to the bnei orev (young ravens) when they cry out.

10.verse: He delighteth not in the gevurat hasus: He taketh not pleasure in the shokayim of an ish (legs of a man).

11.verse: Hashem taketh pleasure in them that fear Him, in those that hope in His chesed.

12.verse: Praise Hashem, O Yerushalayim; praise thy G-d, O Tziyon.

13.verse: For He hath strengthened the bars of thy she’arim (gates); He hath blessed thy banim within thee.

14.verse: He granteth shalom within thy borders, and filleth thee with the chelev chittim (the finest of wheat).

15.verse: He sendeth forth His imrah (command) upon eretz: His Devar runneth swiftly.

16.verse: He giveth sheleg (snow) like tzemer (wool); He scattereth the kfor (frost) like ashes.

17.verse: He casteth down His kerach (ice) like crumbs: who can stand before His cold?

18.verse: He sendeth out His Devar, and melteth them: He causeth His ruach to blow, and the mayim to flow.

19.verse: He declareth His Devar unto Ya’akov, His chukkot and His mishpatim unto Yisroel.

20.verse: He hath not dealt so with any Goy (nation): and as for His mishpatim, they have not known them. Praise ye Hashem.

1.verse: Praise Hashem. Praise Hashem from HaShomayim: praise Him in the heights above.

2.verse: Praise ye Him, all His malachim: praise ye Him, all Tzivos Hashem.

3.verse: Praise ye Him, shemesh and yarei’ach: praise Him, all ye kokhavim of ohr.

4.verse: Praise Him, ye heavens of heavens, and ye waters that be above HaShomayim.

5.verse: Let them praise the Shem of Hashem: for He commanded, and they were created.

6.verse: He hath also established them forever and ever: He hath made a Chok (decree) which shall not pass away.

7.verse: Hallelu Hashem from ha’aretz, ye sea creatures, and all tehomot:

8.verse: Eish, and barad; snow, and cloud; stormy wind fulfilling His Devar:

9.verse: Mountains, and all hills; etz pri (fruitful trees), and all cedars:

10.verse: Beasts, and all cattle; remesh (creeping things), and flying fowl:

11.verse: Malchei eretz, and all people; sarim (princes), and all shoftei aretz:

12.verse: Both bochurim, and betulot; zekenim, and ne’arim:

13.verse: Let them praise the Shem of Hashem: for Shmo alone is excellent; His hod is above Eretz and Shomayim.

14.verse: He also exalteth the keren of His people, tehillah (the praise) of all His Chasidim; even of the Bnei Yisroel, an Am (people) close unto Him. Hallelu Hashem.

1.verse: Praise Hashem. Shiru l’Adonoi shir chadash (Sing unto Hashem a new song), and His praise in the Kahal Chasidim.

2.verse: Let Yisroel rejoice in Him that made him; let the Bnei Tziyon be glad in their Melech.

3.verse: Let them praise Shmo in the dance; let them sing zemirot unto Him with the tambourine and kinnor.

4.verse: For Hashem taketh pleasure in His people; He will crown the meek with Yeshuah (salvation).

5.verse: Let the Chasidim be joyful in kavod; let them sing for joy upon their beds.

6.verse: Let the high praises of G-d be in their mouth, and a two-edged sword in their hand;

7.verse: To execute vengeance upon the Goyim, and punishments upon the people;

8.verse: To bind their melachim with chains, and their nobles with shackles of barzel (iron);

9.verse: To execute upon them the mishpat katuv (written judgment); this honor have all His Chasidim. Hallelu Hashem.

1.verse: Praise Hashem. Hallelu El (Praise G-d) in His Kodesh [Beis Hamikdash]; Hallelu Him in the raki’a [see Bereshis 1:6] of His might.

2.verse: Hallelu Him for His gevurot (mighty acts); hallelu Him according to His surpassing greatness.

3.verse: Hallelu Him with the sound of the shofar; hallelu Him with the nevel (harp) and kinnor (lyre).

4.verse: Hallelu Him with the tambourine and dance; hallelu Him with stringed instruments and flute.

5.verse: Hallelu Him upon the clashing cymbals; hallelu Him upon the resounding cymbals.

6.verse: Let every thing that hath neshamah praise Hashem. Praise Hashem!
